title: Calculating CorporateCompliance& The Foreign Corrupt Practices Act
abstract: Technology is rapidly disrupting every industry and institution around the globe. Yet, corporate compliance has remained relatively unaffected by technological change when compared to other industries. If firms continue to lag behind in their compliance efforts, their risk exposure to the potentially lethal sanctions associated with major compliance failures will continue to increase with time. This is particularly true in the context of the Foreign Corrupt Practices Act (“FCPA”). Generally, the FCPA is a regulatory statute that forbids bribery and false accounting for domestic firms doing business abroad. And, in the past decade the DOJ and SEC have begun aggressively enforcing the FCPA. Firms should begin using technology to develop more robust and cost-efficient compliance programs in order to insulate themselves from the FCPA’s harsh penalties.This paper provides an algorithm that allows firms to evaluate and improve their compliance programs in accordance with several published sources of guidance. Compliance scholars have made clear that it is critical for firms to maintain strong corporate compliance programs and have suggested different models and frameworks for internal evaluation and auditing. However, those suggestions fail to consider how technology may be used to improve the cost-efficiency of corporate compliance & ethics programs. This paper takes an informatics based approach to evaluating and improving firm compliance by focusing on the most important compliance functions according to the DOJ, courts, and other Government actors. Indeed, firms may drastically improve the cost-efficiency of their compliance efforts by adopting the analytical framework proposed in this paper.
ch_abstract: 技术正在迅速颠覆全球各行业和机构。然而，与其他行业相比，企业合规领域受技术变革的影响相对较小。如果企业在合规工作上持续滞后，随着时间推移，其因重大合规失误而面临致命制裁的风险敞口将不断扩大。这一现象在《反海外腐败法》（FCPA）背景下尤为显著。该法案作为监管法规，主要禁止在海外经营的国内企业实施贿赂和虚假会计行为。过去十年间，美国司法部（DOJ）和证券交易委员会（SEC）已开始强势执行该法案。企业应运用技术手段建立更强大且更具成本效益的合规计划，以规避FCPA的严厉处罚。本文提出一种算法，帮助企业依据多项公开指导文件评估和改进合规计划。合规研究学者明确指出，保持强有力的企业合规计划至关重要，并为内部评估与审计提出了多种模型框架。但这些建议均未考量如何利用技术提升企业合规与道德计划的成本效益。本文采用信息学方法，根据DOJ、法院及其他政府机构强调的核心合规职能，构建企业合规评估与改进体系。实践证明，采用本文提出的分析框架可显著提升企业合规工作的成本效益。
tags: Technology, law, compliance, government contracts, legal informatics, FCPA, international

title: Business Strategy and AntitrustCompliance
abstract: Business strategy focuses on finding ways for a firm to approach the “monopoly profit,” while competition law is about trying to stop firms from doing this. Building on this tension, classic strategic management theory may at times lead companies to select strategies that raise antitrust risks. Focusing on three particular areas – influencing the competitor environment, cross subsidisation and defensive strategy – showcases a selection of potentially problematic strategies from the “classic” toolkit. Ultimately, boards, managers, and audit committees involved with strategy may benefit from focused compliance support to better identify the parts of the strategy toolkit that are higher risk than others, as well as the differences in risk by jurisdiction. The ultimate objective is to ensure companies’ strategies are both effective and legally defendable without holding back legitimate actions for corporate profit.
ch_abstract: 商业战略的核心在于为企业寻求接近“垄断利润”的途径，而竞争法则旨在阻止企业实现这一目标。基于这种矛盾关系，经典战略管理理论有时会引导企业选择可能增加反垄断风险的策略。通过聚焦三个特定领域——影响竞争环境、交叉补贴及防御性战略——可以揭示“经典”战略工具包中一系列潜在问题策略。最终，参与战略制定的董事会、管理层及审计委员会若能获得针对性合规支持，将有助于更精准识别战略工具包中风险较高的部分，以及不同司法管辖区的风险差异。根本目标是确保企业战略既高效又具备法律可辩护性，同时不阻碍企业为获取正当利润采取的合法行动。
tags: compliance, antitrust, strategy

title: Delivering Shareholder Value Through Mergers and Acquisitions: How theComplianceFunction Needs to Work with Boards and Executives to Improve Transaction Results
abstract: Significant literature has pointed to acquisition transactions as frequently being losing events for the shareholders of acquiring companies due to value destruction. This research article explores the attitudes and priorities of directors during this process and aims to highlight some important cues for the corporate compliance function to consider in how they can assist the Board of a listed company in planning and implementing merger and acquisition activity. The article argues that the corporate compliance function can and should be intimately involved in transaction processes, before and after the event, to provide extra scrutiny and an independent set of eyes and ears to assist Boards with their stewardship. This article draws on recent research conducted by the author as part of a PhD investigating Board governance of major transactions with the research focus being “What Boards Ought to do to Secure Value when Merging or Acquiring Companies”. The research conducted was qualitative in nature and is based on semi-structured interviews. Interviews canvassed the views and experience of a range of seasoned Chairmen and non executive directors on a cross-section of Boards, primarily for listed public companies. The author was then able to combine the insights provided by this research with his own advisory experience in mergers and acquisitions to draw conclusions in regard to the value-adding role that compliance can play in the M&A process: starting from strategic planning and going well beyond the execution phase.
ch_abstract: 大量文献指出，收购交易常因价值破坏导致收购方股东蒙受损失。本研究探讨了董事在此过程中的态度与优先事项，旨在为上市公司合规职能提供重要指引，协助董事会在并购活动的规划与实施中发挥作用。文章主张合规职能能够且应当深度参与交易全流程——从交易前到交易后——通过额外审查及独立视角协助董事会履行管理职责。本文基于作者博士研究课题"董事会应如何通过并购实现价值保障"的近期成果，该定性研究采用半结构化访谈法，汇集了多位上市公司资深董事长与非执行董事的多元观点与实践经验。作者结合研究洞见与自身并购咨询经验，论证了合规职能在并购全流程中的增值作用：从战略规划阶段延伸至执行阶段之后。
tags: Compliance Funcation, M&A, Boards, Governance

title: VATComplianceIncentives
abstract: VAT compliance incentives are here studied through a game theoretical approach. Agents are explicitly assumed selfish and risk neutral. Compliance or evasion are a simple rational choice given tax parameters and the probability of audit. VAT evasion is a collusive conduct between the two counterparts of the transaction. While under no-audit the counterparts are generally keen to evade, even under a weak probability of audit they are both keen to comply. Therefore, they can form a coalition against the Tax Authority that is then forced to large and costly auditing. Under tax allowances to buyer specific invoiced expenses and no audit, this coalition breaks because the buyer prefers to comply and the seller to evade.In this work we compute the thresholds for tax policy parameters for the private coalition to be willing to comply as a determined trade-off versus auditing.The paper also enlighten the importance of the ratio costs/output values in the transaction. The larger the previous costs in a production chain, the smaller is the gain from VAT evasion. Therefore, for each fiscal parameter set, we can compute the threshold costs/output under which evasion is very likely and where therefore tax allowances can lead to compliance and, even if costly, they can lead to tax revenue increase.Although the policies are at work in some economies, we try to establish a method for tax design, able to make compliance the "dominant strategy", satisfying the "outside option" constraints against the various types of evasion, even in absence of audit and sanctions. The theoretical results derived here can be easily applied to real data.
ch_abstract: 本研究通过博弈论方法探讨增值税合规激励问题。在模型中，我们明确假设交易主体具有自私性且风险中性。根据税收参数与稽查概率，合规或逃税成为简单的理性选择。增值税逃税本质上是交易双方共谋行为：无稽查时双方普遍倾向于逃税，但即便面临微弱稽查概率，双方均会主动选择合规。因此交易双方可能形成对抗税务部门的联盟，迫使税务机关实施高成本的大规模稽查。当买方享有特定发票费用税收减免且无稽查时，该联盟将瓦解——此时买方倾向于合规而卖方倾向于逃税。本研究通过计算税收政策参数的临界值，揭示了私人联盟在稽查成本与合规收益间的权衡机制。研究还阐明了交易成本/产出价值比的关键作用：生产链前端成本越高，增值税逃税收益越小。因此针对任何财税参数组合，我们都能计算出逃税高发区的成本/产出临界值，证明税收减免既可引导合规，又能实现税收增长（即便存在政策成本）。尽管部分经济体已实施类似政策，我们试图建立一种能使合规成为"优势策略"的税制设计方法，在无稽查和制裁条件下，仍能满足对抗各类逃税行为的"外部选择"约束。本理论成果可便捷应用于实际数据分析。
tags: Tax evasion, Tax design, Tax compliance, Tax fraud, VAT, Audit, Tax incentives, Fiscal Policy, Public Economics, Public Finance, Tax Induced, Mixed strategies game, Bayesian game.

title: Introducción alComplianceen el Derecho Comparado. Segunda parte - II: Sistema contiental europeo. Italia (Introduction toCompliancein Comparative Law. Second Part - II: European Continental System -Civil Law- Italy)
abstract: Spanish Abstract: Este trabajo es la última sub-parte del estudio del Compliance en los sistemas jurídicos contemporáneos que busca presentar una serie de argumentos que sustenten la siguiente tesis: para que el funcionamiento real del compliance sea efectivo en la República Argentina hay que tomar referencia de su evolución material en los sistemas que impulsaron su recepción, para lo cual la Alonomologia es la disciplina adecuada.En virtud de ello concluimos en esta oportunidad un análisis del sistema continental europeo, tomando el instituto en el derecho italiano, analizando si el reparto proyectado del compliance alcanza a ser un reparto realizado -de la adjudicación debida- (dimensión sociológica) y efectivizado por las normas que lo captan (dimensión normológica) y finalmente, si su deber ser ideal pasó por el deber ser aplicado y se convirtió en deber ser concretado (dimensión dikelógica).English Abstract:This paper is the last sub-part of the study of compliance in contemporary legal systems that seeks to present a series of arguments that support the following thesis: for the real functioning of compliance to be effective in the Argentine Republic, reference must be made to its material evolution in the systems that promoted its reception, for which Alonomology is the appropriate discipline.By virtue of this we conclude on this occasion an analysis of the European continental system, taking the institute in the Italian law, analyzing if the projected distribution of compliance reaches to be a distribution made -of the due adjudication- (sociological dimension) and made effective by the rules that capture it (normative dimension) and finally, if its duty to be ideal passed by the duty to be applied and became a duty to be concretized (dikelogical dimension).
ch_abstract: 西班牙文摘要：本研究是当代法律体系中合规研究的最后一部分，旨在提出一系列论据支持以下论点：为使合规机制在阿根廷共和国真正有效运行，必须参考推动其接受的体系中合规的实际演变过程，而阿洛诺莫洛吉亚（Alonomologia）正是实现这一目标的恰当学科。基于此，我们此次完成了对欧洲大陆法系的分析，以意大利法律中的制度为例，探讨合规的预期分配是否实现了应有的分配（社会学维度），是否被相关规范有效落实（规范学维度），以及其理想应然是否经过应用应然阶段并转化为具体应然（正义论维度）。. . 英文摘要：本文是当代法律体系中合规研究的最后子部分，旨在提出支持以下论点的一系列论据：为了使合规在阿根廷共和国的实际运作有效，必须参考推动其接受的体系中合规的物质演变，为此阿洛诺莫洛吉亚是合适的学科。基于此，我们此次完成了对欧洲大陆法系的分析，以意大利法律中的制度为例，分析合规的预期分配是否达到了实际分配——应有的裁决（社会学维度），并被捕捉它的规则所实现（规范学维度），最后，其理想应然是否经历了应用应然并转化为具体应然（正义论维度）。
tags: compliance, criminal liability of legal entities, comparative law, Alonomology, italian law, responsabilidad penal de las personas jurídicas, derecho comparado, Alonomología, derecho italiano

title: Ethics andComplianceTraining
abstract: An essential component of ethics and compliance programs is the training of organizational members. Training helps ensure that all employees understand their legal and regulatory obligations, and company policies. There are significant legal incentives for organizations to adopt training but understanding when training is effective is challenging. After discussing the legal incentives, this chapter explores how effectiveness can be measured and reviews those factors that the academic literature has identified as potentially having a positive impact on training effectiveness.
ch_abstract: 道德与合规计划的一个关键组成部分是对组织成员的培训。培训有助于确保所有员工理解其法律和监管义务以及公司政策。虽然组织有充分的法律动因开展培训，但判断培训何时有效却颇具挑战性。在探讨法律动因后，本章研究了如何衡量培训效果，并梳理了学术文献中确认可能对培训效果产生积极影响的各项因素。
tags: Compliance Training, Ethics Training, Harassment Training, Compliance Programs, Sexual Harassment, Organizational Sentencing Guidelines

title: Complianceen el Derecho Comparado. Segunda parte: Bases culturales. Regulación en el sistema del Common Law. (Compliancein Comparative Law. Cultural Bases. Regulation in Common Law System)
abstract: Spanish Abstract:Este trabajo es la continuación del estudio del Compliance en el Derecho Comparado desde la Alonomología. En él se desarrollan las bases culturales en la que se desenvuelven los sistemas jurídicos occidentales y sus desafíos frente al derecho universal planetario que postula la globalización.Desde esa perspectiva se efectúa un análisis del sistema del common law, donde surgió el instituto objeto de este estudio, desde sus orígenes hasta sus desarrollos más actuales en Estados Unidos y la ley antisoborno del Reino Unido, para favorecer la reflexión crítica de sus postulados en vistas a asegurar el cumplimiento de los valores perseguidos por del instituto del Compliance en su implementación en la República Argentina.English Abstract:This paper is the continuation of the study of Compliance in Comparative Law from the perspective of Alonomology. It develops the cultural bases in which Occidental legal systems are developed and their challenges in front of the universal planetary law that globalization postulates.From this perspective, an analysis of the common law system is carried out, where the institute object of this study emerged, from its origins to its most recent developments in the United States and the anti-bribery act of the United Kingdom, in order to favour the critical reflection of its postulates with a view to ensuring the fulfilment of the values pursued by the institute of Compliance in its implementation in the Argentine Republic.
ch_abstract: 西班牙文摘要：本文是从异源学角度对比较法中合规研究的延续。文中探讨了西方法律体系所根植的文化基础及其在全球化所倡导的普世行星法面前面临的挑战。基于此视角，本文分析了普通法系——该研究对象发源地的发展历程，从其起源到美国最新发展及英国反贿赂法案，旨在促进对其原则的批判性思考，以确保合规制度在阿根廷共和国实施时能实现其所追求的价值。. . 英文摘要：本文是从异源学视角对比较法中合规研究的延续。文中阐述了西方法律体系发展的文化基础，以及这些体系在全球化所提出的普世行星法面前面临的挑战。基于此视角，本文对普通法系进行了分析——该研究对象即源于此体系，从其起源到美国的最新发展和英国反贿赂法案，旨在促进对其原则的批判性反思，以确保合规制度在阿根廷共和国实施时能实现其追求的价值。
tags: Compliance, Criminal Liability, Legal Persons, Comparative Law, Comparative Legal Systems, Alonomology, Responsabilidad Penal, Personas Jurídicas, Derecho Comparado, Sistemas Jurídicos Comparados, Alonomología

title: Determinants of IFRSCompliancein Africa: Analysis of Stakeholder Attributes
abstract: Purpose: This paper examines the drivers of companies’ compliance with IFRS using the stakeholder salience theory.Research Methods: We have used panel data from 205 companies to examine the IFRS compliance level across 13 African countries. Our study has also established the relationship between stakeholders’ attributes and firms’ compliance with IFRS.Findings: On IFRS compliance, we found that the average compliance score among the companies over the period was 73.09% with a minimum score of 62.86% and maximum of 85.61%. We found a significant positive association between audit committee competence (ACC) and compliance and found the same for chartered accountants on board (AOB). There is less compliance with the latest standards, such as IFRS 3, 7, and 13. Also, IAS 17, 19, 36, and 37 are problematic across the sample. We also found that compliance has been increasing over the years.Practical implications: For companies, our studies provide empirical evidence on the importance of having chartered accountants’ corporate boards as well as competent audit committees involved in ensuring high compliance with IFRS. Our findings also provide valuable information for professional accounting organizations on the role of its members (chartered accountants) in the effectiveness of IFRS compliance.Value/Contribution: This study complements and updates prior studies on IFRS compliance with findings from Africa, a region that has been neglected in the literature.It provides empirical evidence on the importance of chartered accountants sitting on corporate boards in ensuring high compliance with IFRS.
ch_abstract: 目的：本文运用利益相关者显著性理论探讨企业遵守国际财务报告准则（IFRS）的驱动因素。研究方法：我们采用205家企业的面板数据，分析了13个非洲国家的IFRS合规水平，并建立了利益相关者属性与企业IFRS合规性之间的关系。研究发现：在IFRS合规方面，样本企业期间平均合规得分为73.09%，最低62.86%，最高85.61%。审计委员会专业能力（ACC）与合规性呈显著正相关，董事会特许会计师（AOB）同样呈现正向关联。企业对IFRS 3、7、13等新准则的遵循度较低，IAS 17、19、36和37在整个样本中执行难度较大。研究同时发现合规水平呈逐年上升趋势。实践启示：对企业而言，本研究实证证明了董事会配备特许会计师及专业审计委员会对提升IFRS合规性的重要作用。研究发现也为专业会计组织提供了其成员（特许会计师）在提升IFRS合规有效性方面作用的重要参考。价值贡献：本研究以被文献忽视的非洲地区数据补充更新了既有IFRS合规研究，实证揭示了企业董事会引入特许会计师对保障高水平IFRS合规的关键作用。
tags: Africa, Compliance, IFRS, Stakeholder salience

title: The Next Chapter in Anti-CorruptionCompliance
abstract: In this brief invited essay, we assess the future of corporate anti-corruption compliance efforts and sketch several ways to improve ethics-building within organizations.
ch_abstract: 在这篇特邀短文中，我们评估了企业反腐败合规工作的未来，并概述了在组织内部加强道德建设的几种途径。
tags: Foreign Corrupt Practices Act, FCPA, Corporate Governance, Compliance, Bribery, New Governance

title: The End of Eastern Territoriality? CJEUCompliancein the New Member States
abstract: How does compliance with Court of Justice of the European Union (CJEU) rulings on patient mobility in the new Member States compare with the old Member States? Studying new Member States’ compliance practices would highlight the state of territoriality, the CJEU’s effective influence and the European healthcare union’s strength among the new Members. To provide a structured analysis and transferrable results, we compare Poland, the Czech Republic and Bulgaria with France and Germany. These countries are selected on the basis of commonalities in their systems’ organization. For the results for the old Member States, we rely on Obermaier’s 2009 ‘The End of Territoriality’. This study is qualitative in nature and relies mostly on qualitative semi-structured interviews with experts from ministries of health, health insurers and legal experts from all three countries. We distinguish between formal and informal compliance and based on this, we advance an analytical framework for a systematic study of CJEU compliance across the EU. Our findings produce a heterogeneous picture of these countries, with all three of them demonstrating different modes of compliance. This is because of distinct domestic conditions, ranging from insurance fund amenability and national court complaisance to state administration obstinacy.
ch_abstract: 与老成员国相比，新成员国对欧盟法院(CJEU)患者流动裁决的遵守情况如何？研究新成员国的合规实践将突显领土性原则的现状、欧盟法院的实际影响力以及欧洲医疗联盟在新成员国中的实力。为提供结构化分析和可迁移的研究结果，我们将波兰、捷克和保加利亚与法国、德国进行对比。这些国家的选取基于其医疗体系组织结构的共性。关于老成员国的研究数据，我们援引了奥伯迈尔2009年发表的《领土性的终结》。本研究采用定性方法，主要通过对三国卫生部官员、医疗保险机构及法律专家的半结构化访谈展开。我们区分了形式合规与实质合规，并据此提出一个用于系统研究欧盟全境合规情况的分析框架。研究发现这些国家呈现差异化图景，三国展现出截然不同的合规模式，这源于各国国内条件的显著差异——从保险基金的配合度、国内法院的顺从性到政府行政部门的顽固性均有所不同。
tags: CJEU compliance, CJEU influence in the new member states, patient rights, forms of CJEU compliance

title: Non-ComplianceMechanisms or International Courts: How to Increase TreatyCompliance?
abstract: International courts are traditionally seen as ‘guardians’ of the international treaty regimes by which they were established and over which they have jurisdiction.However in recent years many international treaties have established ‘in-house’ non-compliance mechanisms (NCMs) or other treaty bodies to facilitate implementation and promote Parties’ compliance with their obligations.
ch_abstract: 国际法院传统上被视为其所依据并管辖的国际条约体系的“守护者”。然而近年来，许多国际条约设立了“内部”不遵守情事程序或其他条约机构，以促进条约实施并推动缔约方履行义务。
tags: International treaties, International courts, Non-compliance mechanisms

title: Regional variation in taxcomplianceand the role of culture
abstract: This research note analyzes the role of culture on individuals’ tax compliance by focusing on regional differences within a single country: Italy. Southern Italy has long been a focus of research interest, not only for its high rates of tax evasion, but for a host of other social and political ills, all usually attributed to regional culture. Our laboratory tax compliance experiment, conducted in provinces of the northern and southern regions, reveal that taxpayers in the north and south generally behaved alike both in terms of average compliance rates and individuals’ sensitivity to changes in tax structures—except for lower responsiveness to greater redistribution of tax revenues among subjects in Salerno than those in Bologna. This suggests the limited explanatory power of culture in tax compliance in favor of institutional explanations.
ch_abstract: 本研究简报通过聚焦单一国家（意大利）内部的区域差异，分析了文化对个人纳税遵从度的影响。长期以来，意大利南部不仅是逃税高发区，还因诸多通常归因于地区文化的社会政治问题而备受学界关注。我们在南北省份开展的实验室纳税实验显示，无论是平均遵从度还是个人对税率变化的敏感度，南北纳税人的行为模式总体趋同——唯一例外是萨莱诺受试者对税收再分配增强的反应弱于博洛尼亚群体。这表明文化因素对纳税行为的解释力有限，制度性解释更具说服力。
tags: Tax compliance; Lab experiment; Regional differences

title: Chile:ComplianceAfter ‘Kind’ Reminders
abstract: Chile has a quite positive record of compliance with decisions issued by the Inter-American Commission on Human Rights (IACmHR) and the Inter-American Court of Human Rights (IACtHR), despite the absence of a law on implementation. Nevertheless, several measures related to specific issues, namely amnesties, indigenous rights and military justice have not been implemented for years or even decades.Chile has recently adopted its first National Human Rights Plan, based on the recommendations of UN treaty bodies, the Inter-American System, and its national human rights institution. This should help bringing national legislation and practice in line with international human rights law (IHRL) before the ‘kind’ reminder by an international judgment. Despite a comparatively good record of implementation of international judgments, the country also lacks a consistent and efficient mechanism to apply IHRL in its domestic judicial decisions, both in the judiciary and in the Constitutional Tribunal. There are challenges especially with regard to the correct interpretation of IHRL by national courts, while its use has increased in recent years.Police violence during manifestations and riots after 18 October 2019 found strong criticism by international human rights bodies, with the IACmHR visiting Chile in January 2020. The report has not yet been issued. No precautionary measures were requested in the Inter- American System of Human Rights. Most claims on arbitrary detentions, inhuman treatment, torture, and disproportionate use of force are still pending in domestic tribunals or administrative justice.
ch_abstract: 智利在遵守美洲人权委员会（IACmHR）和美洲人权法院（IACtHR）裁决方面记录良好，尽管缺乏具体的执行法律。然而，涉及特赦、土著权利和军事司法等特定问题的若干措施多年甚至数十年仍未落实。智利近期依据联合国条约机构、美洲人权体系及其国家人权机构的建议，首次通过了《国家人权计划》。这有助于在国际判决发出"温和"提醒前，推动国内立法和实践与国际人权法（IHRL）接轨。尽管执行国际判决的记录相对较好，该国仍缺乏在司法系统和宪法法院中一贯有效适用国际人权法的机制。国内法院对国际人权法的正确解释尤其面临挑战，尽管近年来其运用有所增加。2019年10月18日后示威和骚乱中的警察暴力遭到国际人权机构强烈批评，美洲人权委员会于2020年1月访问智利。调查报告尚未发布。美洲人权体系未提出任何预防性措施。关于任意拘留、非人道待遇、酷刑及过度使用武力的大多数申诉仍在国内法院或行政司法系统中待决。
tags: Compliance; Inter-American Human Rights System; Chile

title: Controlling and AssistingCompliance: Financial Aspects
abstract: This contribution deals, firstly, with the sources of funding of compliance mechanisms under Multilateral Environmental Agreements (MEAs), which are often unpredictable and not sufficiently stable, and with the ensuing problems which have emerged. A second set of issues concerns the interplay of compliance bodies with financial mechanisms and economic instruments created under MEAs in order to facilitate, respectively, developing and industrialized States in the achievement of their targets. These are, on one side, the funds created under MEAs or other financial institutions that facilitate the compliance of developing countries by providing them with financial assistance. While some of these funds are built on voluntary contributions, others may no longer be conceived as a form of “liberality” of developed countries towards poorer ones and a legal obligation to contribute to them may be foreseen. On the other side, in order to reduce the costs that industrialized countries bear to cut greenhouse gases emissions, flexibility mechanisms have been established by the Kyoto Protocol. These innovative financial instruments create an unforeseen implementation scenario, characterized by partnerships between developed and developing States and the establishment of a market, where a new environmental commodity is traded.
ch_abstract: 本文首先探讨了多边环境协定（MEAs）下合规机制的资金来源问题——这些资金往往不可预测且缺乏足够稳定性，并分析了由此产生的一系列问题。其次，研究聚焦于合规机构与MEA框架下两类金融工具的互动关系：一类是为协助发展中国家实现目标而设立的基金或金融机构，这些资金支持部分依赖自愿捐助，但某些基金可能将发达国家对贫困国家的出资从"慷慨援助"转变为法律义务；另一类是为降低工业化国家减排成本而设计的灵活机制，如《京都议定书》创设的创新金融工具，这些机制意外促成了发达国家与发展中国家间的合作模式，并催生了一个交易新型环境商品的市场体系。
tags: environmental agreements, compliance, financial assistance, budget

title: BoardCompliance
abstract: What role do corporate boards play in compliance? Compliance programs are internal enforcement programs, whereby firms train, monitor and discipline employees with respect to applicable laws and regulations. Corporate enforcement and compliance failures could not be more high-profile, and have placed boards in the position of responding to systemic problems. Both case law on boards’ fiduciary duties and guidance from prosecutors suggest that the board should have a continuing role in overseeing compliance activity. Yet very little is actually known about the role of boards in compliance. This paper offers the first empirical account of public companies’ engagement with compliance at the board level, drawing on director-level data from BoardEx and data on federal organizational prosecutions from the Duke University and University of Virginia Corporate Prosecution Registry. We find that, despite a standard account that compliance has boomed, few boards actually adopt compliance committees. Less than five per cent of U.S. public companies have done so, although the proportion has grown steadily over time. We use our data to explore why boards establish compliance committees. Our results suggest that there is room for more constructive engagement with compliance by many boards. We conclude by recommending ways in which board compliance might be facilitated or encouraged: reconsidering norms about board size and independence, enhancing accountability of directors to regulators, and tightening state law fiduciary duties regarding oversight.
ch_abstract: 公司董事会在合规中扮演何种角色？合规计划是企业内部的执法机制，通过培训、监督与惩戒确保员工遵守法律法规。企业执法与合规失效问题备受瞩目，迫使董事会必须应对系统性风险。关于董事受托义务的判例法与检方指引均表明，董事会应持续监督合规活动。然而人们对董事会实际履职情况知之甚少。本文首次基于BoardEx的董事层级数据及杜克大学与弗吉尼亚大学企业诉讼登记库的联邦组织诉讼数据，实证研究上市公司董事会层面的合规实践。研究发现：尽管合规理念广为传播，但真正设立合规委员会的董事会寥寥无几——全美不足5%的上市公司采取此举，虽其比例正逐年缓升。我们通过数据探究董事会成立合规委员会的动因，结果表明多数董事会的合规参与度仍有提升空间。文末提出促进董事会合规的可行路径：重新审视董事会规模与独立性的规范标准、强化董事对监管机构的问责机制、以及收紧州法关于监督职责的受托义务要求。
tags: corporate law, compliance, corporate governance, compliance committees

title: AntitrustCompliance: Collusion
abstract: Focusing on collusive behavior, this chapter outlines the complexity associated with both the ex ante design of antitrust compliance programs and the ex post assessment of their impact. Following an interdisciplinary review of relevant literature, the chapter provides a structured cost–benefit approach to compliance and challenges the idea that compliance cannot be rationalized. We recognize that measurement of compliance programs may be particularly difficult in light of the importance of less-tangible factors such as corporate culture.Yet, the chapter proposes that a principled approach to compliance would considerably support the work of practitioners. Future research should concentrate on studying the interaction effects of  compliance mechanisms and corporate culture. Such large-scale empirical studies on individual and firm-specific factors of compliance might be promoted and coordinated by competition authorities.
ch_abstract: 本章聚焦于串通行为，阐述了反垄断合规计划事前设计的复杂性及事后效果评估的难度。通过跨学科文献综述后，本章提出结构化的合规成本效益分析方法，对"合规无法被合理化"的观点提出质疑。我们承认，鉴于企业文化等无形因素的重要性，合规计划的量化评估可能尤为困难。但本章指出，基于原则的合规方法将极大助力从业者的工作。未来研究应着重考察合规机制与企业文化的交互影响，此类针对合规个体因素与企业特质的宏观实证研究可由竞争主管部门推动协调。
tags: Antitrust, Compliance, Competition Law

title: CriminalizedCompliance
abstract: Corporate compliance programs have become increasingly criminalized.  In the truest of ironies, companies have adopted compliance protocols that are motivated by and mimic application of the law they seek to avoid most.  This approach to compliance — using the precepts of criminal enforcement and adjudication to govern employee conduct — is inherently flawed, however, and can never be fully effective in abating corporate wrongdoing.  Criminalized compliance programs impose unintended behavioral consequences on employees, specifically by fostering rationalizations that allow would-be offenders to square their self-perception as “good people” with the unethical or illegal behavior they are contemplating, thereby allowing wrongdoing to go forward.  By importing into the corporation many of the criminal law’s delegitimizing features, criminalized compliance encourages rationalizations and creates the necessary precursors to the commission of corporate crime.  Once this dynamic is understood, it provides a new way of conceptualizing corporate compliance and explains the ineffectiveness of many “leading” compliance programs.  It also suggests that companies committed to making gains in ethics and compliance should often ignore the practices of their peers and the regulators that influence them, and instead design behaviorally cognizant strategies aimed at combating individual and organizational rationalizations.
ch_abstract: 企业合规计划正日益被刑事化。最具讽刺意味的是，公司采用的合规方案恰恰源于并效仿了他们最想规避的法律应用。这种以刑事执法和审判原则来约束员工行为的合规模式存在根本缺陷，永远无法有效遏制企业不当行为。刑事化的合规计划会对员工产生非预期的行为后果——具体而言，它会催生心理合理化机制，使潜在违规者在保持"好人"自我认知的同时，为其正在考虑的不道德或非法行为开脱，从而纵容不当行为的发生。当合规计划移植了刑法诸多去正当化的特征时，就会助长合理化思维，为企业犯罪创造条件。理解这一机制后，我们就能以全新视角审视企业合规，并解释诸多"标杆"合规计划失效的原因。这也意味着，真正致力于提升道德与合规水平的企业，往往需要摒弃同行及监管机构的常规做法，转而设计具有行为认知特性的策略，以阻断个人与组织的合理化借口。
tags: corporate compliance, corporations, criminal law, corporate law, behavioral ethics, organizations, organizational legitimacy, business ethics, white collar crime, rationalizations, criminology, corporate prosecutions, behavioral psychology, behavioral economics

title: Call for a Unified Anti-Corruption and Competition LawComplianceProgramme: WhyComplianceProgrammes Should Be Viewed as a Mitigating Factor
abstract: Whether motivated by ethical reasons, the deterrent effect of fines and other sanctions, or both, an increasing number of companies coordinate compliance with anti-corruption regulations in conjunction with compliance with competition laws when establishing their corporate governance policy framework. This article advocates that at the macro level, the competent authorities should adopt a holistic approach regarding the efforts made by the companies for compliance with the competition law and anti-corruption laws and both should be subject to a unified legal enforcement policy concerning interacting compliance programmes. Furthermore, we argue that both anti-corruption and competition law compliance programmes should be considered by regulators and the Courts as mitigating factors in determining fines and sanctions for violating companies. This would encourage companies to develop thorough compliance programmes that go beyond mere legal compliance and additionally address behaviour, assist them in identifying and accumulating best practices over the years. In doing so, the impact and reach of regulation and legislation will increase; ultimately improving market efficiency. Such a broad scale upgrade in sanctions policy would eventually be of benefit to society and the economy in terms of both crime prevention and the procedural economy.
ch_abstract: 无论是出于道德原因、罚款及其他制裁的威慑作用，还是两者兼有，越来越多的公司在制定企业治理政策框架时，将遵守反腐败法规与竞争法合规协同推进。本文主张在宏观层面，主管部门应对企业遵守竞争法与反腐败法的努力采取整体性视角，并将两者纳入关于互动合规计划的统一执法政策。此外，我们认为监管机构和法院在判定违规企业罚款与制裁时，应将反腐败和竞争法合规计划视为减轻处罚的因素。这将促使企业制定全面的合规计划——不仅满足法律要求，更能规范行为，并帮助其识别和积累多年来的最佳实践。通过这种方式，法规与立法的影响力和覆盖范围将得到提升，最终提高市场效率。这种制裁政策的大规模升级，最终将在犯罪预防和程序经济两方面为社会和经济带来益处。
tags: compliance, competition law, antitrust, anti-corruption

title: TheComplianceMentorship Program: Improving Ethics andCompliancein Small Government Contractors
abstract: Over the past decade, the anti-corruption, ethics, and compliance landscape has changed dramatically. This is a direct consequence of a global anti-corruption enforcement effort led by the United States through its enforcement of the Foreign Corrupt Practices Act. The increase in enforcement has also been spurred by the adoption of several multilateral anti-corruption agreements, such as the Organization for Economic Co-operation and Development (OECD) Anti-Bribery Convention and the United Nations Convention Against Corruption (UNCAC).  These agreements have spurred several countries to enact anti-corruption laws, such as the U.K. Bribery Act, Brazil’s Clean Company Act, and France’s Loi Sapin II. The laws prohibit, among other things, the bribery of foreign government officials. They also encourage companies to dedicate resources to developing anti-corruption compliance programs and maintaining robust internal controls.The increase in anti-corruption enforcement has profoundly impacted large, multinational corporations. Many of these companies have responded to the enforcement increase by investing heavily in sophisticated compliance programs designed to prevent or mitigate liability for anti-corruption violations. The development of rigorous internal compliance programs has been particularly pronounced in the defense industry, especially among large, U.S. defense contractors.Unlike their large counterparts, many small government contractors are largely unable to keep up with the rapidly evolving trends and best practices in ethics and compliance. Their inattention to this critical area leaves them at risk for compliance failures, fraud, and corruption. As a result, small contractors are more likely than their large counterparts to be debarred from the U.S. procurement system.Despite the harsh consequences of compliance deficiencies, few small contractors are likely to dedicate resources to the development of vital compliance policies and internal controls because of the reality of limited resources. This has created a critical gap in the defense industry supply chain, as many large contractors may partner with small companies that lack the sophistication and resources necessary to ensure compliance with the many government contracts compliance requirements.One solution to this growing problem is to incentivize large government contractors to help their small subcontractors develop compliance programs. The incentives, of course, must be substantial enough to convince large contractors to share their confidential and proprietary compliance programs and best practices.Fortunately, a model for this type of arrangement exists in the U.S. procurement system. The “mentor-protégé” program is designed to help small businesses navigate the immense government contracts regulatory system.Under this program, generally a larger, more experienced contractor serves as a “mentor” to a smaller contractor (the “protégé”). The mentor, among other things, guides the protégé through the complex procurement regime by sharing expertise and resources. In return, the mentor is provided with contractual opportunities and incentives by the U.S. Government.This model could benefit companies in the compliance space by providing a mechanism for contracting parties to exchange information and ensure transparency throughout all levels of the procurement process.This article recommends incentivizing large businesses to utilize their vast resources to assist their small business partners with the development of internal ethics and compliance programs in order to improve the overall integrity of the government procurement system. It analyzes the development of global anti-corruption compliance standards through an overview of noteworthy changes in laws, regulations and enforcement, as well as the current compliance risks that large companies face when contracting with smaller companies who lack robust compliance systems and internal controls. The article concludes by recommending  the adoption of a corporate mentor-protégé program that incentivizes larger companies to dedicate resources to helping smaller contractors develop anti-corruption compliance programs.
ch_abstract: 过去十年间，反腐败、道德规范与合规领域发生了翻天覆地的变化。这直接源于美国通过《反海外腐败法》执法引领的全球反腐行动。多项多边反腐协议的出台也推动了执法力度加强，例如经济合作与发展组织《反贿赂公约》和《联合国反腐败公约》。这些协议促使英国《反贿赂法》、巴西《清洁公司法》、法国《萨潘第二法案》等国家立法相继颁布。这些法律不仅明令禁止贿赂外国政府官员，更推动企业投入资源建立反腐合规体系与完善内控制度。. . 反腐执法强化对大型跨国企业影响深远。许多公司通过重金打造精密合规体系来应对，旨在预防或减轻违规责任。这种严格的内部合规机制在国防工业领域尤为突出，美国大型国防承包商表现最为显著。. . 与巨头企业形成鲜明对比的是，众多小型政府承包商难以跟上合规领域快速演进的最佳实践。对这一关键领域的忽视使其面临合规失效、欺诈与腐败风险。因此小型承包商相比大企业更可能被美国采购体系拒之门外。. . 尽管合规缺陷后果严重，但资源有限的现实使小型承包商很少投入资源建立关键合规政策与内控体系。这在国防工业供应链中形成了重大缺口——大型承包商常需与缺乏合规能力的小企业合作。. . 解决这一日益严峻问题的方案，是激励大型政府承包商协助小型分包商建立合规体系。当然，激励措施必须足够有力，才能说服大企业分享其机密专属的合规方案与最佳实践。. . 值得庆幸的是，美国采购体系中的"导师-门生"计划为此提供了范本。该计划旨在帮助小企业应对庞杂的政府合同监管体系。通常由经验丰富的大型承包商担任"导师"，通过分享专业知识与资源指导"门生"企业穿越复杂采购体系，作为回报，美国政府会为导师企业提供合同机会与政策激励。. . 这种模式可为合规领域提供新思路，建立合同方信息交换机制，确保采购流程各环节透明度。本文建议激励大企业运用其雄厚资源，协助小企业合作伙伴建立道德合规体系，从而提升政府采购体系的整体廉洁度。通过梳理法律法规与执法实践的重大变革，分析全球反腐合规标准的发展脉络，揭示大企业与缺乏健全合规体系的小公司合作时面临的风险。最终提出应推行企业版"导师-门生"计划，激励大企业投入资源帮助小承包商建设反腐合规体系。
tags: procurement, government contracts, contractor, compliance, foreign corrupt practices act, FCPA, United Nations, OECD, bribery, corruption, anti-corruption, UNCAC, UK Bribery Act, Sapin II, defense, defense contractor, fraud, supply chain, ethics, anti-bribery

title: The Effect of TaxComplianceCost on Taxpayer’s VoluntaryCompliancein Tanzania
abstract: This study examined the effect of tax compliance cost on taxpayers ‘voluntary taxcompliance in Tanzania, to attain this objective, qualitative and quantitativeresearch approaches were used. A cross-sectional survey research designtechnique of data collection method was used. Both primary data and secondarydata in the form of interviews, document reviews, and surveys were used.Questionnaires were used as a tool for collecting data, and systematic andunsystematic random sampling, as well as purposive sampling, was used. Thisstudy drew a sample size of 99 small and medium taxpayers from a population of12,670 small and medium taxpayers who are registered in the Dodoma Region.The results showed that when the taxpayers’ compliance cost is very high andcauses a decrease in taxpayers’ voluntary compliance, the cost of taxpayers’compliance including monetary cost such as consultancy cost and tax audit costs,psychological cost as well as time cost still challenge the taxpayers and lastly thehigh taxpayers’ compliance cost causes non-tax compliance. This studyrecommended that the Tanzania Revenue Authority (TRA) should reduce thecosts associated with taxpayers’ voluntary compliance as much as possible bysimplifying the procedures of paying taxes, Also, the study recommended that theresponsibility of combating these costs both to the government and the taxpayers.The study concluded that the high taxpayers’ compliance cost causes non-taxcompliance.
ch_abstract: 本研究探讨了税收遵从成本对坦桑尼亚纳税人自愿纳税的影响。为实现这一目标，采用了定性与定量相结合的研究方法，并运用横断面调查设计技术进行数据收集。研究通过访谈、文件审查和问卷调查等形式获取了原始数据与二手数据，其中问卷作为主要数据采集工具，同时采用系统随机抽样、非系统随机抽样及目的性抽样相结合的方式。研究从多多马地区12,670家注册中小型纳税人中抽取了99家作为样本。. . 研究结果显示：当纳税人遵从成本过高时，会导致自愿纳税意愿下降。具体而言，包括咨询费用、税务审计费用在内的货币成本，心理成本以及时间成本仍对纳税人构成挑战；最终，高遵从成本将导致纳税不遵从行为。为此，本研究建议坦桑尼亚税务局（TRA）应通过简化纳税流程尽可能降低纳税人自愿遵从的相关成本，同时强调政府与纳税人需共同承担控制这些成本的责任。研究最终得出结论：高税收遵从成本是导致纳税不遵从行为的主要原因。
tags: Tax compliance Cost, Taxpayers, Tax Compliance, Taxpayers’ Voluntary Compliance, Tanzania

title: Do CorporateCompliancePrograms InfluenceCompliance?
abstract: What impact does the implementation of formal compliance management programs have on large business organization's compliance with the law? This paper reports results from analysis of survey responses from 999 large Australian businesses that show that implementation of competition and consumer protection compliance programs can improve compliance with competition and consumer protection law. The effect is mainly indirect because compliance programs translate into good management of compliance in practice. We also find that three other factors, management commitment to compliance values, managerial competence and organizational resources, are more important than compliance programs in determining the actual level of compliance.
ch_abstract: 正式合规管理计划的实施对大型企业组织的法律合规性有何影响？本文分析了999家澳大利亚大型企业的调查反馈，结果表明实施竞争与消费者保护合规计划能够提升企业在竞争与消费者保护法方面的合规表现。这种影响主要是间接性的，因为合规计划在实践中转化为有效的合规管理。研究还发现，在决定实际合规水平方面，管理层的合规价值观承诺、管理能力以及组织资源这三个因素比合规计划本身更为重要。
tags: compliance, compliance programmes, regulation, competition law, consumer protection law, australian competition and consumer commission

title: StateCompliancewith International law in Intelligence Matters: A Behavioural Approach
abstract: Decision-making in intelligence matters is often assumed to be an extra-legal process. This article however shows that the determining factor in compliance is a legal one: the likelihood of the state being held effectively accountable for a breach of international law. Through a behavioural analysis of state conduct in intelligence matters and the modelling of intelligence decision-making, the article demonstrates that state behaviour in intelligence matters can be explained and predicted. Taking compliance as the standard for assessing the effectiveness of regulation, this finding has strategic implications for the actors of the international legal order attempting to enhance compliance. Specifically, increasing the likelihood of effective accountability increases the probability of compliance and decreases the weight given to extra-legal and domestic considerations in decision-making, regardless of the activity and state considered. Hence, rather than focussing on the regulatory framework itself (international law), regulatory approaches aiming to enhance compliance should focus on improving accountability.
ch_abstract: 情报事务中的决策常被视为法外过程。然而本文揭示，合规性的决定性因素在于法律层面：即国家违反国际法后是否可能被有效追责。通过对国家情报行为的行为学分析及决策建模，文章论证了国家在情报事务中的行为可被解释与预测。以合规性作为评估监管效力的标准，这一发现对试图提升合规性的国际法律秩序参与者具有战略意义。具体而言，提高有效追责的可能性会增强合规概率，同时降低决策中对法外因素及国内考量的权重，无论涉及何种活动或国家。因此，旨在加强合规性的监管路径不应聚焦于监管框架本身（国际法），而应着力完善追责机制。
tags: intelligence, accountability, compliance, behavioural analysis, decision-making, regulation

title: The Price Fixer:ComplianceTales from the Other Side
abstract: This paper fills an important gap in the antitrust compliance literature by exploring the perspective of the price fixer in breaches of competition law. It provides a critical analysis of statements made by price fixers, their competition lawyers and in-house counsel involved in cartel cases. The study draws on a combination of publicly available statements and anonymised accounts collected over 15 years of engaging with each of these three groups. It concludes that those responsible for cartels are motivated by varying factors and do not necessarily understand or accept that cartel behaviour is wrongful. Also, disciplining those individuals is complicated by the incentives created through leniency and settlement programmes. These findings highlight the importance of continued investment in compliance and the broader need for education in competition law to make it less likely that infringements will occur in the first place.
ch_abstract: 本文通过探讨价格操纵者违反竞争法的视角，填补了反垄断合规文献的重要空白。文章对价格操纵者、其竞争法律师以及参与卡特尔案件的企业内部法律顾问的陈述进行了批判性分析。研究综合运用了公开声明与十五年来从这三个群体收集的匿名记录。研究表明，卡特尔行为的责任者受多种因素驱动，未必理解或承认卡特尔行为的错误性。此外，宽大处理与和解计划产生的激励机制使得对这些个人的惩戒变得复杂。这些发现凸显了持续加强合规投入的重要性，以及更广泛开展竞争法教育的必要性，从而从源头上减少侵权行为的发生。
tags: Competition Law, Antitrust, Compliance, Cartels

title: A Diretiva Whistleblower e os Programas de Ética eCompliance(The Whistleblower Directive and the Ethics andCompliancePrograms)
abstract: Portuguese Abstract:A Diretiva Whistleblower vai determinar a adoção transversal no setor público e privado de programas de ética e compliance baseados em procedimentos de denúncia interna de violações do direito da União Europeia. Neste artigo analisam-se os traços fundamentais do sistema de whistleblowing previsto na Diretiva e o impacto que terá no desenvolvimento de uma cultura de integridade nas organizações na União Europeia.English Abstract:The Whistleblowing Directive will determine the widespread adoption of ethics and compliance programs in the private and public sectors which are based on the internal reporting of breaches of European Union law. This article analyses the main features of the system of whistleblowing foreseen in the Directive, as well as the impact of the latter in fostering an organizational culture of integrity in the European Union.
ch_abstract: 葡萄牙文摘要：《举报人指令》将推动公共和私营部门普遍采用基于欧盟法律违规内部举报程序的道德与合规计划。本文分析了该指令所设举报制度的核心特征，及其对欧盟组织内诚信文化发展的影响。. . 英文摘要：《举报人指令》将促使公共和私营部门广泛采用基于欧盟法律违规内部举报的道德与合规计划。本文分析该指令所设举报制度的主要特点，以及其对欧盟组织内培育诚信文化的影响。
tags: Compliance; European Union Law; Whistleblowing

title: The Role of Non-State Actors in ClimateCompliance
abstract: This chapter examines the role of non-state actors in promoting compliance with climate change instruments and finds that their contribution has been substantial. Non-state actors are proven enforcers – sometimes more effective than states. Climate cases brought by non-state actors to non-climate institutions help to demonstrate this point, and effective mechanisms for non-state access to compliance are modeled within multilateral environmental agreements ranging from Aarhus to NAFTA. The author argues that the role of non-state actors should be expanded as climate change frameworks evolve and compliance mechanisms are strengthened. Leaving the public without standing within formal enforcement mechanisms misses a critical opportunity to promote compliance.
ch_abstract: 本章探讨了非国家行为体在促进气候变化协议遵守方面的作用，发现其贡献巨大。事实证明，非国家行为体是有效的执行者——有时比国家更有效。非国家行为体向非气候机构提起的气候诉讼案例有助于证明这一点，从《奥胡斯公约》到《北美自由贸易协定》等多边环境协定中，都建立了非国家行为体参与合规的有效机制。作者认为，随着气候变化框架的演进和合规机制的强化，应扩大非国家行为体的作用。若公众无法在正式执行机制中发挥作用，将错失促进合规的关键机会。
tags: Climate Change, Compliance, Non-State Actors, Climate Governance, International Environmental Law, Public Participation, Copenhagen, Kyoto Protocol, Non-Governmental Organization, NGO

title: Corporate Social Responsibility, ESG, andCompliance
abstract: In 2019, the CEO and chairperson of BlackRock, the world’s largest asset manager, called for corporate leaders to embrace corporate purpose and create value for stakeholders, and 181 CEOs of the Business Roundtable committed to lead their companies for the benefit of all stakeholders—customers, employees, suppliers, communities, and shareholders. The idea that corporations should engage in socially responsible business practices (“CSR”) or initiatives relating to environmental, social, and governance matters (“ESG”) is gaining prominence, but remains highly contested. Deeper examination reveals that these terms—CSR and ESG—each lack a singular meaning. From aligning shareholder and stakeholder interests for shared value and risk management, to going beyond compliance and profit-maximizing strategies, there is no consensus on what socially-responsible activity entails and the rationale for its pursuit.This chapter aims to illuminate the landscape of CSR, ESG, and their connection to compliance. Varying usage and mixed empirical research reveals that CSR and ESG lack a clearly defined connection to compliance. This indeterminacy extends to (1) whether CSR and ESG are correlated with or refer to greater levels of legal compliance, as well as (2) what it means for a corporation to “comply” with CSR or ESG goals in light of the proliferation of standards and metrics pertaining to sustainability and social impact. Exploring these topics through the U.S. perspective reflects that the business world is in a state of flux regarding how companies take account of their impact on stakeholders and the environment, and laws are evolving on issues such as sustainability disclosures that could help us better understand existing practices.
ch_abstract: 2019年，全球最大资产管理公司贝莱德的董事长兼首席执行官呼吁企业领导者秉持企业宗旨，为利益相关方创造价值，商业圆桌会议的181位CEO承诺将领导公司为所有利益相关方——客户、员工、供应商、社区和股东——谋取利益。关于企业应践行社会责任商业实践（"CSR"）或参与环境、社会及治理事务（"ESG"）倡议的理念日益受到重视，但仍存在巨大争议。深入分析可见，CSR与ESG这两个术语均缺乏统一定义——从协调股东与利益相关方权益以实现共享价值及风险管理，到超越合规要求与利润最大化战略，对于社会责任活动的具体内涵及践行理由始终未达成共识。本章旨在厘清CSR、ESG及其与合规的关联。多样化的术语使用与复杂的实证研究表明，CSR和ESG与合规之间缺乏明确定义的联系。这种不确定性体现在：（1）CSR和ESG是否与更高程度的法律合规存在关联或指向关系；（2）鉴于可持续发展与社会影响相关标准及指标的激增，企业"遵守"CSR或ESG目标究竟意味着什么。从美国视角探讨这些议题可见，商界对于企业如何考量其对利益相关方及环境影响正处于动态调整期，而关于可持续发展披露等问题的法律演进或将帮助我们更深入理解现有实践。
tags: compliance, ESG, CSR, sustainability, disclosure, stakeholders, corporate social responsibility, shareholder primacy

title: Elements of EffectiveCompliancePrograms
abstract: In general, a compliance program can be understood to be an internal management system that educates the officers and employees of a company about laws and regulations relevant to the business activities of the company and establishes processes and procedures to guide and monitor the behavior of those persons.  There are no legally mandated standards for compliance programs; however, numerous attempts have been made to identify and define the essential elements of an effective corporate compliance program in guidelines from the accounting profession and regulators and in pronouncements included in case law.  Each compliance program should be tailored to the unique circumstances of the company, including the size of the company, the level of regulation applicable to the company’s business activities, and its past compliance history.  In any case, however, the program should be broad in its scope of application; and extend beyond all officers and employees of the company and its subsidiaries and branches to include outside consultants, advisors, independent contractors, and business partners such as distributors, agents, sales representatives, licensees, and joint venture partners.
ch_abstract: 一般而言，合规计划可理解为一套内部管理体系，旨在向公司高管及员工普及与公司经营活动相关的法律法规，并通过建立流程和程序来指导及监督相关人员行为。法律并未强制规定合规计划的标准，但会计行业准则、监管机构指引及判例法中的声明已多次尝试界定有效企业合规计划的核心要素。每项合规计划都应根据公司的具体情况量身定制，包括企业规模、业务活动适用的监管要求以及既往合规记录。但无论如何，该计划的适用范围应当广泛，不仅涵盖公司及其子公司、分支机构的所有高管员工，还应延伸至外部顾问、独立承包商以及经销商、代理商、销售代表、被许可方、合资伙伴等商业合作伙伴。
tags: compliance, legal requirements, compliance culture

title: MEAComplianceProcedures: Overview of Key Design and Implementation Issues
abstract: Non-compliance procedures under multilateral environmental agreements (MEAs) have emerged over the past few decades as they have in other areas of international law. This paper provides an overview of the underlying compliance theories for facilitative and enforcement based compliance approaches, highlights experiences under selected MEAs, and identifies key compliance system design issues. This paper first offers a high-level overview of the key features of a selection of MEA compliance systems.  It then considers the role of non-compliance procedures in MEAs and the underlying theoretical foundation for facilitative and enforcement-based compliance systems.  The roles and interconnections among the primary rule system, the compliance information system, and then non-compliance response system are discussed.  This is followed with an exploration of the key design elements (from scope and triggers to consequences), which are then explored further using compliance systems under the UN climate regime as a case study.
ch_abstract: 过去几十年来，多边环境协定（MEAs）下的不遵守程序与国际法其他领域一样逐渐发展形成。本文概述了以促进方式与执行方式实现合规的理论基础，重点分析了若干多边环境协定的实践经验，并指出了合规体系设计的关键问题。文章首先从宏观层面梳理了部分多边环境协定合规体系的核心特征，继而探讨不遵守程序在多边环境协定中的作用，以及促进型与执行型合规体系背后的理论基础。文中论述了主要规则体系、合规信息系统及不遵守应对系统三者间的功能定位与内在联系，随后从适用范围、触发机制到后果措施等维度剖析关键设计要素，并以联合国气候体制下的合规体系作为案例进行深入阐释。
tags: compliance, MEAs, non-compliance procedures, compliance systems, compliance theory

title: Analysis of Procedural and Retributive Justice in TaxCompliance
abstract: To date, tax research has tended to focus on tax penalties rather than their retributive justices and procedural justices of systems imposing tax penalties. This article focuses on retributive justices and procedural justice in tax compliance literature. The article examines whether or not charging corporate income tax penalties, which are perceived retributively justice encourage tax compliance. Also it investigates whether or not implementing procedural justice in imposing corporate income tax penalties increases compliance and moderates the relationship between tax compliance and retributive justice. Data were collected using survey method to solicit responses from 257 Small and Medium Enterprises [SMEs] taxpayers in Tanzania about their perceptions over retributive justice of corporate income tax penalties for not keeping complete records as well as paying taxes on time, and likely impacts of the penalties on tax compliance. Also the survey collected data on respondents’ perception on procedural justice in the process of imposing tax penalties.
ch_abstract: 迄今为止，税收研究往往侧重于税收处罚本身，而非实施税收处罚制度的报应正义与程序正义。本文聚焦于税收遵从文献中的报应正义与程序正义，探讨企业所得税收处罚若被视为具有报应正义性，是否能促进税收遵从；同时研究在实施企业所得税收处罚时践行程序正义，是否会提升遵从度并调节税收遵从与报应正义之间的关系。研究采用问卷调查法收集数据，获取坦桑尼亚257家中小企业纳税人关于"未完整保存账簿或未按时纳税"的企业所得税收处罚之报应正义性的认知，以及此类处罚对税收遵从的潜在影响；同时收集受访者对税收处罚实施过程中程序正义的认知数据。
tags: procedural justice, retributive justice, SMEs, tax avoidance, tax compliance, tax evasion

title: Collusive vs. coercively corrupt tax auditors and their impact on taxcompliance
abstract: This study examines taxpayer compliance in the presence and absence of collusively corrupt taxauditors and compares it to taxpayer compliance in the presence and absence of coercively corrupt tax auditors. Our experimental results show that overall taxpayer compliance declines in the presence of a collusively corrupt tax auditor who accepts bribes that leave the taxpayer economically better off. In contrast, taxpayer compliance increases in the presence of coercive tax auditors who demand moderate bribes. This may reflect taxpayers’ attempt to create a moral distance between themselves and the corrupt auditor. However, such economic sacrifices disappear when the level of bribe demanded by coercive auditors is increased to a higher component of reported income, suggesting that taxpayers may be willing to bear only relatively modest costs to morally differentiate themselves from coercive tax auditors.
ch_abstract: 本研究探讨了存在与不存在共谋腐败税务稽查员时的纳税人遵从行为，并将其与存在及不存在胁迫型腐败税务稽查员时的遵从情况进行比较。实验结果表明：当存在接受贿赂并使纳税人经济获益的共谋型腐败稽查员时，总体纳税人遵从度会下降；相反，面对索取适度贿赂的胁迫型稽查员时，纳税人遵从度反而上升。这可能反映了纳税人试图与腐败稽查员保持道德距离的心理。然而，当胁迫型稽查员索贿金额增至申报收入的较高比例时，这种经济牺牲行为便随之消失，这表明纳税人可能只愿意承担相对有限的成本来与胁迫型税务稽查员划清道德界限。
tags: Collusive corrupt, Coercive corruption, Tax auditors, Tax compliance

title: ComplianceDynamism: Capturing the Polynormative and Situational Nature of Business Responses to Law
abstract: Studying compliance, in terms of the business responses to legal rules, is notoriously difficult. This paper focuses on the difficulty of capturing the behavioral response itself, rather than on difficulties in explaining compliance and isolating par- ticular factors of influence on it. The paper argues that existing approaches to capture such compliance, using surveys and governmental data, run the risk of failing to capture compliance as it occurs in the reality of day-to-day business responses to the law. It does so by means of a unique ethnographic approach to study compliance. Drawing from data of deep participant observation about responses to legal rules in two small businesses, the paper finds that in this context there is Compliance Dynamism. This means that compliance varies for different rules, it varies over time, and businesses learn from one response to the law to the next on a daily basis. Compliance is also situational, and there is an Indirect Observer Effect, where the way compliance is measured, especially when using data derived from inspections, shapes what compliance is observed and what is not. Therefore, compliance should be captured not as a singular state but as a string of reiterative processes that occur in their situational context. And this fundamentally challenges most existing methods to capture compliance and thus our understanding of what compliance occurs and what may shape it. In its conclusion, the paper draws out the implications this has for studies that seek to find simple and usable findings about compliance.
ch_abstract: 研究企业在面对法律规则时的合规行为，其难度众所周知。本文聚焦于捕捉行为反应本身的困难，而非解释合规或分离特定影响因素的难题。文章指出，现有通过调查和政府数据来捕捉合规行为的方法，可能无法真实反映企业在日常经营中对法律的实际响应。为此，本研究采用独特的人种志方法展开分析。通过对两家小微企业法律响应行为的深度参与式观察，研究发现存在"合规动态性"现象——即企业对不同规则的合规程度存在差异，这种差异会随时间变化，且企业会在日常法律应对中持续积累经验。合规还具有情境依赖性，并存在"间接观察者效应"：尤其是采用检查数据时，测量方式本身会决定哪些合规行为被观察到。因此，合规应被视为情境中一系列反复发生的动态过程，而非单一静态结果。这一发现从根本上挑战了现有主流研究方法，也重塑了我们对合规行为及其影响机制的理解。文末探讨了该结论对追求简明实用成果的合规研究带来的启示。
tags: compliance, methods, ethnography, white collar crime, regulatory enforcement

title: AntitrustCompliance: An Annotated Bibliography
abstract: The purpose of this annotated bibliography is to survey the literature on antitrust compliance. The bibliography is organized into five sections: (1) current U.S. antitrust enforcement policy vis-à-vis compliance; (2) tools companies and in-house counsel can use to bolster existing compliance programs; (3) compliance in a globalized world; (4) recommended policy considerations; and (5) comparative policy considerations. Included are articles, commentaries, conference papers, essays, and books addressing one or more of the main categories into which the bibliography is organized.
ch_abstract: 本注释书目的目的在于梳理有关反垄断合规的文献。书目分为五个部分：(1) 美国当前针对合规的反垄断执法政策；(2) 企业及内部法务可用于强化现有合规计划的工具；(3) 全球化背景下的合规；(4) 推荐的政策考量；(5) 比较政策分析。收录的文献包括文章、评论、会议论文、随笔及书籍，均涉及书目分类中的一个或多个主要类别。
tags: Compliance, Antitrust, Competition, Incentives, Compliance Programs

title: Innovation, Overgeeking and Behavior inCompliancePrograms
abstract: English Abstract:Innovation usually appears on the code of ethics of organizations, either as a corporate value or as part of the so-called organization´s vision. Its positive role related to profit maximization or market share is apparent and it is also to the success of some of its specific programs, as its compliance program.It is less evident, instead, why innovation, in the former sense (referred to the general aims of the organization) should be included on the code of ethics, being that code a cornerstone of the compliance program, whose aims were utterly different.Nonetheless, that inclusion is correct. The program of compliance, as a condition of efficiency, must be consistent with the general and ultimate aims of the organization. Moreover, it must not be even “neutral” to those aims, but positively functional.A second order but relevant remark may be made. Formal appellations to innovation may bias to fancy software or hardware technology over innovative organizational processes even if the latter are more efficient. The term overgeeking denotes this malfunction.Spanish Abstract:La innovación suele aparecer en los códigos de ética de las organizaciones, ya sea como un valor corporativo o como parte de la llamada visión de la institución. Es evidente su rol positivo respecto del objeto general de la empresa -maximización de beneficios o de la cuota de mercado- y también lo es si se refiere a innovación para la mejora de algunos de sus programas específicos, incluido su programa de compliance.Es menos evidente, en cambio, por qué la innovación, entendida en el primero de tales sentidos, es decir, como instrumental a los fines generales de la organización, deba estar incluida en el Código de Ética, que es la pieza fundamental del programa de compliance, el cual debería apuntar, específicamente, a otro tipo de valores.Es correcto, sin embargo, que lo esté, porque el programa de compliance, como condición de posibilidad su eficiencia, no debe ser inconsistente y ni siquiera neutral respecto de los objetivos generales de la organización.Una consideración secundaria pero relevante, en este campo, es que la apelación a innovación puede sesgar a una interpretación intuitiva que privilegie la adopción de soluciones tecnológicas vistosas por encima otras más eficientes, como lo son, muchas veces, innovaciones puramente organizacionales que no incluyan el hardware o software más reciente. El término overgeeking denota esa disfunción.
ch_abstract: 英文摘要：创新通常出现在组织的道德准则中，要么作为企业价值观，要么作为所谓组织愿景的一部分。它与利润最大化或市场份额相关的积极作用显而易见，也对其某些特定项目（如合规计划）的成功至关重要。然而，为何创新在前一种意义上（指组织的总体目标）应被纳入道德准则则不那么明显，因为该准则是合规计划的基石，而合规计划的目标完全不同。尽管如此，这种纳入是正确的。合规计划作为效率的条件，必须与组织的总体和最终目标保持一致。此外，它甚至不能对这些目标保持“中立”，而应具有积极的促进作用。  . . 另一个次要但相关的观点是，对创新的形式化呼吁可能会偏向于花哨的软件或硬件技术，而非创新的组织流程，即使后者更高效。术语“overgeeking”指代这种功能失调。  . . 西班牙文摘要：创新通常出现在组织的道德准则中，要么作为企业价值观，要么作为所谓组织愿景的一部分。它对企业的总体目标（利润最大化或市场份额）的积极作用显而易见，如果涉及改进某些特定计划（包括合规计划）的创新，也同样如此。然而，为何创新在前一种意义上（即作为实现组织总体目标的工具）应被纳入道德准则则不那么明显，因为该准则是合规计划的核心，而合规计划本应指向另一类价值观。尽管如此，这种纳入是正确的，因为合规计划作为其效率可能性的条件，不应与组织的总体目标不一致，甚至不应保持中立。  . . 在这一领域中，一个次要但相关的考虑是，对创新的呼吁可能会偏向一种直观解释，即优先采用花哨的技术解决方案，而非更高效的方案（例如许多不涉及最新硬件或软件的纯粹组织创新）。术语“overgeeking”指代这种功能失调。
tags: Compliance, Law and Economics, Behavioral Law & Economics, Behavioral Sciences, Innovation, Regulation

title: ShariahComplianceand Corporate Cash Holdings
abstract: This study investigates the influence of shariah compliance status on firms’ cash holding levels and speed of adjustment in non-financial firms listed in six Gulf Cooperation Council (GCC countries) from 2005 to 2016. It shows that shariah compliance status has a significant effect on firms’ cash holding decisions. Shariah-compliant firms have significantly higher cash holding levels than non-shariah-compliant firms. Further, shariah-compliant firms adjust more quickly to their target cash holdings than do their conventional counterparts. In our view, shariah-compliant firms are subject to multiple restrictions that limit their external financing channels; therefore, holding larger cash reserves is important as such firms are financially constrained and gain from the transaction cost motive of holding cash. The findings of the study have important implications for regulators, investors and managers. To the best of our knowledge, this study is the first to compare the effect of shariah compliance on firms’ cash holdings and speed of adjustment towards the trade-off theory’s optimal cash holding target.
ch_abstract: 本研究探讨了2005年至2016年间，伊斯兰教法合规状态对海湾合作委员会（GCC）六国上市非金融企业现金持有水平及调整速度的影响。研究表明，伊斯兰教法合规状态对企业现金持有决策具有显著影响。符合伊斯兰教法的企业现金持有水平明显高于非合规企业。此外，合规企业比传统企业能更快调整至目标现金持有量。我们认为，伊斯兰教法合规企业面临多重限制导致外部融资渠道受限，因此持有更多现金储备至关重要——这类企业既受财务约束，又能从现金持有的交易成本动机中获益。研究发现对监管机构、投资者和管理者具有重要启示。据我们所知，这是首个比较伊斯兰教法合规性对企业现金持有量及向权衡理论最优目标调整速度影响的研究。
tags: Cash holding, Speed of adjustment, Shariah compliance, Islamic finance, Gulf Cooperation Council

title: The "Wholesale Failure" of the SEC's Approach to ChiefComplianceOfficer Liability
abstract: Chief Compliance Officers (“CCOs”) at financial services firms are essential in ensuring that the approximately 15,000 SEC-registered firms, including investment advisers, broker-dealers, and private funds, comply with federal securities laws.  These firms collectively manage over $114 trillion in assets for investors and are the “lifeblood” of the U.S. economy.  The CCO position is so crucial to regulators that CCOs can and have been held personally liable for compliance violations of their firms, even when the CCO was not involved in the misconduct, which has caused negative consequences.Significantly and problematically, the SEC has not promulgated a legal standard for when CCOs may be held personally liable for violations committed by their firms, and their attempts to clarify the factors that would put a CCO in danger of liability have only added to the confusion.  This paper proposes a recklessness legal standard for when CCOs are to be held personally liable for violations committed by their firms and demonstrates that this standard will benefit CCOs, firms, and regulators.This paper takes a unique approach, not just rehashing existing ideas but utilizing cutting-edge research from organizational studies, compliance, behavioral studies, and information from legal authorities to demonstrate what creates strong organizational cultures that prevent unlawful behavior.  These studies feed into the legal standard I propose, demonstrating that it will promote the appropriate incentivizes to meet the SEC’s regulatory goals of protecting investors and ensuring fair and efficient markets, rather than the current problematic incentives for a CCO to create an ineffective, check-the-box, reactionary compliance program to protect themselves from liability.  This legal standard will also remedy other negative consequences of the SEC’s approach, such as the chilling effect on knowledgeable and competent CCOs and reflects both the modern realities of the CCO position and what research shows is required to build strong organizational compliance cultures.This paper has significant and timely implications for compliance, securities and legal scholarship more broadly.  First, as the conscience of firms managing trillions in assets on behalf of investors, including individuals, pensions, and universities, CCOs play an integral role in promoting behavior that protects these investors and promulgating the legal standard proposed will benefit these investors and the U.S. economy.  Second, this paper applies novel research regarding the ex-ante function of law, where CCOs and other organizational actors must take proactive, preventative actions to ensure violations do not occur in the first place.  The far majority of legal scholarship focuses on the ex-post function of law, where the legal system responds to past behavior; however, such an approach is ineffective in promoting an organizational culture of compliance, which has important consequences for organizations across industries.
ch_abstract: 金融服务公司的首席合规官（“CCOs”）对于确保约15,000家在SEC注册的公司（包括投资顾问、经纪自营商和私募基金）遵守联邦证券法至关重要。这些公司共同为投资者管理着超过114万亿美元的资产，是美国经济的“命脉”。首席合规官职位对监管机构如此重要，以至于首席合规官可能且已经因其公司的合规违规行为而承担个人责任，即使首席合规官并未参与不当行为，这已造成负面影响。. . 值得注意的是且成问题的是，SEC并未就首席合规官何时可能因其公司的违规行为承担个人责任颁布法律标准，其试图澄清可能导致首席合规官面临责任风险的因素反而增加了困惑。本文提出了一种“轻率”法律标准，用于判定首席合规官何时应因其公司的违规行为承担个人责任，并证明该标准将使首席合规官、公司和监管机构受益。. . 本文采用了一种独特的方法，不仅重复现有观点，还利用组织研究、合规、行为研究的前沿成果以及法律权威信息，展示了如何建立防止非法行为的强大组织文化。这些研究支持了我提出的法律标准，表明它将促进适当的激励，以实现SEC保护投资者和确保市场公平高效的监管目标，而不是当前有问题的激励——首席合规官为规避责任而建立无效的、走过场的、被动反应的合规计划。该法律标准还将纠正SEC方法的其他负面影响，例如对知识渊博且称职的首席合规官的寒蝉效应，并反映了首席合规官职位的现代现实以及研究显示的建立强大组织合规文化所需的条件。. . 本文对合规、证券和更广泛的法律学术具有重要且及时的意义。首先，作为代表个人、养老金和大学等投资者管理数万亿美元资产的公司“良心”，首席合规官在促进行为保护这些投资者方面发挥着不可或缺的作用，颁布拟议的法律标准将使这些投资者和美国经济受益。其次，本文应用了关于法律事前功能的新研究，即首席合规官和其他组织参与者必须采取主动的预防性行动，以确保违规行为从一开始就不会发生。绝大多数法律学术研究都集中在法律的事后功能上，即法律体系对过去行为的反应；然而，这种方法在促进合规的组织文化方面效果不佳，这对各行业的组织具有重要影响。
tags: Compliance, SEC, Securities, Organizational Studies, Chief Compliance Officer, Financial Regulation, Business Organizations, Supervision, Liability Standard, Regulatory Enforcement, Corporate Governance

title: Cultures ofCompliance
abstract: There has been a "cultural turn" in discussion and debates about the promise of corporate compliance efforts. These efforts are occurring quickly, without great confidence in their efficacy. Thus the interest in culture. This article explores what a culture of compliance means and why it is so hard to achieve. The "dark side" that enables non-compliance in organizations is powerful and often hidden from view, working via scripts that rationalize or normalize, denigrations of regulation, and celebrations of beliefs and attitudes that bring with them compliance dangers. The article addresses how both culture and compliance should be judged by those wishing for better corporate behavior.
ch_abstract: 关于企业合规承诺的讨论和辩论出现了一次“文化转向”。这些努力正在迅速展开，但对其效果并无十足把握。因此，人们对文化产生了兴趣。本文探讨了合规文化的含义及其难以实现的原因。助长组织内不合规行为的“阴暗面”力量强大且往往隐蔽，通过合理化或常态化的脚本、对监管的贬低，以及对伴随合规风险的信念与态度的颂扬发挥作用。文章还探讨了希望改善企业行为的人应如何评判文化与合规。
tags: compliance, human behavior

title: ComplianceManagement Systems: Do They Make a Difference?
abstract: Regulatory compliance is vital for promoting the public values served by regulation. Yet many businesses remain out of compliance with some of the regulations that apply to them — presenting not only possible dangers to the public but also exposing themselves to potentially significant liability risk. Compliance management systems (CMSs) may help reduce the likelihood of noncompliance. In recent years, managers have begun using CMSs in an effort to address compliance issues in a variety of domains: environment, workplace health and safety, finance, health care, and aviation, among others. CMSs establish systematic, checklist-like processes by which managers seek to improve their organizations’ compliance with government regulation. They can help managers identify compliance obligations, assign responsibility for meeting them, track progress, and take corrective action as needed. In effect, CMSs constitute firms’ own internal inspection and enforcement responsibilities. At least in theory, CMSs reduce noncompliance by increasing information available to employees and managers, facilitating internal incentives to correct instances of noncompliance once identified, and helping to foster a culture of compliance. Recognizing these potential benefits, some government policymakers and regulators have even started to require certain firms to adopt CMSs.But do CMSs actually achieve their theoretical benefits? We review the available empirical research related to CMSs in an effort to discern how they work, paying particular attention to whether CMSs help firms fulfill both the letter as well as the spirit of the law. We also consider lessons that can be drawn from research on the effectiveness of still broader systems for risk management and corporate codes of ethics, as these systems either include regulatory compliance as one component or they present comparable challenges in terms of internal monitoring and shaping of organizational behavior. Overall, we find evidence that firms with certain types of CMSs in place experience fewer compliance violations and show improvements in risk management. But these effects also appear to be rather modest. Compliance in large organizations generally requires more than just a CMS; it also demands appropriate managerial attitudes, organizational cultures, and information technologies that extend beyond the systematic, checklist processes characteristic of CMSs. We address implications of what we find for policy and future research, especially about the conditions under which CMSs appear to work best, the types or features of CMSs that appear to work better than others, and the possible value of regulatory mandates that firms implement CMSs.
ch_abstract: 监管合规对于促进法规所服务的公共价值至关重要。然而许多企业仍未能完全遵守适用于它们的部分法规——这不仅可能对公众构成危害，也使企业自身面临重大的责任风险。合规管理体系（CMS）或有助于降低违规概率。近年来，管理者开始在各领域运用CMS应对合规问题，包括环境、职场健康安全、金融、医疗保健及航空等。CMS通过建立系统化、清单式的流程，帮助管理者提升组织对政府法规的遵从度。它们能协助管理者识别合规义务、分配责任、追踪进度，并在必要时采取纠正措施。实质上，CMS构成了企业内部的检查与执行机制。理论上，CMS通过增加员工和管理者可获取的信息、强化违规行为的内部整改激励、培育合规文化来减少违规行为。鉴于这些潜在效益，部分政府政策制定者和监管机构已开始强制要求特定企业实施CMS。. . 但CMS是否真能实现其理论效益？我们梳理了相关实证研究以探究其运作机制，重点关注CMS能否帮助企业同时实现法律条文与立法精神的遵守。我们还借鉴了更广泛的风险管理体系和企业道德规范有效性的研究经验，因为这些体系要么将监管合规作为组成部分，要么在内部监控和组织行为塑造方面面临类似挑战。总体而言，我们发现证据表明采用特定类型CMS的企业违规行为更少，风险管理水平有所提升。但这些效果似乎较为有限。大型组织的合规通常不仅需要CMS，还需匹配的管理者态度、组织文化及信息技术支持，这些要素超越了CMS典型的系统化清单流程特征。我们探讨了研究发现对政策及未来研究的启示，特别是CMS最有效运作的条件、表现更优的CMS类型或特征，以及强制企业实施CMS的法规可能产生的价值。
tags: Regulatory compliance, administrative regulations, compliance programs, enterprise risk management, risk control, organizational behavior, corporate behavioral change, corporate codes of ethics, rule of law, systems engineering, organizational cultures

title: Insider TradingCompliancePrograms
abstract: This chapter in a forthcoming handbook on corporate compliance provides an overview of corporate insider trading compliance programs. It sets out the basic legal framework of the federal insider trading prohibition. It then reviews the reasons corporations adopt compliance programs. The chapter next reviews the basic elements of an insider trading compliance program. Finally, the chapter examines the special case of Rule 10b5-1 compliance programs.
ch_abstract: 本手册即将出版的章节概述了公司内幕交易合规计划。它阐述了联邦内幕交易禁令的基本法律框架，随后探讨了公司采纳合规计划的原因。接着，该章节回顾了内幕交易合规计划的基本要素。最后，本章节分析了10b5-1规则合规计划的特殊案例。
tags: insider trading, compliance

title: TestingCompliance
abstract: Corporations must comply with a dizzying array of laws and regulations.  To accomplish this complex task, corporations increasingly turn not just to the legal department and outside counsel but also an in-house group composed of non-lawyer specialists who seek to educate and motivate personnel with respect to their obligations under the law and the corporation’s code of conduct.  How can prosecutors, enforcers, companies, or the public know whether compliance is effective or merely cosmetic?  In this Article, we argue that hope-based compliance — a mentality that leads insiders and outsiders to assess compliance programs by examining how many resources are devoted to the effort and whether the programs appear sensible and well-intentioned — predictably arises from the incentives and practices evident under current laws.   We describe the “compliance trap”: that efforts to validate compliance are not encouraged by enforcers or regulators.  Such entities should want companies to share sound compliance practices to improve standards in industry.  Individual companies, however, have incentives not to share information about compliance failures, lest they risk liability. Nor do companies have strong incentives to share information about compliance successes, lest competitors use their strategies too. Rather than address this problem, regulators and enforcers, as we will explore, have exacerbated it. We propose a set of legal reforms that would create the conditions for a move to evidence-based compliance.  We describe a range of ways that companies can audit employees, using data analytics but also inexpensive and simple experimental approaches drawn from organizational psychology.  We call for a scientific approach towards regulating compliance through testing, in which compliance data must be made public, and empirically validated.
ch_abstract: 企业必须遵守纷繁复杂的法律法规。为完成这一复杂任务，企业不仅越来越多地依赖法务部门和外部律师，还组建了由非律师专业人士组成的内部团队，致力于教育员工并督促其履行法律义务和企业行为准则。检察官、执法机构、企业或公众如何判断合规工作是切实有效还是流于表面？本文提出，"基于期望的合规"——这种思维模式使得内外部人员通过评估投入资源多寡及项目是否合理善意来衡量合规成效——实则是现行法律下激励机制与实践催生的必然结果。我们揭示了"合规陷阱"：执法与监管机构并未鼓励企业验证合规实效。这些机构本应希望企业分享优质合规实践以提升行业标准。但单个企业既无动力公开合规失败（以免招致责任），也缺乏分享成功经验的意愿（以防竞争对手效仿）。而正如我们将探讨的，监管者与执法者非但未解决这一问题，反而加剧了困境。我们提出一系列法律改革方案，为转向"基于实证的合规"创造条件，并列举了企业运用数据分析及组织心理学中简便实验方法审计员工行为的多重途径。我们主张通过测试推行合规监管的科学方法，要求公开合规数据并进行实证验证。
tags: compliance, testing, validation, corporate crime

title: How the Metaverse Will Ease Banks’ComplianceWoes
abstract: Banks and financial institutions have started experimenting with the metaverse across functions.They are exploring its use in areas such as customer experience and relationship management, and bill payments.Another area where the metaverse can make an impact is regulatory compliance.Banks face compliance challenges due to the absence of a real-time monitoring system, siloed data systems and processes, and lack of interoperability between data systems.Leveraging the metaverse as the front end for regulatory processes sitting on top of existing regulatory compliance systems can help overcome these hurdles.We dwell on the challenges faced by banks in achieving compliance, touchpoints where the metaverse can be leveraged, and its potential business benefits.
ch_abstract: 银行和金融机构已开始在多个职能领域试水元宇宙。它们正探索元宇宙在客户体验与关系管理、账单支付等领域的应用。另一个元宇宙可能产生影响的领域是监管合规。由于缺乏实时监控系统、数据系统与流程各自为政、以及数据系统间互操作性不足，银行面临合规挑战。利用元宇宙作为现有合规监管系统前端的操作界面，有助于克服这些障碍。我们将深入探讨银行在实现合规过程中面临的挑战、元宇宙可发挥作用的接触点，以及其潜在商业价值。
tags: metaverse, regulatory compliance, banking

title: Introducción alComplianceen el Derecho Comparado. Primera parte: Alonomología. Common Law (Introduction toCompliancein Comparative Law. Part one: Alonomology. Common Law)
abstract: Spanish Abstract:La propuesta de este trabajo consiste en presentar una serie de argumentos que sustenten la siguiente afirmación: para que el funcionamiento real del compliance sea efectivo en la República Argentina hay que tomar referencia de su evolución material en los sistemas que impulsaron su recepción, para lo cual la Alonomologia es la disciplina adecuada.En virtud de ello se desarrollará una introducción a la disciplina, su valor interdisciplinario aportado por otros especialistas desde el fuera de ámbito jurídico (“Filosofía Jurídica Mayor”) que toma como referencia la ubicación del Derecho con otros objetos como el resto de la cultura.Desde esa perspectiva efectuaremos un análisis del sistema del common law, donde surgió el instituto objeto de este trabajo y su evolución conjetural y real a través del tiempo (dimensión temporoespacial), desde sus primeros antecedentes hasta la Convención contra el Soborno Transnacional de la Organización para la Cooperación y el Desarrollo Económico (OCDE) que motivó su recepción en la normativa nacional.Analizaremos si el reparto proyectado del compliance alcanza a ser un reparto realizado -de la adjudicación debida- (dimensión sociológica) y efectivizado por las normas que lo captan (dimensión normológica) y finalmente, si su deber ser ideal pasó por el deber ser aplicado y se convirtió en deber ser concretado (dimensión dikelógica).English Abstract:The proposal of this paper consists in presenting a series of arguments that support the following statement: for the real functionality of Compliance to be effective in the Argentine Republic, we must take reference to its material evolution in the systems that promoted their reception, for which Alonomology is the appropriate discipline.To this end, an introduction to the discipline will be developed, its interdisciplinary value contributed by other specialists from outside the legal area ("Major Legal Philosophy"), which takes as a reference the location of the Law with other objects like the rest of the culture.From this perspective we will carry out an analysis of the common law system, where the institute object of this work emerged and its conjectural and real evolution through time (temporospatial dimension), from its first antecedents to the Convention on combating bribery of foreign public officials in international business transactions of the Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development (OECD) that motivated its reception in national regulations.We will analyze if the projected “partition” (“reparto”) of compliance becomes a “partition” (“reparto”) made -from the due adjudication- (sociological dimension) and made effective by the norms that cap-ture it (normative dimension) and finally, if its "ought to be" ideal went through the "ought to be" applied and became a "ought to be" concretized (dikelogical dimension).
ch_abstract: 西班牙文摘要：本文旨在提出一系列论据支持以下主张：要使合规机制在阿根廷共和国真正有效运作，必须参考推动其被接纳的体系中该机制的实际演变历程，而阿洛诺莫学（Alonomologia）正是实现这一目标的恰当学科。为此，我们将系统介绍该学科及其跨学科价值——这种价值源于法学领域外其他专家（"法哲学高阶理论"）的贡献，其核心在于将法律与其他文化对象进行关联定位。  . . 基于此视角，我们将分析普通法体系（合规制度的发源地）及其在时空维度下的推演进程与实际演变，从早期雏形到经济合作与发展组织（OECD）《跨国反贿赂公约》的出台——正是该公约推动了阿根廷国内对合规制度的立法接纳。我们将审视合规的预设"分配"是否转化为实际"分配"（社会学维度），是否被相关规范有效吸纳（规范学维度），最终探讨其应然理想是否经历适用阶段并转化为实然成果（正义逻辑维度）。  . . 英文摘要：本文旨在提出一系列论据支持以下主张：要使合规机制在阿根廷共和国真正有效运作，必须参考推动其被接纳的体系中该机制的实际演变历程，而阿洛诺莫学（Alonomologia）正是实现这一目标的恰当学科。为此，我们将系统介绍该学科及其跨学科价值——这种价值源于法学领域外其他专家（"法哲学高阶理论"）的贡献，其核心在于将法律与其他文化对象进行关联定位。  . . 基于此视角，我们将分析普通法体系（合规制度的发源地）及其在时空维度下的推演进程与实际演变，从早期雏形到经济合作与发展组织（OECD）《跨国反贿赂公约》的出台——正是该公约推动了阿根廷国内对合规制度的立法接纳。我们将审视合规的预设"分配"是否转化为实际"分配"（社会学维度），是否被相关规范有效吸纳（规范学维度），最终探讨其应然理想是否经历适用阶段并转化为实然成果（正义逻辑维度）。

title: Legalization and Norm Internalization: An Empirical Study of International Human Rights Commitments Eliciting Public Support forCompliance
abstract: Past studies argue that states abide by international human rights laws because the ratification of human rights treaties elicits public demand for compliance. Yet, the extent to which human rights treaties affect public support for compliance is unclear. At times, legalization of norms seems to elicit substantial public support for compliance, but at other times, legalization seems to have little effect. This study incorporates the life cycle of norms to arrive at a deeper understanding of the conditions in which international legal commitments to human rights generate public support for compliance with human rights norms. Using a series of survey experiments, this study finds that the effect of legalization on public support depends on the internalization of the norm itself.
