title: InternationalTrade and LaborStandards: A Proposal for Linkage
abstract: Should some rights to engage in international trade be made conditional on the promotion of labor standards?  The critics of such conditionality, known as linkage, are right to be concerned about its possible adverse effects. However, linkage can be desirable.  A set of rules for international trade that incorporates linkage can serve the interests of developing countries, and in particular of less advantaged individuals within them - if it is unimposed, transparent and rule-based, applied in a manner reflecting a country's level of development, demands adequate international burden-sharing, and incorporates measures that ensure that appropriate account is taken of different viewpoints within each country.   Such a linkage system could substantially reduce the costs that are incurred by exporting countries when they attempt to promote the interests of workers. By enabling and encouraging countries to promote labor standards, an appropriate form of linkage can serve as a cornerstone of a worker-oriented world trading system.
ch_abstract: 是否应将某些从事国际贸易的权利与促进劳工标准挂钩？反对这种挂钩条件的批评者对其可能带来的负面影响表示担忧是正确的。然而，挂钩机制也可能具有积极意义。一套包含挂钩机制且非强制实施、透明、基于规则、根据国家发展水平灵活适用、要求合理分担国际责任、并纳入措施确保各国不同观点得到充分考量的国际贸易规则，能够符合发展中国家的利益，尤其是这些国家中弱势群体的利益。这种挂钩体系能显著降低出口国在维护劳动者权益时付出的代价。通过赋能并鼓励各国提升劳工标准，恰当的挂钩机制可成为以劳动者为核心的世界贸易体系的基石。
tags: linkage, labor standards, international trade, WTO

title: Adoption ofInternationalFinancial ReportingStandardsand the Cost of Adverse Selection
abstract: This paper tests whether the adoption of International Financial Reporting Standards (IFRS) reduces the cost of adverse selection. We find that adverse selection costs fall only for firms that adopt IFRS before the mandated date. We also find that firms in countries with well-developed local reporting standards do not benefit from improved transparency as a result of IFRS adoption. We also find that IFRS adoption relies on strong local enforcement to have any significant impact on transparency. We conclude that IFRS adoption may be less effective if local standards are well-developed, or are poorly enforced.
ch_abstract: 本文检验了采用国际财务报告准则(IFRS)是否会降低逆向选择成本。我们发现，只有在强制实施日期前采用IFRS的企业，其逆向选择成本才会下降。我们还发现，本地报告准则完善国家的企业并未从IFRS采用带来的透明度提升中获益。研究同时表明，IFRS的采用需要强有力的本地执法支持，才能对透明度产生显著影响。我们得出结论：当本地准则已高度完善或执法不力时，采用IFRS的效果可能较为有限。
tags: Inventory holding premium, Information asymmetry, International Financial Reporting Standards, IFRS, Adverse selection

title: InternationalFinancialStandards: An Argument for Discernment
abstract: Multiple shocks have led regulators and policy makers to put increasing faith in the diagnostic and prophylactic powers of international financial standards, but the nature, appropriateness and normative force of such standards varies. As a standard setter, the International Organization of Securities Commissions (IOSCO) has pursued global consensus, harmonization and international best practices for many years. International standards, however, are often created under suboptimal conditions by actors with a broad range of motivations, assumptions and biases. Frictions between state-level regulation and international standards can undermine their effectiveness. This policy brief examines the process of standard setting and two very different sets of standards and their standard setters to illustrate some of the anomalies associated with them. The process has become more complex, more compromised and more politicized, leading in some cases to “pseudo-international” standards or a riot of diverse viewpoints, of limited practical use. The danger lies in major economies walking away from international standards which no longer demonstrate pertinence or credibility. Greater discernment should be exercised by state-level policy makers, international financial institutions and the international organizations themselves in proposing, deploying and implementing international standards.
ch_abstract: 多重冲击使得监管机构和政策制定者日益信赖国际金融标准的诊断与预防能力，但这些标准的性质、适用性及规范效力参差不齐。作为标准制定者，国际证券事务监察委员会组织（IOSCO）多年来致力于推动全球共识、协调统一与国际最佳实践。然而国际标准往往由动机、假设和偏见各异的参与方在非理想条件下制定。国家监管与国际标准之间的摩擦可能削弱其有效性。本政策简报通过考察标准制定过程及两组截然不同的标准与其制定机构，揭示其中存在的异常现象。该过程已变得更为复杂、更具妥协性且更政治化，导致某些情况下产生实用性有限的"伪国际"标准或观点纷杂的局面。主要经济体若因国际标准丧失相关性与可信度而弃之不用，将构成重大风险。国家政策制定者、国际金融机构及国际组织自身在提议、部署和实施国际标准时需加强辨别力。
tags: IOSCO, International Financial Standards, IMF, World Bank, Credit Rating Agencies, ESMA, CESR, OECD, G20/OECD Principles of Corporate Governance

title: How to Improve Monitoring and Enforcement ofInternationalLabourStandards?
abstract: Starting from an outline of the existing system, it is discussed how better monitoring and enforcement of international labour standards could be  ensured  in  the  future. Three  issues, in particular, are addressed in this  regard: improved cooperation between international   organisations including enhanced dialogue between courts and other supervisory bodies; the EU’s possible contribution to the enforcement of international labour standards; and the role of the private sector in the monitoring and enforcement of these standards.
ch_abstract: 从现有体系的概述出发，本文探讨了未来如何更好地监督和执行国际劳工标准。特别针对以下三个议题展开讨论：加强国际组织间的合作，包括促进法院与其他监督机构之间的对话；欧盟在推动国际劳工标准实施中可能发挥的作用；以及私营部门在监督和执行这些标准过程中扮演的角色。
tags: International labour standards, monitoring and enforcement, courts and supervisory bodies, ILO and other international actors, role of the EU, relevance of the private sector

title: AccountingStandardsand the Economics ofStandards
abstract: The paper draws on the economics of standards to inform current debates on international accounting standards. It traces the benefits claimed for standards - their contribution to the division of labour, innovation, trust, etc.; and the costs, including entry barriers and compliance costs. It illustrates these benefits and costs with cases from accounting regulation. It adopts two approaches to the question whether accounting regulation is best achieved by a single set of standards for the world, or by competing systems. The first approach focuses on contributions in economics, including the theory of standards races and of optimal variety. In these analyses, only in special circumstances has a single standard emerged as the superior outcome. The second approach introduces evidence from accounting and finance on the problems of translating with globalised financial markets, and on the relative costs and benefits of multiple standard-setters or a single global scheme. The most compelling net benefits of harmonisation arise for small economies moving from idiosyncratic to international standards.
ch_abstract: 本文借鉴标准经济学理论，为当前国际会计准则的讨论提供参考。文章梳理了标准带来的益处——促进劳动分工、推动创新、增强信任等；同时也分析了相关成本，包括准入门槛与合规支出。这些利弊关系均通过会计监管案例得以印证。针对"全球统一会计准则与竞争性体系孰优孰劣"的命题，研究采用双重论证路径：其一聚焦经济学领域成果，涵盖标准竞赛理论与最优多样性理论，这些分析表明单一标准仅在特定情境下才显现优势；其二引入会计金融领域的实证依据，既剖析全球化金融市场下的转换难题，又对比多元标准制定者与单一全球体系的成本效益。研究显示，协调统一带来的最大净效益体现在从小众标准转向国际准则的小型经济体身上。
tags: international accounting regulation, economics of standards

title: InternationalStandardsand the WTO TBT Agreement: Improving Governance for Regulatory Alignment
abstract: The WTO TBT Agreement obliges governments to use international standards as a basis for regulation, yet leaves a degree of flexibility with respect to the choice of standard, and the manner of its use. This interplay between obligation and flexibility has given rise to tension in various fora of the WTO, including in committee work, negotiations and dispute settlement. This paper brings together these three distinct strands of WTO work to illustrate core aspects of the international standards debate at the WTO. In our analysis we first briefly outline the nature of the discipline in the TBT Agreement itself; next, we describe where and how the discussion arises in the WTO; and, finally, explore some implications of governance of international standard setting. We propose that greater regulatory alignment could be achieved through a renewed focus on the procedures of setting international standards (the how), and greater emphasis on robust technical/scientific underpinnings of such standards (the what).
ch_abstract: WTO《技术性贸易壁垒协定》要求各政府以国际标准作为制定法规的基础，但在标准选择及使用方式上保留了一定灵活性。这种义务与灵活性的相互作用在WTO多个场合引发了紧张关系，包括委员会工作、谈判和争端解决。本文汇集了WTO这三类不同领域的工作，以阐明国际标准辩论在WTO中的核心议题。我们的分析首先简要概述了TBT协定中相关纪律的性质；其次描述了该讨论在WTO中出现的场合及方式；最后探讨了国际标准制定治理的若干影响。我们建议通过重新聚焦国际标准制定程序（方式问题），并更加强调此类标准坚实的技术/科学基础（内容问题），可以实现更高程度的监管协调。
tags: international trade, international standards, international cooperation, coherence, non-tariff barriers, technical barriers to trade, regulation

title: Problems of ImplementingInternationalAccountingStandardsin a Transition Economy: A Case Study of Russia
abstract: International Financial Reporting Standards (IFRS) and their predecessor, International Accounting Standards (IAS) are gaining in worldwide recognition. All publicly traded companies in the EU must adopt them by 2005 and many other countries either have adopted them or plan to do so in the near future. In 2002, the Russian Prime Minister announced that all Russian companies and banks must prepare their financial statements in accordance with international standards starting January 1, 2004. Implementing that decision will not be easy, for a variety of reasons. Not all international standards have been translated into Russian. Many Russian accountants are not sufficiently familiar with international standards to implement them. Some Russian universities have only recently started teaching international standards and the continuing education programs of the various Russian accounting associations are not yet prepared to offer comprehensive courses on international standards. Current Russian accounting standards conflict with international standards in several important ways and these conflicts will not be resolved in the near future. This paper reviews the literature on this subject and incorporates the results of interviews conducted of Russian accounting firms, enterprises and university professors in July and August 2003.
ch_abstract: 国际财务报告准则（IFRS）及其前身国际会计准则（IAS）正获得全球范围的认可。欧盟所有上市公司必须在2005年前采用这些准则，许多其他国家也已采用或计划在不久的将来采用。2002年，俄罗斯总理宣布自2004年1月1日起，所有俄罗斯公司和银行必须按照国际标准编制财务报表。由于多种原因，实施这一决定并非易事。并非所有国际准则都已翻译成俄文，许多俄罗斯会计师对国际准则不够熟悉，难以执行。一些俄罗斯大学最近才开始教授国际准则，而俄罗斯各会计协会的继续教育项目尚未准备好提供关于国际准则的全面课程。现行俄罗斯会计准则在多个重要方面与国际准则存在冲突，这些冲突短期内无法解决。本文回顾了相关文献，并整合了2003年7月至8月对俄罗斯会计师事务所、企业及大学教授的访谈结果。
tags: International Accounting Standards, IAS, International Financial Reporting Standards, IFRS, transition economy, Russia, accounting, accounting education, corporate governance, foreign direct investment, FDI

title: The Link between Adherence toInternationalStandardsof Good Practice, Foreign Exchange Spreads, and Ratings
abstract: This paper examines the relationship between adherence to international standards of good practice in policy-making and two key indicators of access to capital markets and the cost of this access: spreads and sovereign ratings. In contrast to other work, this study reviews a broad set of indicators for adherence to international standards. The estimations are conducted for emerging market economies, and pay particular attention to issues of persistence in spreads and ratings and nonlinearities in the relationships. The main finding confirms the expectation that standards are indeed relevant. Accounting standards and property rights are especially important for spreads, in addition to data transparency (SDDS subscription). Accounting standards and corruption are especially important in explaining ratings in addition to trade protectiveness (not a standard).
ch_abstract: 本文探讨了政策制定中遵循国际良好实践标准与两个关键资本市场准入指标及其成本（利差与主权评级）之间的关系。与其他研究不同，本研究采用了一套更全面的国际标准遵循评估指标。研究针对新兴市场经济体展开估算，特别关注利差与评级的持续性特征以及变量间的非线性关系。主要结论验证了研究假设：国际标准确实具有显著影响。会计准则与产权制度对利差影响尤为突出，数据透明度（SDDS订阅）同样重要；在解释主权评级方面，会计准则与腐败问题作用显著，贸易保护程度（非标准范畴）也具有解释力。
tags: Standards and codes, foreign exchange spreads, credit ratings, crisis prevention

title: Research onInternationalStandardson Auditing: Literature Synthesis and Opportunities for Future Research
abstract: Research on International Standards on Auditing (ISAs) would greatly benefit from a research framework that categorizes the research streams related to ISAs and suggests areas for future research. This paper reviews the current research related to ISAs and develops a framework for analysis going forward. We identify seven main research streams: the development and history of ISAs; adoption of ISAs; association between national auditing standards and ISAs; financial reporting quality; audit reports; audit efficiency; and International Financial Reporting Standards (IFRS) compliance. For each research stream, the main results are summarized. At the conclusion of our literature reviews for each research stream, we suggest areas requiring further examination.
ch_abstract: 对国际审计准则（ISAs）的研究若能建立一个分类研究脉络并指明未来研究方向的分析框架，将获得极大助益。本文梳理了当前与ISAs相关的研究成果，构建了前瞻性分析框架。我们归纳出七大核心研究脉络：ISAs的发展历程与历史沿革；ISAs的采纳实施；各国审计准则与ISAs的关联性；财务报告质量；审计报告；审计效率；以及国际财务报告准则（IFRS）遵循情况。针对每个研究脉络，我们总结了主要研究成果。在每项研究脉络的文献综述结尾处，我们提出了需要深入探索的研究方向。
tags: Auditing, International Standards on Auditing, ISA, Harmonization

title: An Examination of Inventory Costing Convergence under Generally Accepted Accounting Principles andInternationalFinancial ReportingStandards
abstract: Accounting principles in the United States are converging toward international standards. If convergence continues, and there are proponents and detractors, then the U.S. system of accounting, called Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP), will eventually be replaced by International Financial Reporting Standards (IFRS). Convergence has profound implications for publicly traded companies and their many stakeholders such as investors, lenders, government agencies, and employees. A key issue facing accounting standard-setters is the treatment of inventory costing, an area in which GAAP and IFRS differ. This study addresses three research questions: What is the past and current usage of different inventory costing methods?, How important is inventory on corporate financial reports?, and What will be the impact on corporate financial reporting, specifically regarding inventory costing, if IFRS replaces GAAP? Findings show that a change from GAAP to IFRS will have a major impact on inventory costing and, as a result, on corporate financial reporting overall.
ch_abstract: 美国的会计原则正逐步与国际标准接轨。若这一趋同进程持续（既有支持者也有反对者），那么美国现行的通用会计准则（GAAP）终将被国际财务报告准则（IFRS）取代。这一变革对上市公司及其众多利益相关方——包括投资者、债权人、政府机构和员工——具有深远影响。会计准则制定者面临的关键问题在于存货成本核算的处理方式，这正是GAAP与IFRS存在差异的领域。本研究聚焦三个核心问题：不同存货成本核算方法的历史与现状如何？存货在企业财务报告中的重要性体现在何处？若IFRS取代GAAP，将对企业财务报告（特别是存货成本核算方面）产生何种影响？研究结果表明，从GAAP转向IFRS将对存货成本核算产生重大影响，进而全面重塑企业财务报告体系。
tags: International Financial Reporting Standards, IFRS, inventory costing, GAAP

title: IDPC Response to the 2008 Annual Report of theInternationalNarcotics Control Board
abstract: As in previous years, the 2008 Annual Report of the International Narcotics Control Board (INCB) contains a wealth of technical information on the operation of the international drug control system that attempts to manage the global licit market for narcotic and psychotropic substances for medical and research uses while simultaneously stifling the illicit market.  Interspersed with these operational descriptions are references and discussions on certain policy issues: primarily observations on the strengths and weaknesses of the system and what the INCB considers the main risks and threats to the effectiveness of that system.  While much of this data and debate is a welcome contribution to the policy process, the IDPC continues to be troubled with the selective and subjective nature of the INCB’s concerns; concerns that do not seem to flow from a balanced assessment of what constitutes non-compliance with the UN drug control conventions. In this response to the Annual Report attention is given to the INCB’s analysis of a number of interconnected issues, including the history of the drug control system and on its positions on three contemporary debates: harm reduction, the search for effective cannabis control, and the Bolivian request for reconsideration of the status of the coca leaf.  The response concludes that the INCB continues to be quick to condemn what it sees as any move towards liberalisation of policy and practice, while ignoring clear breaches of the spirit and letter of the conventions that arise from repressive policy in many countries.  Recognizing that the INCB has a crucial role to play within a global control system that is fit for purpose in the 21st century, it is argued that the Board will need to make significant changes to both its perspectives and operating procedures if it is to gain the confidence of many civil society and government stakeholders in the future.
ch_abstract: 与往年一样，2008年国际麻醉品管制局（INCB）年度报告包含了大量关于国际毒品管制体系运作的技术信息，该体系旨在管理用于医疗和科研用途的麻醉品和精神药物的全球合法市场，同时遏制非法市场。在这些运作描述中穿插着对某些政策问题的提及和讨论：主要是对该体系优势和弱点的观察，以及INCB认为对该体系有效性构成的主要风险和威胁。尽管这些数据和讨论大多是对政策进程的有益贡献，但国际药物政策联盟（IDPC）仍对INCB所关注问题的选择性和主观性感到不安；这些问题似乎并非基于对违反联合国毒品管制公约行为的平衡评估。在对年度报告的回应中，重点关注了INCB对一系列相互关联问题的分析，包括毒品管制体系的历史及其在三个当代辩论中的立场：减害、寻求有效的大麻管制，以及玻利维亚要求重新考虑古柯叶地位的请求。回应总结认为，INCB继续迅速谴责其认为任何政策与实践自由化的动向，同时忽视了许多国家压制性政策对公约精神和条款的明显违反。认识到INCB在适合21世纪的全球管制体系中扮演着关键角色，本文认为，若该机构希望在未来赢得许多民间社会和政府利益相关者的信任，就必须对其观点和运作程序进行重大调整。

title: LabourStandardsinInternationalTrade Agreements: An Assessment of The Arguments
abstract: In the 1980s and 1990s organized labour in industrialized countries was hit by the demise of traditional manufacturing industries, the ever-expanding globalization of the economy and the ideological dominance of economic liberalism and free trade. Support for the introduction of labour standards in the world trade regime grew out of these conditions. This paper introduces an analytical framework for the study of labour standards in international trade agreements (LSITA) and provides a detailed examination of the individuals and organizations involved in the debate and an analysis of their arguments and activities. Experiences of LSITA fall into four categories: (i) unilateral: child and prison labour legislation and corporate codes of conduct; (ii) bilateral: the GSP programmes; (iii) multilateral: attempts in the GATT/WTO; and (iv) regional: the Social Charter of the EU and the labour side agreement of NAFTA.In the opposition group are neoclassical economists and free trade theorists; major international employers; and some Third World governments and economic elites.Among the proponents belong neo-Keynesians and neo-institutionalists; 'ethical' international employers; trade unions; the ILO; governments and politicians in industrialized countries; and a plethora of NGOs and individual activists.
ch_abstract: 20世纪80至90年代，工业化国家的有组织劳工遭受了传统制造业衰落、经济全球化持续扩张以及经济自由主义和自由贸易思想占据主导地位的三重冲击。正是在此背景下，将劳工标准纳入全球贸易体系的呼声日益高涨。本文构建了一个分析国际贸易协定中劳工标准（LSITA）的研究框架，系统考察了相关争议中的参与主体及其主张与行动。LSITA实践呈现四种形态：（一）单边措施：童工与监狱劳动立法及企业行为准则；（二）双边机制：普惠制方案；（三）多边尝试：关贸总协定/世贸组织内的努力；（四）区域实践：欧盟社会宪章与北美自贸协定劳工附加协议。反对阵营包括新古典主义经济学家与自由贸易理论家、跨国雇主集团及部分第三世界政府与经济精英；支持群体则涵盖新凯恩斯主义者与新制度主义者、"道德型"跨国企业、工会组织、国际劳工组织、工业化国家政府与政界人士，以及众多非政府组织与个人活动家。
tags: Labour standards in international trade, workers' rights, social clause in trade

title: Rules andStandardsin the Application ofInternationalHumanitarian Law
abstract: Many scholars have written about the changes in international humanitarian law in recent years. Many have seen this change in the environment of International humanitarian law as a result of greater application of human rights in this area of law. This article approaches the changes in international humanitarian law from a different perspective, that of law and economics. The main claim in this article is that recent changes in international humanitarian law could be seen as a change from a rule based normative system, to a standard based one. The differences between a rule system and a standard system lie not in the complexity of the norms, but in the questions of who makes decisions and when are decisions taken. In a rule - the decisions are taken before the fact, and in a standard - after the fact. This article then evaluates the advantages and disadvantages of this move from rules to standards, and offers some observations and future possibilities for research.
ch_abstract: 近年来，许多学者撰文探讨国际人道法的变化。许多人认为，国际人道法环境的这一变化源于人权在该法律领域更广泛的应用。本文从法律与经济学的不同视角切入，分析国际人道法的变革。文章的核心观点是：近期国际人道法的变革可视为从基于规则的规范体系转向基于标准的体系。规则体系与标准体系的差异不在于规范的复杂性，而在于决策主体与决策时机的不同——规则体系事先制定决策，标准体系事后作出判断。本文进而评估了这种从规则到标准转变的利弊，并提出若干研究建议与未来可能的研究方向。
tags: International law, international humanitarian law, israel, rules, standards

title: The World Drug Report 2007 Still Winning the War on Drugs?
abstract: This IDPC Briefing reviews the data in the latest report from the UN Office on Drugs and Crime on the state of the global market, criticises the claims made in the report that international action is successfully controlling the market, and questions the political objectivity of the UNODC as we approach the review of the global objectives set in 1998.
ch_abstract: 这份IDPC简报审视了联合国毒品和犯罪问题办公室最新报告中关于全球市场状况的数据，批评了报告中关于国际行动正在成功控制市场的说法，并对在即将审查1998年设定的全球目标之际，联合国毒品和犯罪问题办公室的政治客观性提出了质疑。
tags: International policy, Policy evaluation, World, CND, ECOSOC, INCB, UNGASS, United Nations, UNODC

title: Patterns of Innovation:Standardsand Open Source
abstract: Standards and open source software have facilitated collaboration among implementers and developers to an extraordinary level, essentially allowing dispersed people and teams to innovate on a scale previous available only to large organizations. This paper discusses the similarities between the organizational patterns used support the quality, stability and accessibility of specifications and open source software, the role each play in the other’s success, and the role each can play in supporting public policy.
ch_abstract: 标准与开源软件极大地促进了实施者与开发者之间的协作，本质上使得分散的个人和团队能够实现以往只有大型组织才能达到的创新规模。本文探讨了用于保障规范与开源软件质量、稳定性和可访问性的组织模式之间的相似性，分析了两者在彼此成功中所起的作用，以及各自在支持公共政策方面所能发挥的作用。
tags: Standards, Open Source Development, Policy

title: Response to the 2007 Annual Report of theInternationalNarcotics Control Board
abstract: The latest INCB Annual Report was published on 4th March 2008. This brief response explains the contents of the report, and comments on the positions taken by the Board on proportionality in drug law enforcement, the scheduling of coca leaf, and harm reduction.
ch_abstract: 国际麻醉品管制局最新年度报告于2008年3月4日发布。本简短回应阐述了报告内容，并就该局在毒品执法比例性、古柯叶列管及减害措施等方面所持立场作出评论。
tags: Coca, Harm reduction, Law enforcement, World, CND, INCB, UNGASS, United Nations, UNODC

title: InternationalStandardsas Global Public Goods in the World Trading System
abstract: International standards have assumed special legal significance in the World Trade Organization (WTO) Agreement on Technical Barriers to Trade (‘TBT Agreement’). This article conceptualizes international standards as global public goods and argues for applying global administrative law principles to vet international standards before they are afforded quasi-legislative status in the WTO law. We traced how the WTO Appellate Body has changed its original hands-off approach in EC – Sardines in 2002 to a more intrusive approach in US – Tuna II in 2012. We submit that the WTO Appellate Body’s new approach to international standards marks a distinctive pathway for the development of global administrative law in producing global public goods.The compliance with global administrative law principles set out in the TBT Committee Decision in turn provides international standardizing bodies with additional legitimacy and accountability. However, contrary to popular opinion, we submit that adoption by consensus is not a necessary condition for a standard to be recognized as an international standard in the world trading system.
ch_abstract: 国际标准在《世界贸易组织技术性贸易壁垒协定》（简称《TBT协定》）中具有特殊的法律意义。本文将国际标准概念化为全球公共产品，并主张在赋予其WTO法律准立法地位前，应运用全球行政法原则对其进行审查。我们追溯了WTO上诉机构如何从2002年"欧共体－沙丁鱼案"最初的不干预态度，转变为2012年"美国－金枪鱼案(Ⅱ)"中更具介入性的立场。我们认为，上诉机构对国际标准的新态度标志着全球行政法在制定全球公共产品过程中形成了一条独特发展路径。符合TBT委员会决议所载全球行政法原则，反过来为国际标准制定机构提供了额外的合法性与问责性。但与普遍观点相反，我们认为协商一致通过并非标准被世界贸易体系认定为国际标准的必要条件。
tags: International Standards, TBT Agreement, WTO, Global Public Goods, Global Administrative Law

title: The Missing Links In The Chains? Mutual Distributed Ledger (aka Blockchain)Standards
abstract: Commissioned by the States of Alderney, PwC, and the Cardano Foundation, Z/Yen engaged with over seventy people representing developers, regulators, standards bodies, lawyers, financiers, business-people, accountants, and potential users, to answer a number of questions:What are the potential risks associated with future widespread use of mutual distributed ledgers (MDLs), and what are their implications?How do distributed ledgers fit within existing regulatory frameworks? Are existing laws sufficient to cover the activities supported by distributed ledgers, or is new legislation is needed?Would MDLs benefit from the development of standards? Which sectors and services might need MDLs most?What different paths could be taken to create standards?MDLs hold immense promise, although the spectrum of opinion regarding their future varied widely. Developers, naturally, saw a host of opportunities to transform business practices and offer new services. The financial services sector held the most nuanced views, perhaps due to their sensitivities about disruption in payments. The prevailing view was that firms would inevitably use MDLs, though with understandable caution about governance and compliance issues. Public sector bodies were less aware of the potential that MDLs held, but there was some quiet enthusiasm. Amongst professional and financial services, views were mixed. There was extreme skepticism contrasting with extreme enthusiasm in legal services. The pessimism was anticipation of less future business when things go right. The optimism prompted by a hope that smart contracts were rather likely to generate commercial conflicts.So how should regulators view distributed ledger technology? Regulators carry out three primary roles: promoting competition, maintaining the integrity of markets, and interpreting jurisdictional policy. MDLs have the potential both to support and hinder these functions.In terms of competition, the key feature of MDLs is their challenge to the natural monopolies created by central third parties.In terms of market integrity the transparent nature of MDLs greatly reduces the opportunities for theft and fraud, though encryption could make establishing the identities of buyers and sellers more difficult.In terms of enforcement, the transparency of MDLs and the permanence of transactions logged on the chain should make regulatory tasks easier, though, as MDLs are more likely to operate across jurisdictions they could provoke regulatory conflict.All new technology carries risk, but what exactly does this mean in the context of MDLs?We can categorize the risks associated with MDLs into a number of areas, but three occupied the thoughts of the majority of the practitioners we spoke with.Governance: organisations will need to put in place many inter-organisational structures to manage MDLs. How will errors be corrected? Who will have authority to write to the ledger? Will there be a central authority who can make changes to the records, or change the entire system to help it evolve?Liability and Responsibility: How should high risk activities such as AML and KYC be handled? Who will ‘carry the can’ if things go wrong? What systems are in place to manage and resolve disputes?Taxonomies: What exactly is any specific MDL in front of a regulator, permissioned-unpermissioned, public-private, opaque-transparent, proof-of-work, proof-of-stake, voting, woven broadcasting? What are the tolerances and performance capabilities? These questions are of pressing concern to users but, as this is a rapidly developing field, a common language has not yet been developed.MDLs will realize their potential to contribute to economic growth when the technology is widely diffused and used. Diffusion itself results from a series of individual decisions to begin using the new technology, decisions which are often the result of a comparison of the uncertain benefits of the technology with the uncertain costs of adopting it. It is diffusion, rather than invention or innovation, that ultimately determines the pace of economic growth and the rate of change of productivity, and until many users adopt MDL technology it may contribute little to our well-being.The key to ensuring widespread diffusion is ensuring that distributed ledgers are viewed as a safe, reliable technology, but how can regulators assist with this?Regulators have two primary levers they can use, regulation and standards:Regulation is sometimes a knee-jerk response by policy makers to perceived risk. While it can be speedy and authoritative, the process to create regulations can be distanced from the participants, resulting in unnecessary burdens or unforeseen consequences. Standards, if implemented as part of a voluntary standards market with strict certification and accreditation can be highly effective. However, adoption can be slower and piecemeal. Voluntary standards without certification and accreditation are little more than guidance notes. They have no sanction for non-compliance and they are not an effective tool for regulators. Without certification, there is no independent verification that a standard has been met. A strong voluntary standards market requires verifiers to be accredited, as this ensures quality and indemnity behind certification. This triple-lock; standards, certification and accreditation, is the bedrock of a voluntary standards market.It is important to remember that in the majority of cases MDLs will support existing services that have existing processes and support technologies. There will be a rich standards and regulation landscape that they must negotiate in order to be fit for purpose. Simpler, less regulated domains are more likely to adopt MDL approaches earlier, particularly where MDLs can solve an unaddressed problem, e.g. know-your-customer/anti-money-laundering/ultimate-beneficial-ownership in financial services, and offer a difference to traditional central third party approaches, e.g. meeting EU General Data Protection Regulation for the “right to be forgotten” surrounding identity documentation.Are new regulations needed for MDLs? MDLs will, in the majority of cases, be deployed into existing regulatory environments. Unless regulations specifically stipulate the use of third party intermediaries, they are likely to be sufficient to cover the activities supported by MDLs.There was considerable interest amongst participants in the area of so called “smart contracts”, this is dealt with in detail in the report, but in summary, stating that “the code is law” is not a sufficient response, and the real world legal agreements that connect organizations to smart contracts will need to be very carefully constructed.This diagram represents the standards environment. At its core are technical standards that determine how technologies perform. At its periphery are thematic standards dealing with the generic issues every organisation must deal with. Sandwiched between these two are sector specific standards which deal with activities and processes.From our discussions with participants we conclude that it is probably too early to begin developing performance standards for MDLs. The technology is still evolving and technical standards would stifle innovation, though there is scope to consider carbon standards for proof-of-work cryptocurrency applications. Participants felt that existing thematic standards, such as ISO9000 for quality management or ISO 31000 for risk management, were probably flexible enough to cover the use of MDLs. Most participants felt most benefits lay in sectoral standards, with three salient points:There is a need to develop a common language to categorize and typify MDLs; There is a need to consider the way MDLs are managed and permissioned, how data is managed, who has access to it, how it can be changed or corrected, who pays for mistakes; There is a need to carefully consider liability and indemnity, particularly with respect to identity, and more widely helping to develop ‘trust structures’ that provide the multi-organisational, non-technical, cooperating framework. So what might standards in these areas look like?Taxonomies & performance standards need to be outcome-focused sets of definitions and characteristics, so that regulators and potential purchasers can assess MDLs based on their outputs, rather than the mechanics of how they operate; Data governance & liability standards need to pay fundamental attention to the civil liberty implications of data aggregation, sharing and mining; Commercial governance & liability standards need to structure how organisations link legally and contractually with MDLs. So how could a voluntary standards market be established? Three potential routes present themselves;ISO standards developed at a global level with national standards institutions and wider stakeholders. Standards Australia are considering this route on technical standards for block-chains. ISO standards carry immense credibility because of their well-established model for certification and accreditation, but the ISO path can be a long one;Publically Available Specifications (PASs) created with a national standards institution, perhaps later rolled-out as an ISO standard. This route has the advantage of creating standards which are close to the industries they are intended for, resulting in cost-effective and streamlined solutions.Open process standards work up from industry participants, but can suffer from a tendency to certification and accreditation procedures, the end result can lack credibility.In conclusion, “The Missing Links in the Chains” confirms that the establishment of a voluntary standards market may be beneficial in promoting the uptake of MDLs by providing certainty to both users and developers, while assisting regulators in fulfilling their duties. Further consideration is needed on the scope of ‘taxonomies & performance’, ‘data governance & liability’, and ‘commercial governance & liability’. And of course, a big question mark about what group is prepared to pay to take standards forward?
ch_abstract: 受奥尔德尼岛政府、普华永道和卡尔达诺基金会委托，泽尼咨询公司调研了七十余位代表开发者、监管机构、标准组织、律师、金融从业者、商人、会计师及潜在用户的专业人士，旨在解答以下核心问题：未来广泛应用的互惠分布式账本（MDL）存在哪些潜在风险及其影响？分布式账本如何适配现有监管框架？现行法律是否足以覆盖其支持的业务活动，抑或需要新立法？MDL是否会受益于标准制定？哪些行业服务最需要MDL？制定标准可采取哪些不同路径？. . 尽管对MDL前景的看法差异显著，其巨大潜力已获公认。开发者自然视其为变革商业实践和提供新服务的机遇。金融服务业因对支付领域颠覆的敏感性持最审慎态度，普遍认为企业终将采用MDL，但对治理与合规问题保持合理谨慎。公共部门对MDL潜力认知有限，但存在隐性热情。专业与金融服务领域观点分化，法律界呈现极端怀疑与极度乐观的两极——悲观者预期业务量将因技术完善而缩减，乐观者则寄望智能合约引发商业纠纷带来机遇。. . 监管者应如何看待分布式账本技术？其三大核心职能——促进竞争、维护市场完整性和解释管辖政策——均可能被MDL强化或削弱。就竞争而言，MDL关键特性在于挑战中心化第三方形成的自然垄断；市场完整性方面，其透明特性虽大幅降低盗窃欺诈可能，但加密技术或增加买卖双方身份核验难度；执法层面，交易链上永久存证虽简化监管任务，但跨境运作特性可能引发监管冲突。. . MDL相关风险可归为三类，从业者最关注：治理（需建立跨组织管理架构，纠错机制、账本写入权限、系统演进决策权归属）、责任划分（反洗钱等高风险活动处理、事故追责机制、争议解决体系）、分类体系（监管面对的具体MDL属性判定：许可/非许可、公有/私有、透明/不透明、工作量证明/权益证明/投票/广播等机制的性能容限）。这些迫切问题尚未形成统一术语体系。. . MDL对经济增长的贡献取决于技术普及度。普及源于个体对技术不确定收益与采纳成本的权衡，正是普及而非发明创新最终决定经济增长与生产率变化速度。确保广泛普及的关键在于建立安全可靠的技术形象，监管者可通过两种杠杆实现：监管与标准。监管虽是政策制定者对风险的快速反应，但可能脱离实践导致负担；而具备严格认证体系的志愿性标准市场则更为高效。需注意无认证的自愿标准仅具指导性，有效标准市场需构建"标准-认证-认可"三位一体机制。. . 多数情况下MDL将服务于现有业务，需适应庞杂的标准与监管体系。监管空白领域（如金融业中客户身份识别/反洗钱/最终受益人确认）或更早采用MDL方案，尤其是能解决传统中心化模式痛点（如满足欧盟《通用数据保护条例》"被遗忘权"要求）的场景。现有监管框架通常足以覆盖MDL活动，除非法规明确要求第三方中介。参与者对"智能合约"尤为关注，但"代码即法律"远不足够，需精心设计连接组织与智能合约的现实法律协议。. . 标准环境可分为三层核心：决定技术性能的技术标准、处理通用议题的主题标准、针对行业活动的领域标准。与从业者讨论表明，目前制定MDL性能标准为时尚早，技术演进可能受限于过早标准化（工作量证明加密货币的碳足迹标准除外）。现有主题标准（如ISO9000质量管理、ISO31000风险管理）已足够灵活。领域标准建设最具价值，需聚焦三点：建立MDL分类通用术语体系；规范数据管理权限、纠错机制及责任归属；构建身份识别等领域的责任赔偿框架及多组织非技术性"信任结构"。. . 具体标准应具备以下特征：分类与性能标准需结果导向，便于监管者和购买者基于输出而非运作机制评估MDL；数据治理标准需重点关注数据聚合、共享及挖掘的公民自由影响；商业治理标准需明确组织与MDL的法律契约连接方式。建立志愿性标准市场有三条路径：ISO全球标准（权威但周期长）、国家标准机构推出的公开可用规范（PAS，可后续升级为ISO标准）、行业自下而上的开放流程标准（可能缺乏认证严谨性）。. . 《链条缺失的环节》最终确认：建立志愿性标准市场可通过为用户和开发者提供确定性来促进MDL采纳，同时辅助监管履职。"分类与性能"、"数据治理与责任"、"商业治理与责任"三大范畴需深入探讨。核心问题在于：哪方群体愿为标准推进承担成本？
tags: Mutual Distributed Ledger Standards, MDLs, Standards

title: The World Drug Report 2010: A Response from theInternationalDrug Policy Consortium
abstract: The aim of this review is to provide an overview and analysis of the contents of the 2010 UNODC World Drug Report and highlight a number of key issues of interest and concern. The authors begin with a critique of Mr. Costa’s contribution to the publication and often the only part of the 300-page document that receives significant attention: the Executive Director’s Foreword. They also reflect briefly upon his tenure at the UNODC between 2002 and 2010. Mindful of the volume of market related and trend oriented data within the Report, the authors then move onto to provide a summary of the global picture as presented by the UNODC in the main body of the text. Within this section, they also highlight ongoing examples of the Office’s increasingly sophisticated and transparent methodology. This approach emphasizes the continuingly high levels of uncertainty concerning many aspects of the global market. This is followed by discussion of a reoccurring theme running throughout the Report; the issue of displacement. The final section of this IDPC report is devoted to a discussion of chapter three of this year’s publication, 'The Destabilizing Influence of Drug Trafficking on Transit Countries: The Case of Cocaine.'
ch_abstract: 本综述旨在概述并分析2010年联合国毒品和犯罪问题办公室《世界毒品报告》的内容，重点探讨若干关键议题。作者首先评价了科斯塔先生对该报告的贡献——这份300页文件中唯一常受关注的部分，即执行主任前言，并简要回顾了他2002至2010年任职期间的作为。鉴于报告中大量市场相关数据和趋势分析，作者随后概括了联合国毒品和犯罪问题办公室在正文中呈现的全球态势，同时指出该机构日益精密透明的方法论案例，这种方法凸显出全球毒品市场诸多方面仍存在高度不确定性。接着讨论了贯穿报告的核心议题——毒品市场转移现象。国际药物政策理事会报告的最后部分专门探讨了本年报告第三章《毒品贩运对过境国的破坏性影响：以可卡因为例》。
tags: ATS, cannabis, coca, cocaine, demand reduction, ecstasy, heroin, international policy, opium, supply reduction, UNODC

title: Past and Future of Central Bank Cooperation: Policy Panel Discussion
abstract: On 27-29 June 2005, the BIS held its fourth Annual Conference on Past and Future of Central Bank Cooperation, as part of the Bank's 75th anniversary celebrations. The event brought together some 80 senior representatives of central banks, academic institutions and the private sector to exchange views on this topic. The conference was opened with addresses by Tommaso Padoa-Schioppa (former member of the Executive Board, ECB) and William White (Economic Adviser, BIS). It was closed with a Policy Panel discussion: "Reflections on the future of central bank cooperation". The panel discussion was chaired by the BIS General Manager Malcolm D Knight. The panellists were Andrew D Crockett (JP Morgan Chase), Jacques de Larosiýre (Paribas), Allan Meltzer (Carnegie Mellon University), Paul Volcker (International Accounting Standards Committee), and Yutaka Yamaguchi (former Deputy Governor, Bank of Japan). Their contributions are contained in this BIS Paper.
ch_abstract: 2005年6月27日至29日，国际清算银行（BIS）举办了第四届"央行合作的历史与未来"年度会议，作为该行成立75周年庆祝活动的一部分。此次会议汇聚了约80位来自中央银行、学术机构和私营部门的高级代表，就这一主题展开观点交流。会议开幕式由欧洲央行前执行董事会成员托马索·帕多阿-斯基奥帕和国际清算银行经济顾问威廉·怀特致辞。闭幕环节举行了题为"对央行合作未来的思考"的政策讨论会，由国际清算银行总经理马尔科姆·奈特主持。讨论小组成员包括摩根大通的安德鲁·克罗克特、巴黎银行的雅克·德拉罗西埃、卡内基梅隆大学的艾伦·梅尔策、国际会计准则委员会的保罗·沃尔克以及日本银行前副总裁山口裕。他们的发言内容收录于本期国际清算银行论文集中。

title: Banking Reform in China: Driven byInternationalStandardsand Chinese Specifics
abstract: This paper reviews the progress of banking reforms in China over the last five years. The stated goal of reform is to "transform major banks into internationally competitive joint-stock commercial banks with appropriate corporate governance structures, adequate capital, stringent internal controls, safe and sound business operations, quality services as well as desirable profitability." The reform strategy relies on three pillars - extensive publicly-financed bailouts, implementation of the international best practices in bank governance and regulation and listing of major banks at the Hong Kong stock exchange. This strategy has been successful in stabilizing the three major banks. However, our review of academic and commercial research indicates that there is no evidence that the stabilization is sustainable. Prudential indicators of the largest banks are comparable to international averages, but this is an outcome of large bail outs and ongoing credit boom rather than fundamental change in banker's incentives. Reforms of bank governance and regulatory framework need more time to proliferate throughout the banking and regulatory hierarchies. However, time alone would not solve the problem as the reform design retains important departures from international standards. These standards are implemented in a selective manner; those aspects that help to concentrate key powers in the center are implemented rather vigorously, whereas principles that require independence of banks' boards and regulators are ignored. Thus the largest Chinese banks remain under the firm state control and can be used as development policy tools for the better or the worse.
ch_abstract: 本文回顾了过去五年中国银行业改革的进展。改革宣称的目标是"将主要银行转变为具有适当公司治理结构、充足资本、严格内控、安全稳健运营、优质服务及良好盈利能力的国际竞争力股份制商业银行"。改革战略依托三大支柱——大规模公共资金救助、实施国际最佳银行治理与监管实践以及在香港交易所上市主要银行。该策略已成功稳定了三大银行，但学术与商业研究显示尚无证据表明这种稳定具有可持续性。大型银行的审慎指标与国际平均水平相当，但这源于巨额救助和持续的信贷繁荣，而非银行家激励机制的实质性变革。银行治理与监管框架改革需要更长时间渗透至整个银行与监管体系，但仅靠时间无法解决问题，因改革方案仍存在与国际标准的重要偏离。这些标准被选择性执行：有助于集中核心权力至中央的方面得到有力落实，而要求银行董事会和监管机构独立性的原则则被忽视。因此中国大型银行仍受国家牢牢掌控，可能被用作发展政策工具——无论利弊。
tags: China, banks, reform, international standards

title: Private Global Regulation: The Politics of SettingStandardsforInternationalProduct and Financial Markets
abstract: Divergent national standards often inhibit trade in goods and services. Consequently, the setting of international standards is rapidly becoming an issue of considerable economic and political salience.  But who sets international standards? Who wins, who loses?  Building on previous studies we have done, we are presenting in this paper a first general theory of international regulatory processes that take place in non-governmental institutional settings.   Largely overlooked in IPE, these processes have moved to center-stage of global regulation as states have delegated ever-greater regulatory authority to transnational non-governmental bodies.  Our theory provides a comprehensive account of how domestic or regional institutional features of private-sector groups systematically shape the politics of global regulation.  We test a series of propositions on data collected by us through international business surveys over the last six years, covering both product and financial markets. We conclude by highlighting the challenges to global due process and democratic governance identified by our research.
ch_abstract: 各国标准不一往往阻碍商品和服务贸易。因此，国际标准的制定正迅速成为具有重大经济和政治意义的议题。但谁在制定国际标准？谁赢谁输？基于我们既往研究，本文首次提出关于非政府机构背景下国际监管进程的通用理论。随着各国将越来越多的监管权授予跨国非政府机构，这些被国际政治经济学长期忽视的进程已跃居全球监管的核心舞台。我们的理论全面阐释了私营部门群体的国内或区域制度特征如何系统性影响全球监管政治。通过分析过去六年国际商业调查中收集的产品与金融市场数据，我们验证了一系列理论命题。最后着重指出本研究发现的对全球正当程序与民主治理的挑战。
tags: international political economy, finance, accounting, standards, international organizations, non-state actors

title: The Role ofInternationalActors in Post-Communist Countries: Coercion or Persuasion? The Transfer of Hospital DesignStandardsbyInternationalOrganizations and Private Firms
abstract: This paper explores the role of international actors in post-communist transformation. By taking the case of hospital design standards, it explains how the national actors choose to leave aside the national regulations and to adopt foreign technical standards. The paper takes the case of technical standards employed for the modernization of healthcare facilities in Ukraine and Moldova. An in-depth comparative case study of two projects revealed that national architects of these post-soviet countries use foreign standards. While the change of standards is a similar outcome in both cases, the international actors involved are different. My findings suggest that while both international organizations and private actors diffuse foreign technical standards in post-soviet countries, the processes through which they realize it differs. Whereas international organizations dispose of coercive means to impose foreign solutions, private actors need to negotiate and to convince for their adoption. Drawing on recent debates on policy diffusion and transfer (Dolowitz and Marsh 2012; 2000, Simmons and al. 2008, Stone 2010, 2012), the results shed light on “carriers” of institutional arrangements among different political systems.
ch_abstract: 本文探讨了国际行为体在后共产主义转型中的作用。通过医院设计标准的案例，文章阐释了国家行为体如何选择搁置本国法规而采用外国技术标准。研究以乌克兰和摩尔多瓦医疗设施现代化过程中采用的技术标准为例，对两个项目进行深入比较案例研究发现：这些后苏联国家的建筑师均采用了外国标准。虽然标准变更的结果相似，但所涉国际行为体却各不相同。研究结果表明：尽管国际组织和私营行为体都在后苏联国家传播外国技术标准，但其实现路径存在差异——国际组织可通过强制性手段推行外国方案，而私营行为体则需通过协商说服来实现标准采纳。基于政策扩散与转移的最新讨论（Dolowitz and Marsh 2012; 2000, Simmons et al. 2008, Stone 2010, 2012），研究结果揭示了不同政治体系间制度安排的"传播载体"。
tags: transfer, standards, international actors, post-soviet states

title: Guide to theInternationalBanking Statistics
abstract: Note: This document has been superseded by Guidelines to the international locational banking statistics and Guidelines to the international consolidated banking statistics This Guide to the international banking statistics is intended to serve two main purposes: firstly, to provide reporting countries with definitions and guidelines for the reporting of data; secondly, to give a detailed account of current country practices regarding the coverage and disaggregation of the reported data. The Guide describes two statistical systems, the locational banking statistics and the consolidated banking statistics. It replaces the previous issue (July 2000) and includes numerous changes and updates to the tables on countries' reporting practices. The locational banking statistics, which are described in Part I, gather quarterly data on international financial claims and liabilities of bank offices resident in the reporting countries broken down by currency, sector and country of residence of counterparty, and by nationality of reporting banks. In this system, both domestic and foreign-owned banking offices in the reporting countries record their positions on a gross (unconsolidated) basis, including those vis-ý-vis own affiliates, which is consistent with the principles of national accounts, balance of payments and external debt statistics. The statistics were introduced with a breakdown by major individual currencies and a partial sectoral and geographical breakdown at the beginning of the 1970s to provide information on the development and growth of the eurocurrency markets. In the subsequent years, the issue of recycling oil-related surpluses and the accompanying rise in international indebtedness shifted the emphasis in favour of a more detailed geographical breakdown and of flow data. The outbreak of the debt crisis in the early 1980s stimulated further efforts to refine both the geographical coverage of the data and the estimates of exchange rate adjusted flows. In the early 1990s, strong interest arose in making use of these statistics to improve the coverage and accuracy of the recording of balance of payments transactions. Following the financial crises in emerging economies in the late 1990s the locational banking statistics became an important component of the Joint BIS-IMF-OECD-World Bank Statistics on External Debt, which were developed in response to requests for dissemination of more timely external debt indicators. The consolidated banking statistics, which are described in Part II, collect quarterly data on banks' international financial claims broken down by remaining maturity and sector of borrower. In addition, they include information on exposures by country of immediate borrower and on the reallocation of claims (ie risk transfers) to the country of ultimate risk. The latter is defined as the country where the guarantor of a claim resides. The data mainly cover claims reported by domestic bank head offices, including the exposures of their foreign affiliates, and are collected on a worldwide consolidated basis with inter-office positions being netted out. The statistics also provide separate data on international claims of foreign bank offices whose head offices are located outside the reporting countries on an unconsolidated basis. The statistics were introduced as a semiannual reporting exercise in the late 1970s and early 1980s to provide information on the country risk exposures of major individual nationality banking groups to developing countries. Following the financial crises in emerging economies in the late 1990s, the consolidated banking statistics were enhanced to include complete country coverage of banks' on-balance sheet exposures, separate country data on an ultimate risk basis and a move to a quarterly reporting frequency. In response to recommendations of a working group of the CGFS, and in order to maintain the consolidated banking statistics as a key source of public information on international financial market developments, it is planned to improve the measurement of commercial banks' consolidated country risk exposures on an ultimate risk basis. Consequently, the statistics will, as from end-2004, cover more detailed and comprehensive data on country risk exposures inclusive of derivatives and other off-balance sheet positions. Part III of this Guide provides a glossary of terms used in the locational and consolidated banking statistics, while part IV contains a list of international organisations (Appendix 1) and official monetary authorities (Appendix 2). Beginning in 1998, the BIS has invited a number of additional countries, in particular from emerging markets, to participate in the international banking statistics. This is intended to further increase the global coverage of the statistics. So far, 12 economies have joined the locational (Australia, Bermuda, Brazil, Chile, Guernsey, India, Isle of Man, Jersey, Panama, Portugal, Taiwan (China) and Turkey) and nine have joined the consolidated (Brazil, Chile, Hong Kong, India, Panama, Portugal, Singapore, Taiwan (China), and Turkey) banking statistics, with more countries expected to be included in the near future. The Guide has been prepared with the assistance of the central banks or official authorities contributing to the two sets of international banking statistics. The BIS is grateful to all these institutions for their cooperation and valuable advice in its preparation. Note: This document supersedes "The Guide to the International Banking Statistics" (July 2000)
ch_abstract: 注：本文件已被《国际银行区位统计指南》和《国际银行合并统计指南》所取代。本《国际银行统计指南》旨在实现两个主要目的：一是为报告国提供数据报告的定义和指导；二是详细说明当前各国在报告数据的覆盖范围和分类方面的做法。本指南描述了两大统计体系——区位银行统计与合并银行统计。它取代了前一版（2000年7月），并对各国报告实践表格进行了大量修改和更新。. . 第一部分阐述的区位银行统计按季度收集报告国境内银行机构的国际金融债权与负债数据，并按货币、部门、交易对手居住国及报告银行国籍进行细分。该体系要求报告国境内的本国与外资银行机构以总额（未合并）形式记录头寸（包括与关联机构的交易），这符合国民账户、国际收支和外债统计原则。该统计于1970年代初推出时，按主要货币分类并包含部分部门和地域细分，旨在追踪欧洲货币市场的发展。随后因石油相关盈余回流及国际债务问题加剧，统计重点转向更详细的地域分类和流量数据。1980年代初的债务危机推动了对数据地理覆盖范围和汇率调整流量估算的进一步优化。1990年代初，这些统计被广泛用于提升国际收支交易的记录覆盖面和准确性。1990年代末新兴经济体金融危机后，区位银行统计成为"BIS-IMF-OECD-世界银行联合外债统计"的重要组成部分，该体系是为响应提高外债指标时效性的需求而建立。. . 第二部分阐述的合并银行统计按季度收集银行国际金融债权数据，并按剩余期限、借款部门分类，同时包含直接借款国风险敞口信息及债权重分配（即风险转移）至最终风险国的数据（最终风险国定义为债权担保人所在国）。数据主要涵盖国内银行总行及其海外分支机构的全球合并报表（剔除内部头寸），并单独列示总部位于报告国境外的外资银行机构的未合并国际债权。该统计最初于1970年代末至1980年代初作为半年度报告推出，用于监测主要跨国银行集团对发展中国家的国别风险敞口。1990年代末金融危机后，统计范围扩展至银行表内敞口的全国家覆盖、基于最终风险的国别数据细分，并改为季度报告。根据全球金融体系委员会工作组的建议，为保持该统计作为国际金融市场发展核心公共信息来源的地位，计划从2004年底起纳入包含衍生品及其他表外头寸的更全面国别风险敞口数据。. . 本指南第三部分提供两大统计体系的术语表，第四部分列出国际组织（附录1）和官方货币当局（附录2）名录。自1998年起，国际清算银行邀请更多新兴市场国家加入统计体系以扩大全球覆盖面。目前已有12个经济体加入区位统计（澳大利亚、百慕大、巴西、智利、根西岛、印度、马恩岛、泽西岛、巴拿马、葡萄牙、中国台湾和土耳其），9个加入合并统计（巴西、智利、中国香港、印度、巴拿马、葡萄牙、新加坡、中国台湾和土耳其），预计未来将有更多国家参与。. . 本指南在参与两大国际银行统计的各国央行及官方机构协助下完成，国际清算银行对所有合作机构提供的宝贵建议深表感谢。注：本文件取代《国际银行统计指南》（2000年7月版）

title: Voluntary SustainabilityStandards
abstract: This article begins by explaining private standards in an international context. On one hand, standards have an important role in shaping social environmental sustainability and therefore promoting economic, political, cultural and geographical development. On the other hand, their uncoordinated proliferation can generate misleading signals and measurements, compromising their ability to fulfill their role. The non-governmental nature of these regulations poses challenges to uniform standardization across the global value chain. In face of this problem, some countries have launched national platforms to establish minimal criteria on which the standard can be created. This study argues that this kind of meta-regulation is necessary.
ch_abstract: 本文首先阐释了国际背景下的私营标准。一方面，标准在塑造社会环境可持续性方面具有重要作用，从而促进经济、政治、文化和地理发展。另一方面，这些标准缺乏协调的激增可能产生误导性信号和衡量标准，削弱其发挥作用的能力。这些规范的非政府性质对全球价值链的统一标准化构成了挑战。针对这一问题，部分国家已建立国家平台来制定创建标准的最低准则。本研究认为此类元监管机制确有必要。
tags: voluntary sustainability standards, global governance, sustainable development, International Environmental Law

title: A Comparative Analysis of Required Financial Disclosures in US, UK andInternationalAccountingStandards
abstract: This paper explores the extent to which there are significant differences in disclosure requirements under US, UK, international accounting standards. Previous research into international disclosure diversity has focused on an analysis of disclosure practices in different countries rather than on disclosures required by regulations in different countries. Financial disclosures required by UK professional regulations and by International Accounting Standards (IASs) are summarised and classified using Barth and Murphy’s (1994) categorisation by purpose of disclosure and by category and subject. US, UK and international required disclosures are compared and areas of divergence are highlighted. Although differences in required disclosures between the three regulatory regimes are evident from the analysis, these differences are not significant in the multivariate models tested. A notable difference is greater required disclosures in the UK/IASs concerning entity structures (business combinations, consolidations, segmental reporting etc.).A greater proportion of US required disclosures address risks and potentials and assess returns. A much greater proportion of UK/IASs disclosures related to items recognised in accounts. The Financial Accounting Standards Board is currently examining the issue of disclosure effectiveness in the US. By highlighting areas of diversity in required disclosures in the US, UK and internationally this study will add insights to this discussion of disclosure effectiveness.
ch_abstract: 本文探讨了美国、英国及国际会计准则在披露要求上存在显著差异的程度。既往关于国际披露差异性的研究多聚焦于各国披露实践的分析，而非基于各国法规要求的披露内容。研究采用Barth和Murphy（1994）按披露目的及类别主题的分类框架，对英国专业准则与国际会计准则（IASs）要求的财务披露进行了系统归纳。通过对比美、英与国际准则的法定披露内容，重点揭示了关键分歧领域。分析表明：虽然三种监管体系在披露要求上存在明显差异，但这些差异在测试的多变量模型中并不显著。一个显著区别在于英国/IASs对实体结构（企业合并、合并报表、分部报告等）的披露要求更为严格；美国准则更高比例的披露涉及风险与潜力评估及收益预测；而英国/IASs的披露内容中与账目确认项目相关的比例明显更高。美国财务会计准则委员会当前正研究披露有效性问题，本研究通过厘清美、英及国际准则在法定披露要求上的差异领域，将为这场关于披露有效性的讨论提供新的认知视角。
tags: Financial Reporting, Accounting Standards, Required Disclosures, UK GAAP, US GAAP, International Accounting Standards

title: Fairness at Work: Federal LabourStandardsfor the 21st Century
abstract: On October 30, 2006 Commissioner Harry Arthurs delivered his report Fairness at Work: Federal Labour Standards for the 21st Century to the Minister of Labour, the Hon. Jean-Pierre Blackburn.
ch_abstract: 2006年10月30日，专员哈里·亚瑟斯向劳工部长让-皮埃尔·布莱克本阁下提交了题为《工作中的公平：21世纪联邦劳工标准》的报告。

title: The ILO Assessment ofInternationalLabourStandardsin Azerbaijan: Causes of Violations and Taken Measures
abstract: What are the causes of violations of international labour standards in Azerbaijan? In which way these standards are violated? What measures are taken (if any) by the government to deal with these violations?In this paper, I examine the Direct requests and Observations issued by the International Labour Organization in and following 2013 on situation of international labour standards in Azerbaijan. For the purpose of the paper I look into comments of the ILO on fundamental labour rights at workplace.
ch_abstract: 阿塞拜疆违反国际劳工标准的原因是什么？这些标准是如何被违反的？政府采取了哪些措施（如果有的话）来处理这些违规行为？在本文中，我研究了国际劳工组织在2013年及之后针对阿塞拜疆国际劳工标准状况发出的直接请求和观察意见。为了本文的目的，我查阅了国际劳工组织关于工作场所基本劳工权利的评论。
tags: International Labour Organization, international labour standards, fundamental labour rights, Azerbaijan, causes of violations

title: Examine of AccountingStandardsSetting Authorities in America,Internationaland Iran
abstract: In this article, considering that the role of America in Accounting standard, First financial Accounting Standards Board in America is examined in details. Then, considering that the magnifications that make in regard to acceptance of International Accounting Standards, presentation brief history of this standards set, will be showed that not only Europe Union accept this standards that set in combined accounting inventories level but also many countries in the worldwide Such as America, Canada and Japan haven't accepted this standard set and in spite of starting of symmetric projects, the date of the final of these projects is changing. In relation to discussion of Iran, either history or accounting standards of adjusted tables and International Accounting Standard are presented to show a high difference between two standard sets that creating of these differences and not be interpreted. International Accounting Standards, so, it is necessary that this problem be solved.
ch_abstract: 本文考虑到美国在会计准则中的角色，首先详细探讨了美国财务会计准则委员会。随后，鉴于国际会计准则采纳过程中的诸多争议，通过简要梳理该准则体系的发展历程，揭示出不仅欧盟在合并会计层面接受了这套标准，但全球范围内包括美国、加拿大和日本等众多国家尚未采纳。尽管协调项目已启动，其最终完成时间仍存在变数。关于伊朗的讨论部分，则通过对比本土调整表会计准则与国际会计准则的历史沿革，展示两者间的显著差异。这些差异的成因尚未得到合理解释，因此亟需解决这一问题。
tags: Standard enactment authorities in America, IASB (International Accounting Standards Board), Accounting Standards and International Financial reporting standards and their interpretation, countries that have accepted IFRS

title: Holding Standardisation to Competition LawStandards
abstract: This contribution discusses open standards in the software industry from a competition law enforcement perspective. While some of the observations may be of relevance to other sectors as well, those will not be addressed here. Open standards, as defined below, may benefit competition in software markets by enabling interoperability and thus avoiding customer lock-in and lowering barriers to entry.
ch_abstract: 本文从竞争法执法的角度探讨了软件产业中的开放标准问题。尽管部分观点可能也适用于其他行业，但本文不作讨论。如下文所定义的开放标准，能够通过实现互操作性来促进软件市场竞争，从而避免用户被锁定并降低市场准入门槛。
tags: EU, competition, law, standards, patents

title: The Value Relevance of Direct Cash Flows underInternationalFinancial ReportingStandards
abstract: This study examines if there has been a change in the value relevance of direct cash flow components since the adoption of International Financial Reporting Standards (IFRS) in Australia. Our results show that for both industrial and extractive firms direct cash flow statements are value relevant under Australian Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (AGAAP) and remain so after the adoption of IFRS. In addition, for industrial firms there is a significant increase in the value relevance of direct cash flows after IFRS, along with an increase in the value relevance of accruals. These results are consistent with the proposition that direct cash flows play a reinforcing role that complements the more complex IFRS accounts. Consequently, if the International Accounting Standards Board (IASB) were to mandate direct cash flow statements it would, in all likelihood, provide users of accounts with a valuable incremental source of hard transaction information.
ch_abstract: 本研究探讨了澳大利亚采用国际财务报告准则(IFRS)后，直接现金流量组成部分的价值相关性是否发生变化。研究结果表明，无论是工业企业还是采掘企业，在澳大利亚公认会计原则(AGAAP)下直接现金流量表都具有价值相关性，且在采用IFRS后依然保持。此外，对于工业企业而言，采用IFRS后直接现金流量的价值相关性显著提升，应计项目的价值相关性也有所增加。这些发现支持了直接现金流量对更复杂的IFRS账目具有补充强化作用的观点。因此，如果国际会计准则理事会(IASB)强制要求编制直接现金流量表，很可能会为财务报表使用者提供宝贵的增量硬交易信息来源。
tags: Cash flows and International Financial Reporting Standards, Direct cash flow method, IFRS cash flow value relevance

title: IDPC Advocacy Note Correcting a Historical Error: IDPC Calls on Countries to Abstain from Submitting Objections to the Bolivian - Proposal to Remove the Ban on the Chewing of the Coca Leaf
abstract: Several governments led by the United States are mobilising to block a request by the Bolivian government to remove an international ban on the centuries-old practice of chewing coca leaves. The 18-month period to contest Bolivia’s requested amendment ends January 31, 2011. In 2009, Bolivia’s first indigenous President, Evo Morales Ayma, sent a request to the United Nations to remove the unjustified ban on coca leaf chewing. This would amend the 1961 United Nations Single Convention on Narcotic Drugs and bring it in line with the 2007 UN Declaration on the Rights of Indigenous Peoples. Mr Morales sought to correct a historical error. He stated in his letter to the Secretary General: "Coca leaf chewing is one of the socio-cultural practices and rituals of the Andean indigenous peoples. It is closely linked to our history and cultural identity.” This ancestral practice "cannot and should not be prohibited.” In the 1990s, a study conducted by the World Health Organisation concluded that chewing coca causes none of the harmful health or social consequences as cocaine use.  The US blocked the publication of this evidence. The US and a number of other governments including the UK, France, Germany, Italy, Sweden, Denmark, the Russian Federation, Japan and Colombia are now planning to stop the right of Bolivians to express their own culture. They are planning to lodge formal objections to the amendment prior to the deadline on the January 31, 2011 which would result in the UN rejecting the Bolivian request. Jeremy Corbyn, a UK Member of Parliament and the Secretary of the All Party Parliamentary Group on Bolivia, said, “At a time when drug prohibition has enriched and emboldened criminal cartels to such an extent that they are attempting to violently annex the state in parts of Mexico and Guatemala, the US is expending considerable effort in blocking the Bolivian government’s legitimate and democratic right to protect and preserve a harmless indigenous practice. The international community needs to get its priorities right and resist this culturally ignorant attempt to dictate to indigenous people in Bolivia.” The International Drug Policy Consortium (IDPC) calls on countries not to oppose the amendment. Ann Fordham, the Coordinator of IDPC, stated, “Bolivia has made a reasonable and democratic request to the international community. The fact that predominantly western countries are unwilling to allow even the slightest amendments to the drug control regime, even where they conflict with the cultural and indigenous rights, is a very worrying development.”
ch_abstract: 以美国为首的多个国家政府正试图阻止玻利维亚政府提出的解除对咀嚼古柯叶这一古老习俗国际禁令的请求。针对玻利维亚修正案请求的18个月异议期将于2011年1月31日截止。2009年，玻利维亚首位原住民总统埃沃·莫拉莱斯向联合国提交申请，要求取消对咀嚼古柯叶的不合理禁令。这将修正1961年《联合国麻醉品单一公约》，使其与2007年《联合国原住民权利宣言》保持一致。莫拉莱斯总统旨在纠正历史错误，他在致联合国秘书长的信中指出："咀嚼古柯叶是安第斯原住民的社会文化实践与仪式，与我们的历史和文化认同紧密相连。"这项古老习俗"不能也不应被禁止"。上世纪90年代，世界卫生组织研究证实咀嚼古柯叶不会像可卡因那样危害健康或引发社会问题，但美国阻止了该证据的公布。目前美国联合英国、法国、德国、意大利、瑞典、丹麦、俄罗斯联邦、日本和哥伦比亚等国政府，企图剥夺玻利维亚人民表达自身文化的权利。这些国家计划在2011年1月31日截止日期前正式提出反对意见，这将导致联合国驳回玻利维亚的请求。英国议会玻利维亚事务小组秘书杰里米·科尔宾议员表示："当毒品禁令助长犯罪集团气焰，导致墨西哥和危地马拉部分地区暴力横行之际，美国却竭力阻挠玻利维亚政府保护无害传统习俗的合法民主权利。国际社会应分清轻重，抵制这种对玻利维亚原住民文化无知的干涉行为。"国际毒品政策 consortium（IDPC）呼吁各国不要反对该修正案。IDPC协调员安·福特汉姆指出："玻利维亚向国际社会提出了合理民主的请求。主要西方国家甚至不愿对毒品管制制度做出最微小的调整，即便这些规定与原住民文化权利相冲突，这种趋势令人深感忧虑。"
tags: Bolivia, Colombia, Denmark, France, Germany, Italy, Japan, Russia, Sweden, UK, USA, Access to essential medicines, Coca, Cocaine, Drugs and cultural heritage, Human rights, International policy, UN system incoherence, Latin America

title: The Impacts of PrivateStandardson Global Value Chains - Literature Review Series on the Impacts of PrivateStandards, Part I
abstract: While standards play an increasingly important role in international trade and global value chains, little is known about their actual impacts in these chains. By applying a systematic literature approach, this paper summarizes the key research findings to this question. We provide insights into the following issues: (i) how do standards impact value chain governance, including whether standards allow for ‘hands-off’ governance, (ii) what are the effects of mainstreaming strategies, (iii) how do standards change actors’ roles following standard adoption, and (iv) what leads to exclude some and involve others. Research also provides a good understanding of how value chain structure has changed following the implementation of standards and, conversely, how a certain structure/governance type allows for standard implementation along the chain. While upgrading opportunities is an important question for producers in the developing world, only a few studies researched this issue and many questions remain open. On the other hand, studies show that smallholders struggled when adopting standards and pointed out that the distribution of benefits is not even along the chain.
ch_abstract: 尽管标准在国际贸易和全球价值链中扮演着日益重要的角色，但人们对其在这些链条中的实际影响知之甚少。通过采用系统性文献研究方法，本文总结了针对该问题的主要研究发现。我们深入探讨了以下议题：（一）标准如何影响价值链治理，包括标准是否支持"放手式"治理；（二）主流化策略会产生哪些效应；（三）标准采纳后如何改变参与者的角色定位；（四）导致部分群体被排斥而其他群体被纳入的成因。研究还清晰揭示了标准实施后价值链结构的演变过程，以及特定结构/治理类型如何促成标准在链条中的贯彻实施。虽然升级机遇对发展中国家生产者至关重要，但仅有少数研究探讨该议题，诸多问题仍悬而未决。另一方面，研究表明小农在采纳标准时面临困境，并指出利益分配沿价值链呈现不均衡态势。
tags: Standards, Food standards, Certification, Value Chain, Trade, Bibliographies

title: DoInternationalLaborStandardsContribute to the Persistence of the Child Labor Problem?
abstract: In recent years, a number of governments and consumer groups in rich countries have tried to discourage the use of child labor in poor countries through measures such as product boycotts and the imposition of international labor standards. The purported objective of such measures is to reduce the incidence of child labor in developing countries and thereby improve children's welfare. In this paper, we examine the effects of such policies from a political-economy perspective. We show that these types of international action on child labor tend to lower domestic political support within developing countries for banning child labor. Hence, international labor standards and product boycotts may delay the ultimate eradication of child labor.
ch_abstract: 近年来，多个富裕国家的政府和消费者团体试图通过产品抵制、实施国际劳工标准等措施，阻止贫困国家使用童工。这类措施的公开目标在于减少发展中国家的童工现象，从而改善儿童福利。本文从政治经济学视角分析了此类政策的影响。研究表明，这类国际童工干预措施会削弱发展中国家内部禁止童工的本土政治支持。因此，国际劳工标准与产品抵制反而可能延缓彻底消除童工的进程。
tags: international labor standards, political economy, child labor, trade sanctions

title: Need for Harmonization ofInternationalAccountingStandards
abstract: Accounting is simply the language of business; like any other field of knowledge, it has its own rules, regulations, and standards, which differ from region to region, country to country, and economy to economy. Having single, universal standards is the dream of many accounting practitioners, but we are still a long way from achieving it. Harmonization is the process of increasing the level of agreement between accounting standards. This study seeks to describe the necessity for and obstacles to international financial standard harmonization. After reading papers, journals, and books, the researcher conducted a literature review to obtain a deeper understanding of the issue and provide a more comprehensive picture of the topic of the study as a whole.
ch_abstract: 会计只是商业的语言；与其他知识领域一样，它也有自己的规则、法规和标准，这些标准因地区、国家和经济体的不同而有所差异。拥有单一、通用的标准是许多会计从业者的梦想，但我们离实现这一目标还很遥远。协调是提高会计准则之间一致性的过程。本研究旨在描述国际财务标准协调的必要性和障碍。通过阅读论文、期刊和书籍，研究者进行了文献综述，以更深入地理解这一问题，并对研究的主题提供更全面的概述。
tags: Harmonization, Accounting standards

title: China's Capital Account Liberalisation:InternationalPerspective
abstract: This volume collects the papers presented at the joint BIS/SAFE seminar on Capital account liberalisation in China: international perspectives, held on 12-13 September 2002 in Beijing, China. Seminar participants from outside China were mostly experienced practitioners and policymakers from 13 economies across four continents. Chinese participants consisted mainly of staff from the State Administration of Foreign Exchange, the People's Bank of China and the Chinese Academy of Social Sciences. The main aim of the seminar was to draw on the diverse international experiences in managing cross-border capital flows and to shed light on how China should proceed to implement capital account liberalisation in the years ahead, following its recent historic entry into the WTO. The present collection includes 16 seminar papers, which are organised under the following six topics: Overview  Japanese experience  Bank-related capital flows  Corporate and non-bank flows  Equity portfolio flows  Offshore banknote flows  Our introduction should be read in close conjunction with the welcome speech by SAFE Deputy Director General Ma Delun and with the SAFE summary chapter by Wang Yungui and Xie Yuelan, which follow immediately.
ch_abstract: 本卷收录了2002年9月12-13日在中国北京举行的"中国资本账户开放：国际视角"BIS/SAFE联合研讨会上发表的论文。来自中国境外的参会者主要是来自四大洲13个经济体的资深从业者和政策制定者。中方参会者主要来自国家外汇管理局、中国人民银行和中国社会科学院的工作人员。研讨会的主要目的是借鉴各国管理跨境资本流动的多样化经验，并就中国在加入世贸组织这一历史性事件后应如何推进未来资本账户开放提供见解。本论文集共收录16篇研讨会论文，按以下六个主题编排：概述  日本经验  银行相关资本流动  企业及非银行机构资金流动  股票投资组合流动  离岸现钞流动  本导言应与随后刊载的国家外汇管理局副局长马德伦的欢迎致辞，以及王允贵、谢月兰撰写的国家外汇管理局总结章节对照阅读。

title: Diffusion of ISO 9000StandardsandInternationalTrade
abstract: Investigating the link between ISO 9000 standards and bilateral exports, this paper contributes to the literature on standardization and international trade. A debate exists as to how ISO 9000 impacts trade. First, it has been argued that ISO 9000 is a "common language" that lowers information asymmetries between firms, thus, allowing more efficient organization of inter-firm trade. Second, ISO 9000 has been criticized as a means of introducing market-entry barriers and a tariff on international trade. To assess the actual impact we estimate a gravity equation for bilateral exports incorporating ISO 9000 adoptions in each country as factors affecting bilateral trade barriers. Endogeneity issues are carefully addressed. To obtain additional insights, we separately estimate an ISO 9000 international diffusion equation. In general, our results support the "common language" hypothesis, i.e., the empirical tests find both domestic and foreign ISO 9000 adoptions to benefit bilateral exports. Moreover, we find evidence for a substitution effect, as ISO 9000 certified firms tend to trade with each other more than with uncertified firms. Consequently, the positive impact of these standards on trade is more pronounced among ISO 9000 abundant countries.
ch_abstract: 本文研究了ISO 9000标准与双边出口之间的联系，为标准化与国际贸易领域的文献做出了贡献。关于ISO 9000如何影响贸易存在争议：一方面，有观点认为该标准作为"通用语言"能降低企业间的信息不对称，从而更高效地组织企业间贸易；另一方面，批评者指出其可能成为设置市场准入壁垒和变相贸易关税的手段。为评估实际影响，我们通过引力模型测算双边出口，将各国ISO 9000认证情况作为影响双边贸易壁垒的因素纳入考量，并谨慎处理了内生性问题。为进一步分析，我们还单独估算了ISO 9000国际扩散方程。总体而言，研究结果支持"通用语言"假说——实证检验表明国内外ISO 9000认证均有利于双边出口增长。此外，我们发现认证企业之间存在替代效应，它们相互间的贸易往来显著多于与非认证企业的交易。因此，这些标准对贸易的积极影响在ISO 9000认证普及率高的国家更为显著。
tags: Gravity model, international trade, ISO 9000, adoption of standards, network effects, compatibility

title: Food Safety andStandardsin India
abstract: In all countries, food is governed by complexities of laws and regulations. Variations in national food control systems involving monitoring and sampling, detection and analytical methods, and application of standards and food safety requirements can lead to trade restrictions. Countries have sometimes developed standards that were not based on science and in effect were nothing more than non-tariff barriers to trade. In this project we examine the food safety and standards of India in general, and analyse the impact of such food safety standards on India’s agricultural trade flows with other countries. India’s trade data for fishery, meat, cereals and vegetables for the years 2010–14 have been used to assess the impacts. A proxy index for food safety standards has been considered throughout the analysis, and has been shown to be significant. We find that India’s food safety regime needs more effective implementation to meet best practice internationally.
ch_abstract: 各国食品均受复杂的法律法规管辖。国家食品监管体系在监测采样、检测分析方法及标准与食品安全要求的应用上存在差异，这些差异可能导致贸易限制。某些国家制定的标准缺乏科学依据，实质上构成了非关税贸易壁垒。本项目全面考察了印度的食品安全与标准体系，重点分析了此类标准对印度农产品国际贸易流量的影响。研究采用2010-2014年印度渔业、肉类、谷物和蔬菜的贸易数据进行评估，全程采用食品安全标准代理指数并证实其重要性。研究发现，印度的食品安全体系需更有效实施才能达到国际最佳实践水平。
tags: Food Safety and Standards; India

title: Measuring Service Quality at King FahdInternationalAirport
abstract: This paper studies the King Fahd International Airport in Dammam, Saudi Arabia, which began its operation in 1999. The paper reviews the development of the airport and the challenges it faces in maintaining standards of service. The study also undertakes an evaluation of the quality of airport service. Empirical research is used to determine the factors that influence travellers' evaluation of service quality. With data collected from 188 respondents, the study evaluates the satisfaction level of travellers on 25 dimensions identified. Then, the implications are discussed.
ch_abstract: 本文研究了沙特阿拉伯达曼的法赫德国王国际机场，该机场于1999年投入运营。文章回顾了该机场的发展历程及其在维持服务标准方面面临的挑战，并对机场服务质量进行了评估。研究采用实证方法分析影响旅客服务质量评价的关键因素，通过188名受访者的数据样本，从25个维度评估旅客满意度水平，最后探讨了相关研究启示。
tags: airport; King Fahd International Airport (KFIA); services; standards; Saudi Arabia.

title: TheInternationalOrganization for Standardization: Private VoluntaryStandardsas Swords and Shields
abstract: Private voluntary standards such as the International Organization for Standardization's (ISO's) 14000 series have played an increasingly important role in encouraging corporations to adopt more sustainable business models on their own initiative and not in direct response to governmentally mandated requirements. ISO standards have a number of benefits, including promoting international uniformity; elevating environmental issues within an enterprise; promoting international trade; and providing a minimal level of environmental performance in countries with less than adequate regulatory infrastructure. Concerns about ISO standards include the relationship to public regulation; and ISO 14001's essentially procedural, as opposed to performance-based, character.  International trade agreements such as NAFTA and the WTO Agreement on Technical Barriers to Trade inject ISO standards into the public policy arena. Because of the structure of these agreements, ISO standards may operate either as a sword-a negative standard used to challenge a domestic regulatory action-or a shield-an internationally agreed reference point that bolsters the legitimacy of a national measure. This Essay examines the potential for ISO standards on eco-labeling to act as swords to attack domestic requirements, and those on life cycle analysis to serve as shields to insulate municipal actions from international challenge in areas such as climate protection.
ch_abstract: 国际标准化组织（ISO）的14000系列等私营自愿性标准在鼓励企业主动采取更可持续的商业模式方面发挥着日益重要的作用，而非直接响应政府强制要求。ISO标准具有多重优势，包括促进国际统一性、提升企业内部对环境问题的重视、推动国际贸易，以及在监管体系欠完善的国家提供最低限度的环境绩效标准。对ISO标准的担忧则涉及与公共监管的关系，以及ISO 14001本质上偏重程序性而非基于绩效的特性。  . . 《北美自由贸易协定》（NAFTA）和《世界贸易组织技术性贸易壁垒协定》等国际贸易协议将ISO标准引入公共政策领域。由于这些协议的结构特点，ISO标准可能充当"利剑"——作为否定性标准挑战国内监管措施；也可能成为"盾牌"——作为国际公认的参考依据增强国家措施的合法性。本文探讨了生态标签类ISO标准作为"利剑"攻击国内要求的可能性，以及生命周期分析类标准在气候保护等领域充当"盾牌"、使地方行动免受国际质疑的潜力。
tags: ISO environmental standards, environmental regulation, green policy, green standards

title: InternationalConvergence of AccountingStandards: 'Hot Topics' and Constituents' Views in Japan
abstract: The aim of this study is to identify key issues for convergence of Japanese and international accounting standards and to present constituents' views about these topics. We investigate the financial impact of requirements relating to fair value measurement, comprehensive income items, leases and business combinations in the financial statements of 50 large listed Japanese firms at 31 March 2005. This analysis provides the setting for our report of the views of Japanese preparers and users of financial statements about convergence of Japanese and international accounting standards, following convergence initiatives over the period 1997-2005. A survey of 974 members of the Securities Analysts Association of Japan indicated support for convergence and the use of fair value measurement, disclosure of comprehensive income, recognition of leases and use of the purchase method for consolidation. Our financial analysis of firms shows that these topics are relevant for many firms. We report support from both preparers and users for several positions favoured by the International Accounting Standards Board (IASB), a positive signal for achieving convergence goals in Japan.
ch_abstract: 本研究旨在探讨日本与国际会计准则趋同的关键问题，并呈现相关各方对这些议题的看法。我们调查了公允价值计量、综合收益项目、租赁及企业合并等准则要求对2005年3月31日50家日本大型上市公司财务报表的财务影响。基于1997-2005年趋同进程的背景，本分析为报告日本财务报表编制者与使用者对准则趋同的观点提供了研究基础。对日本证券分析师协会974名成员的调查显示，受访者支持准则趋同、采用公允价值计量、披露综合收益、确认租赁资产以及采用购买法进行合并。企业财务分析表明这些议题对多数企业具有实际意义。研究发现编制者与使用者均支持国际会计准则理事会（IASB）倡导的若干立场，这为实现日本会计准则国际趋同目标释放了积极信号。
tags: International Accounting Standards Board, Accounting Standards Board of Japan, convergence, fair value measurement, comprehensive income, leases, business combinations

title: Book review: Aleksander Orakhelashvili,InternationalLaw andInternationalPolitics: Foundations of Interdisciplinary Analysis, Edward Elgar Publishing, Cheltenham: 2020, pp. 320
abstract: Review of the book: Aleksander Orakhelashvili, International Law and International Politics: Foundations of Interdisciplinary Analysis, Edward Elgar Publishing, Cheltenham: 2020, pp. 320

title: From Hindsight to Foresight: Biofuels in Agriculture and Forestry
abstract: The Canadian forest sector is facing a time of significant transformation. In this brief we argue that regulatory analysis and foresight is an essential component of the successful transformation of the forest sector. As a first step to a regulatory analysis and foresight, we will illustrate here how to think about regulation based on the hindsight gleaned from the agricultural sector. Specifically we will derive lessons learned from the history of agricultural biofuels. A shift of energy production toward biofuels seems to support all of the three pillars of sustainable development. Accordingly, the most widely produced transport biofuel internationally, agricultural ethanol, has been marketed as a smart and green choice and as better alternative to oil-based gasoline.  This image is now crumbling somewhat. We will focus on lessons learned from the agricultural biofuels story (paying special attention to the case of ethanol) and explore what hindsight can teach us.
ch_abstract: 加拿大林业部门正面临重大转型时期。在本简报中，我们认为监管分析和前瞻性是林业部门成功转型的重要组成部分。作为监管分析和前瞻性的第一步，我们将在此说明如何基于农业部门的历史经验来思考监管问题。具体而言，我们将从农业生物燃料的历史中汲取经验教训。能源生产向生物燃料的转变似乎支持可持续发展的三大支柱。因此，国际上生产最广泛的运输用生物燃料——农业乙醇——一直被宣传为一种智能、绿色的选择，是优于石油基汽油的替代品。这种形象如今已有所动摇。我们将重点探讨农业生物燃料发展历程（特别关注乙醇案例）带来的启示，并探索历史经验能教会我们什么。

title: RegulatoryArbitrage of RiskMeasures
abstract: We introduce the regulatory arbitrage of risk measures, one of the key considerations in choosing a suitable risk measure to use in banking regulation.  A regulatory arbitrage is the amount of capital requirement reduced by splitting a financial risk into several fragments, regulated via a risk measure separately. Coherent risk measures by definition are free of regulatory arbitrage;  dividing risks will not reduce the total capital requirement under a coherent risk measure. However, risk measures in practical use, such as the Value-at-Risk (VaR), are often not coherent and the magnitude of their regulatory arbitrage is then of significant importance.
