We quantify the regulatory arbitrage of risk measures in a rigorous mathematical framework, and categorize risk measures into three classes: free of regulatory arbitrage, of limited regulatory arbitrage, and of infinite regulatory arbitrage. We provide explicit results to characterize the regulatory arbitrage for general classes of risk measures, including distortion risk measures and convex risk measures.  Several examples of  risk measures of limited regulatory arbitrage are illustrated, as possible alternatives for coherent risk measures.
ch_abstract: 我们引入风险度量的监管套利概念，这是选择适用于银行监管的风险度量时需考量的关键因素之一。监管套利指通过将金融风险拆分为多个部分并分别用风险度量进行监管，从而减少的资本要求总额。根据定义，一致性风险度量不存在监管套利；在一致性风险度量下分割风险不会降低总资本要求。然而实际应用中的风险度量（如风险价值VaR）通常不具备一致性，其监管套利规模便具有重要意义。我们在严格数学框架下量化风险度量的监管套利，并将其划分为三类：无监管套利、有限监管套利和无限监管套利。针对包括失真风险度量与凸风险度量在内的广义风险度量类别，我们给出了刻画监管套利的明确结论。文中展示了若干具有有限监管套利的风险度量实例，作为一致性风险度量的潜在替代方案。
tags: risk measures; regulatory arbitrage; subadditivity; Value-at-Risk; regulatory capital

title: Policy Priorities for the Sustainable Use of Forest-Based Bioenergy: Results from a Critical Conversation
abstract: The Regulatory Governance Initiative (RGI) held a workshop on the future of bioenergy use from Canadian forests at Carleton University (Ottawa) on November 26, 2009. The event was co-hosted by the Ivey Foundation, the Canadian Forest Service (CFS) and the Forest Products Association of Canada (FPAC). The purpose of the event was open debate among a diverse group of informed opinion leaders on the following question: What should the Canadian approach look like when it comes to the use of bioenergy from forests? In response to this question, we aimed at compiling a ranked list of priorities and principles from the perspective of policy makers, regulators, industry, non-government organizations, and subject matter experts. The top priority identified was establishing a carbon price, and the top principle was creating a level playing field among all sources of renewable energy.
ch_abstract: 监管治理倡议（RGI）于2009年11月26日在卡尔顿大学（渥太华）举办了一场关于加拿大森林生物能源利用前景的研讨会。该活动由艾维基金会、加拿大林业局（CFS）和加拿大林产品协会（FPAC）共同主办。活动的目的是让来自不同领域的知情意见领袖围绕以下问题展开公开辩论：加拿大在利用森林生物能源时应采取何种方式？针对这一问题，我们旨在从政策制定者、监管机构、行业、非政府组织和主题专家的角度汇编一份优先事项和原则的排序清单。确立碳价被列为最高优先事项，而首要原则则是为所有可再生能源创造公平竞争环境。

title: How Do Cross-CountryRegulatorySystems Affect Poverty? Reviewing a World Bank Policy Research Working Paper
abstract: The relationship between regulation and economic outcomes is a longstanding question in economic analysis. Considering the underlying foundations of good regulatory systems — such as their effectiveness at enforcing contracts or permitting business creation — is critical for spurring improvements in economic opportunity. A March 2019 Policy Research Working Paper for the World Bank Group examines how “business-friendly” regulations and their enforcement affect poverty at the country level. This review analyzes the paper’s main claims, examines its methodology, and recommends ways to make improvements. While the paper contributes to the literature on how country-level regulatory characteristics affect poverty, it makes strong claims that are not fully supported by the results or methodology. Modifying the analysis could enhance the findings and expand the paper’s contribution to the literature on country-level determinants of poverty. Rather than offering a clear path forward to addressing poverty, the World Bank working paper is better seen as a starting point for further research.
ch_abstract: 监管与经济成果之间的关系是经济分析中一个长期存在的问题。考虑良好监管体系的基础——例如其在执行合同或允许企业创建方面的有效性——对于促进经济机会的改善至关重要。2019年3月世界银行集团的一份政策研究工作论文研究了“企业友好型”监管及其执行如何影响国家层面的贫困。本综述分析了该论文的主要主张，检验了其方法，并提出了改进建议。虽然该论文对关于国家层面监管特征如何影响贫困的文献有所贡献，但其提出的强烈主张并未完全得到结果或方法的支持。修改分析可以增强研究结果，并扩大该论文对国家层面贫困决定因素文献的贡献。与其说世界银行的工作论文为解决贫困问题提供了一条清晰的前进道路，不如将其视为进一步研究的起点。
tags: economic development, poverty, regulation, business regulations, World Bank, regulatory regimes

title: The Art & Craft of Learning to Regulate: An Interview-Based Exploration at Health Canada
abstract: Health Canada asked Carleton University's Regulatory Governance Initiative to explore how knowledge transfer in the regulatory community at Health Canada works and to capture the views and wisdom of senior mentors, particularly those who had recently left or who were on the verge of retirement. This study is focused on how they have learned the "art and craft if regulation" and on their views of how the teaching of regulation can best be accomplished. Recent recruits were asked about their experiences and expectations. The comparison of the "looking back" with the "looking forward" perspective provides a broad view. This exploration was based on one-on-one interviews with the aim of fostering an understanding of the issues through dialogue.
ch_abstract: 加拿大卫生部委托卡尔顿大学监管治理研究项目，探讨该部监管体系内的知识传承机制，并收集资深导师（特别是近期离职或临近退休人员）的见解与智慧。本研究聚焦于他们如何习得"监管的艺术与技艺"，以及他们对最佳监管教学方式的看法。同时调研了新入职人员的经历与期望。通过"回顾"与"前瞻"视角的对比，形成了全面观察。此次调研采用一对一访谈形式，旨在通过对话深化对相关问题的理解。

title: An Assessment of ChronicRegulatoryFocusMeasures
abstract: Prior consumer research has demonstrated the ability of promotion and prevention regulatory orientations to moderate a variety of consumer and marketing phenomena, but has used several different scales to measure chronic regulatory focus. This paper assesses five different chronic regulatory focus measures using criteria of theoretical coverage, internal consistency, homogeneity, stability, and predictive ability. The results reveal a lack of convergence among the measures and variation in their performance along these criteria. Specific guidance for choosing a particular measure in regulatory focus research is provided.
ch_abstract: 先前关于消费者的研究表明，促进和预防这两种调节导向能够调节多种消费者及营销现象，但测量长期调节导向时采用了多种不同的量表。本文从理论覆盖度、内部一致性、同质性、稳定性及预测能力五个维度评估了五种不同的长期调节导向测量工具。结果显示这些测量工具间缺乏一致性，且在各评估维度上表现参差不齐。研究为调节导向研究中如何选择特定测量工具提供了具体指导。
tags: regulatory focus theory, RFQ, personality, trait regulatory focus, selves, personality assessment

title: MeasuresAimed at Enhancing the Loss Absorbency ofRegulatoryCapital at the Point of Non Viability
abstract: The Basel Committee’s recent consultative document on the “Proposal to Ensure the Loss Absorbency of Regulatory Capital at the Point of Non Viability” sets out a proposal aimed at “enhancing the entry criteria of regulatory capital to ensure that all regulatory capital instruments issued by banks are capable of absorbing losses in the event that a bank is unable to support itself in the private market.” As well as demonstrating its support of the Basel Committee’s statement that a public sector injection of capital should not protect investors from absorbing the loss that they would have incurred (had the public sector not chosen to rescue the bank), this paper also highlights identified measures which have been put forward as means of rescuing failing banks – without taxpayer financing. Furthermore, it highlights why the controlled winding down procedure also constitutes a means whereby losses could still be absorbed in the event that a bank is unable to support itself in the private market.
ch_abstract: 巴塞尔委员会近期发布的《关于确保非持续经营时监管资本损失吸收能力的建议》咨询文件，提出了一项旨在"提高监管资本的准入标准，以确保银行发行的所有监管资本工具在银行无法通过私人市场维持运营时能够吸收损失"的提案。该文件不仅表明其支持巴塞尔委员会关于公共部门注资不应保护投资者免于承担其本应承受的损失（假设公共部门未选择救助该银行）的声明，还重点介绍了已提出的无需纳税人资金救助问题银行的措施。此外，文件还阐明了为何在银行无法通过私人市场维持运营时，受控的逐步关闭程序仍可作为一种吸收损失的手段。
tags: Capital, Insolvency, Financial Crises, Moral Hazard, Basel III, Investor Compensation Schemes Directive, Bail Outs, Equity, Liquidity

title: AML In Cross-Border Fintech Transactions: Risks andRegulatoryMeasures
abstract: Money laundering (ML) is often likened to pervasive cancer in modern society, morphing into one of the most expensive crimes in the world and spreading with high costs through organisations. Experts argue that tackling this issue requires international cooperation, as no single country can effectively combat it alone. This article considers the potential for cross-border FinTech transactions as a medium for money laundering by undertaking a deep dive into money laundering activities. It examines the AML measures implemented in FinTech money laundering transactions, emphasising the risks attached to such AML measures. In the final section, the article recommends tailored strategies such as private sector collaboration, mandatory international obligations and reports, uniform global AML implementation, and cohesive regulatory policies. The evident intention of the author is to strike clear notes on the need to prioritise the international approach to money laundering prevention over a national approach while also advocating for increased public-private partnership in the fight against money laundering. The research concludes with an optimistic tone, encouraging the international revision of current global AML measures and advancing the strategic implementation of practical solutions, which are undoubtedly required in the ever-changing climate of money laundering activities.
ch_abstract: 洗钱（ML）常被比作现代社会的顽疾，演变为全球最昂贵的犯罪之一，以高昂成本在各类组织中蔓延。专家指出解决这一问题需要国际合作，单靠任何国家都无法有效应对。本文通过深入剖析洗钱活动，探讨跨境金融科技交易作为洗钱媒介的可能性，审视金融科技洗钱交易中实施的反洗钱措施，并着重分析这些措施伴随的风险。最后部分提出定制化策略建议，包括私营部门协作、强制性国际义务与报告、全球统一反洗钱实施以及协调一致的监管政策。作者明确主张应优先采取国际协同的洗钱防治策略而非国家单边行动，同时倡导加强公私合作共同打击洗钱。研究以乐观基调收尾，呼吁国际社会修订现行全球反洗钱措施，推进务实解决方案的战略实施——这在洗钱活动不断演变的形势下无疑至关重要。
tags: Money Laundering, Anti-money Laundering, FinTech, Cross-border Transaction, Regulatory Measures

title: RegulatoryProcess,RegulatoryReform, and the Quality ofRegulatoryImpact Analysis
abstract: Numerous regulatory reform proposals would require federal agencies to conduct more thorough economic analysis of proposed regulations or expand the resources and influence of the Office of Information and Regulatory Affairs (OIRA), which currently reviews executive branch regulations. Such reforms are intended to improve the quality of economic analysis agencies produce when they issue major regulations. We employ newly-gathered data on variation in current administrative procedures to assess the likely effects of proposed regulatory process reforms on the quality of agencies’ regulatory impact analyses (RIAs). Our results suggest that greater use of advance notices of proposed rulemakings for major regulations, advance consultation with regulated entities, use of advisory committees, and expansion of OIRA’s resources and role would improve the quality of RIAs. They also suggest pre-proposal public meetings with stakeholders are associated with lower quality analysis.
ch_abstract: 众多监管改革提案要求联邦机构对拟议法规进行更全面的经济分析，或扩大信息与监管事务办公室（OIRA）的资源与影响力——该机构目前负责审查行政部门制定的法规。此类改革旨在提升各机构发布重大法规时经济分析的质量。我们利用新收集的现行行政程序差异数据，评估了拟议监管流程改革对机构监管影响分析（RIA）质量的潜在影响。研究结果表明，对重大法规更多采用拟议规则制定的预先通知、与被监管实体提前磋商、使用咨询委员会以及扩大OIRA的资源与职能，将提升RIA的质量。研究同时显示，与利益相关方举行提案前公开会议与分析质量下降存在关联。
tags: regulation, regulatory reform, regulatory process, benefit-cost analysis, cost-benefit, regulatory impact analysis, regulatory review

title: Note on COVID-19 and the Police Powers Doctrine: Assessing the Allowable Scope ofRegulatoryMeasuresDuring a Pandemic
abstract: The COVID-19 pandemic has caused severe disruptions not only to public health, but also to the global economy. In response, many States have enacted preventive control measures to curtail the spread of the virus, as well as rehabilitative measures aimed at protecting the economy. Due to the breadth, scope and (at present) uncertain duration of these measures, it is likely that these may result to investment claims from foreign investors whose investments have been severely affected. This Note will discuss one of the available defences to investment claims resulting from regulatory measures undertaken pursuant to public health, that of the doctrine of police powers. This doctrine recognises that reasonable governmental regulation does not result to compensable expropriation. This Note will further consider the challenges faced in the application of the police powers doctrine to the present pandemic situation.
ch_abstract: 新冠疫情不仅严重扰乱了公共卫生领域，也对全球经济造成重创。为此，多国政府相继出台防疫管控措施以遏制病毒传播，同时实施经济保护性复苏政策。由于这些措施涉及范围广、持续时间（目前）不确定，很可能引发受严重影响的外国投资者提出投资索赔。本文拟探讨基于公共卫生采取的监管措施所引发投资索赔的抗辩理由之一——警察权力原则。该原则认为合理的政府监管不构成可补偿的征收行为。本文还将进一步分析该原则在当前疫情形势下适用时面临的挑战。
tags: COVID-19, regulatory measures, police powers doctrine, investment treaty claims

title: The Quality and Use ofRegulatoryAnalysis in 2008
abstract: This paper assesses the quality and use of regulatory analysis for economically significant regulations produced by federal agencies in 2008. A nine-member research team used a six-point (0-5) scale to evaluate regulatory analyses according to criteria drawn from Executive Order 12866 on Regulatory Planning and Review, Office of Management and Budget Circular A-4 on Regulatory Analysis, and  scholarly research. Principal findings include: (1) The average quality of regulatory analysis, though not high, is somewhat better than previous regulatory scorecards have shown; (2) Quality varies widely; (3) The biggest strengths in the analyses are accessibility and clarity; the biggest weakness is retrospective analysis; (4) Budget or  transfer regulations receive much lower-quality analysis than other regulations; (5) A minority of the regulations contain evidence that the agency used the analysis in significant decisions; (6) Quality of analysis is positively correlated with the apparent use of the analysis in regulatory decisions; (7) The analyses contain many examples of - best practices; and (8) Greater diffusion of best practices could significantly improve the overall quality of regulatory analysis.
ch_abstract: 本文评估了2008年联邦机构制定的重大经济监管条例的分析质量及使用情况。一个由九人组成的研究团队采用六分制（0-5分）评分标准，依据《12866号行政令：监管规划与审查》、《管理与预算办公室A-4号通告：监管分析》及学术研究制定的标准对监管分析报告进行评价。主要发现包括：（1）监管分析的平均质量虽不高，但略优于以往监管评分卡显示的水平；（2）分析质量差异显著；（3）分析报告的最大优势在于可获取性与清晰度，最大弱项是回顾性分析；（4）预算或转移支付类监管条例获得的分析质量远低于其他类型监管；（5）少数监管条例显示机构在重大决策中运用了分析结果；（6）分析质量与监管决策中对分析结果的运用程度呈正相关；（7）分析报告中存在诸多"最佳实践"案例；（8）加强最佳实践的推广可显著提升监管分析的整体质量。
tags: regulatory impact analysis, benefit-cost, regulation, cost-benefit analysis, regulatory process, regulatory reform

title: Cityscape:RegulatoryReform and Affordable Housing
abstract: In 1991, at the behest of U.S. Department of Housing and Urban Development (HUD) then Secretary Jack Kemp, the Advisory Commission on Regulatory Barriers to Affordable Housing delivered a report on how land-use restrictions have worsened housing affordability. Secretary Kemp charged the commission to “explore the effect of the maze of federal, state, and local laws, regulations, ordinances, codes, and innumerable other measures that act as barriers to the development of affordable housing in appropriate places … (and) to catalogue the barriers, identify the sources of those barriers, and propose solutions.”
ch_abstract: 1991年，应美国住房与城市发展部（HUD）时任部长杰克·肯普的要求，可负担住房监管障碍咨询委员会提交了一份报告，阐述了土地使用限制如何加剧了住房可负担性问题。肯普部长要求委员会"探究联邦、州和地方各级法律、法规、条例、规范及无数其他措施构成的迷局对在适宜区域开发可负担住房造成的阻碍……（并）系统梳理这些障碍，查明其根源，提出解决方案。"
tags: hud, cityscape, affordable housing, regulatory reform

title: The Unequal Employment Effects ofRegulatoryUncertainty
abstract: This paper examines how increases in regulatory uncertainty may affect employment and presents empirical evidence that the employment effects of regulatory uncertainty are unequal for workers with different levels of educational attainment. VAR estimations suggest that a regulatory uncertainty shock leads to a more persistent and larger drop in employment at lower education levels. This finding is consistent with the expectation of unequal real-options effects of uncertainty due to heterogeneous adjustment costs.
ch_abstract: 本文探讨了监管不确定性增加如何影响就业，并通过实证证据表明，监管不确定性对教育程度不同劳动者的就业影响存在差异。向量自回归模型估计显示，监管不确定性冲击会导致低教育水平群体的就业率出现更持久、更大幅度的下滑。这一发现与因调整成本异质性导致不确定性实际期权效应不均的预期相吻合。
tags: regulatory uncertainty, Employment, education levels, Inequality

title: Evaluating the Quality and Use ofRegulatoryImpact Analysis: The Mercatus Center'sRegulatoryReport Card, 2008-2013
abstract: The Mercatus Center at George Mason University initiated its Regulatory Report Card project in 2009 to assess how well executive branch regulatory agencies conduct and use regulatory impact analysis and to identify ways to motivate improvement. Report Card evaluations reveal that agencies often adopt regulations that affect several hundred million Americans and impose hundreds of millions of dollars in costs without knowing whether a given regulation will really solve a significant problem, whether a more effective alternative solution exists, or whether a more targeted solution could achieve the same result at lower cost. Extensive statistical analysis of Report Card scores suggests that institutional reforms are the most promising means of improving the quality and use of regulatory impact analysis.
ch_abstract: 乔治梅森大学的莫卡特斯中心于2009年启动了"监管报告卡"项目，旨在评估行政监管机构开展和运用监管影响分析的能力，并探索推动改进的途径。评估结果显示，这些机构经常在未确认某项法规能否真正解决重大问题、是否存在更有效的替代方案、或能否通过更具针对性的方案以更低成本实现相同效果的情况下，就颁布影响数亿美国人、造成数亿美元成本的法规。对报告卡评分的深入统计分析表明，制度改革是提升监管影响分析质量与运用效果最具前景的途径。
tags: administrative procedure, Administrative Procedure Act, regulation, regulatory reform,regulatory process, benefit-cost analysis, cost-benefit, regulatory impact analysis, regulatory review

title: Why and How Independent Agencies Should ConductRegulatoryImpact Analysis
abstract: Independent regulatory agencies face increasing pressure to conduct high-quality economic analysis of regulations, similar to the regulatory impact analysis conducted by executive branch agencies. Such analysis could be required by evolving judicial doctrines, regulatory reform statutes, or executive order. This article explains how regulatory impact analysis can contribute to smarter regulation, documents the current low quality of such analysis at many independent regulatory agencies, and offers a blueprint that independent agencies can use to build their capacity to conduct objective, high-quality analysis.
ch_abstract: 独立监管机构面临越来越大的压力，要求其对法规进行高质量的经济分析，类似于行政部门机构进行的监管影响分析。这种分析可能源于不断演变的司法原则、监管改革法规或行政命令。本文阐述了监管影响分析如何促进更明智的监管，记录了许多独立监管机构当前此类分析质量低下的现状，并提供了一个蓝图，供独立机构用于提升其开展客观、高质量分析的能力。
tags: administrative procedure, independent agencies, regulation, regulatory reform, regulatory process, benefit-cost analysis, cost-benefit, regulatory impact analysis, regulatory review

title: RegulatoryMeasuresthrough Plain Packaging of Tobacco Products in the Light of International Trade Agreements
abstract: Plain packaging is the WHO’s new concept to fight the global tobacco epidemic. Already adopted in Australia, other countries are certain to follow and are already evaluating its introduction. However, plain packaging is not as carefree and unproblematic as the WHO considers it to be. The idea of dictating to tobacco producers the way they must present their product provokes heavy protest on political and legal levels. This article analyses the compatibility of plain packaging with WTO-law.
ch_abstract: 平装包装是世卫组织为对抗全球烟草流行提出的新概念。澳大利亚已率先采用，其他国家也必将效仿，并已在评估引入该方案的可行性。然而平装包装并不像世卫组织认为的那样轻松无虞。强制规定烟草生产商产品呈现方式的构想，已在政治和法律层面引发强烈抗议。本文分析了平装包装措施与世贸组织法律的兼容性问题。
tags: arbitration, investment claims, investment disputes, WTO-law, TRIPS, GATT, SPS, TBT, intellectual property, Framework Convention on Tobacco Control, tobacco control, protective measures, public interest, public health

title: ImprovingRegulatoryImpact Analysis Through Process Reform: Testimony Before the U.S. Congress Joint Economic Committee
abstract: Scholarly research demonstrates that Regulatory Impact Analysis often falls short of the standards articulated in executive orders and Office of Management and Budget guidance. More often than not, agencies do not appear to use the Regulatory Impact Analysis to inform major decisions. Regulatory Impact Analyses often seem to be advocacy documents written to justify decisions that were already made, rather than information that helped regulators figure out what to do. Further improvement in the quality and use of Regulatory Impact Analysis will likely occur only as a result of legislative reform of the regulatory process. To achieve improvement, all agencies should be required to conduct thorough and objective Regulatory Impact Analysis for major regulations and to explain how the results of the analysis informed their decisions.
ch_abstract: 学术研究表明，监管影响分析往往达不到行政命令和管理与预算办公室指导文件中阐述的标准。多数情况下，机构似乎并未利用监管影响分析来为重大决策提供依据。这些分析报告往往更像是为既定决策辩护的倡导性文件，而非帮助监管者确定行动方向的信息依据。只有通过立法改革监管流程，才可能实现监管影响分析质量与运用效果的持续提升。为达成改进目标，应要求所有机构对重大监管规定开展全面客观的影响分析，并说明分析结果如何影响其最终决策。
tags: regulation, regulatory impact analysis, cost-benefit andlysis, benefit-cost analysis, regulatory reform

title: Airport Enterprises: An Economic Analysis - Chapter Summary
abstract: ‘Airport Enterprises: An Economic Analysis’ frames the airport firm as a business platform for a broad spectrum of commercial activities, some of which enjoy the characteristics of two-sided markets. This is in contrast to the usual application of welfare economics as an analytical lens for airports, a lens which is argued to be inappropriate for an industry with an international customer base. Also challenged is the consensus that airports are natural monopolies; cost functions are not necessarily sub-additive, additional capacity is added mostly in small increments, and new entry feasible as a result of product diversification or negotiating parties striking long term pricing contracts. Finally, a number of questions are raised about current public policy, the standard interpretation of economic rents at congested airports, and existing plans for adding capacity at London Heathrow airport. Here contained is a Chapter Summary of the book.
ch_abstract: 《机场企业：经济分析》将机场企业定位为一个支持广泛商业活动的经营平台，其中部分业务具备双边市场特征。这一视角有别于通常采用福利经济学分析机场的做法——该书认为这种分析框架不适用于服务国际客户群的行业。书中同时对"机场属于自然垄断行业"的共识提出质疑：成本函数未必具有次可加性，扩建工程多以小规模增量方式进行，通过产品多元化或缔约方达成长期定价协议，新竞争者完全可能进入市场。最后，该书对现行公共政策、拥堵机场经济租金的传统解读方式，以及伦敦希思罗机场现有扩建计划提出若干质疑。此处呈现的是该书的章节概要。
tags: Airport Regulation, Economic Analysis, Transportation, Markets, Airport Policy, Regulation, Business Platforms

title: ReformingRegulatoryAnalysis, Review, and Oversight: A Guide for the Perplexed
abstract: The number of regulations and their economic impact continue to grow. Yet the quality and use of economic analysis to inform regulatory decisions falls far short of the standards enunciated in executive orders governing regulatory analysis and review. Both the president and Congress have grappled in recent years with initiatives intended to reform the analytical requirements and oversight mechanisms that federal agencies must comply with when they propose and finalize regulations. Regulatory scholars have identified numerous additional provisions that could strengthen regulatory analysis, review, and oversight. This article summarizes proposals for change, explains their underlying rationales, and lists the pros and cons associated with each.
ch_abstract: 法规数量及其经济影响持续增长。然而用于指导监管决策的经济分析质量与应用水平，远未达到规范监管分析与审查的行政命令所阐述的标准。近年来总统和国会都致力于推动改革，试图调整联邦机构在提议和敲定法规时必须遵守的分析要求与监督机制。监管学者还提出了大量能够强化监管分析、审查与监督的补充条款。本文汇总了各项改革提案，阐释其根本原理，并逐一列举了相关利弊。
tags: administrative procedure, Administrative Procedure Act, regulation, regulatory reform, regulatory process, benefit-cost analysis, cost-benefit, regulatory impact analysis, regulatory review

title: Commentary: ExploitingRegulatoryChanges for Research in Management Accounting
abstract: This paper describes recent regulatory changes in the European Union to illustrate opportunities for research in management accounting. Issues are whether a regulation is effective in achieving its objective, how it affects the organizational design and decision making in firms, and what additional data become available. I particularly consider the areas of management compensation, risk management, performance measures, non-financial information, the influence of financial reporting, and accountability.
ch_abstract: 本文阐述了欧盟近期的法规变动，以探讨管理会计领域的研究机遇。研究重点包括：法规是否有效达成其目标、如何影响企业组织架构与决策制定、以及能获取哪些新增数据。我特别关注管理层薪酬、风险管理、绩效评估、非财务信息、财务报告的影响及问责机制等领域。
tags: Research opportunities, regulatory change, performance measures, compensation

title: RegulatoryFailure: A Review of the International Academic Literature
abstract: Regulatory failure is much talked about, but little understood. Discussions about regulatory failure are often discussions about different understandings of what can be expected of regulatory governance and public regulation. The rhetoric of regulatory failure (typically a blame game) easily (and often) overshadows its analytical explanation. To improve our understanding of this topic, this research paper presents findings from a broad scoping of the international academic literature on regulatory failure. The literature review is structured according to four broad perspectives on regulation: public interest theory, public choice theory, private interest theory, and institutional theories.
ch_abstract: 监管失灵常被提及，却鲜少被真正理解。关于监管失灵的讨论往往源于对监管治理和公共监管预期效果的不同认知。监管失灵的话语（通常演变为指责游戏）极易（且频繁地）掩盖其背后的分析性解释。为深化对这一议题的理解，本研究论文通过系统梳理国际学术界关于监管失灵的文献，呈现了广泛的研究成果。文献综述围绕监管的四大理论视角展开：公共利益理论、公共选择理论、私人利益理论以及制度理论。
tags: regulatory failure, regulatory practice, regulatory governance, regulation, governance, enforcement

title: RegulatoryUnilateralism: Arguments for Going It Alone on Climate Change
abstract: Climate change is a collective action problem that has often been analysed as a Prisoner’s Dilemma. States have an incentive to free ride on the efforts of others. Yet around the globe national and sub-national governments are introducing regulatory measures to reduce emissions that can be fairly characterised as unilateral actions. The US and China, the world’s two largest emitters, are at the forefront. Indeed the evidence of states beginning to depart from business-as-usual behaviour raises the possibility that the characterizations of climate change as a Prisoner’s Dilemma may apply less strongly to the problem and that something else may be starting to happen. Accordingly, this paper considers: (i) to what extent nations are taking unilateral action to address climate change; and (ii) in the context of climate change, which is considered one of the greatest global collective action problems the world has faced, what are the possible economic explanations for nations to act in a unilateral fashion and what are the normative reasons for doing so. We justify regulatory unilateralism on economic, geopolitical and moral grounds, and argue that regulatory unilateralism may offer the best hope of triggering a race to cut emissions. A race rather than prolonged negotiations is what is required at this moment in climate history.
ch_abstract: 气候变化是一个集体行动问题，常被类比为"囚徒困境"。各国存在搭他国减排便车的动机。然而全球范围内，国家及地方政府正在推行可被视为单边行动的减排监管措施。世界两大排放国美国和中国正走在这一趋势前沿。各国开始偏离常规做法的迹象表明，"囚徒困境"模型对气候变化的解释力可能正在减弱，新的动态正在形成。本文据此探讨：（1）各国在多大程度上采取单边行动应对气候变化；（2）对于这个全球最严峻的集体行动难题，国家采取单边行动的经济学动因和伦理依据。我们从经济、地缘政治和道德层面论证了监管单边主义的合理性，并指出这种单边主义最有望引发减排竞赛——在当下气候治理的关键时刻，我们亟需的是竞赛机制而非冗长谈判。
tags: climate change, emissions reduction, regulatory measures, collective action, regulatory unilateralism

title: RegulatoryPhilosophy, Theory and Practice: Ka Mua, Ka Muri
abstract: Regulation as a practice, profession and discipline has progressed considerably over the last 4,000 years. Modern regulation has shed its image of being a dull, rigid and highly legalistic way to achieve policy outcomes. Today, all around the world, regulators actively experiment with innovative regulatory interventions, often supported by communities and the private sector. This research paper reflects on the long and often remarkable history of regulatory reform to lay out the main regulatory challenges of today, and he explores how they can be best addressed in the future.
ch_abstract: 作为一种实践、职业和学科，监管在过去4000年间取得了长足发展。现代监管已摆脱了那种为实现政策目标而采取的呆板、僵化且高度拘泥于法律形式的刻板印象。如今在全球范围内，监管机构积极尝试创新性监管措施，这些举措常得到社区和私营部门的支持。本研究报告通过回顾监管改革悠久且非凡的历史，阐述了当前面临的主要监管挑战，并探讨了未来应对这些挑战的最佳方式。
tags: regulation, regulatory governance, enforcement, compliance

title: TheRegulatoryDeterminants of Railroad Safety
abstract: The dramatic improvement in railroad safety since the 1970s has been accompanied by a substantial increase in safety regulation and a substantial reduction in economic regulation after 1980. We assess the effects of both regulatory changes on railroad safety with the use of RegData: a new data set that was developed by one of the authors that measures the amount of regulation that is imposed by specific regulatory agencies on specific industries. We find that partial economic deregulation is associated with improved safety. Safety regulation was most closely associated with improved railroad safety during the period when economic regulation curtailed railroads’ incentives to operate safely.
ch_abstract: 20世纪70年代以来铁路安全状况的显著改善，伴随着安全监管的大幅加强以及1980年后经济监管的大幅削减。我们运用RegData（由作者之一开发的新型数据集，可量化特定监管机构对特定行业施加的监管强度）评估了这两类监管变革对铁路安全的影响。研究发现，部分经济放松管制与安全水平提升存在关联。在经济监管削弱铁路安全运营激励的时期，安全监管与铁路安全改善的关联性最为显著。
tags: railroad, railroad safety, regulation, safety regulation, Staggers Act, RegData

title: Managing the Performance ofRegulatoryAgencies
abstract: Around the world, regulatory institutions have assumed central roles in making and implementing public policy decisions. How well regulatory leaders manage these institutions ultimately shapes the degree to which regulation can succeed in solving social and economic problems. This chapter seeks to guide both practice and research by providing a framework for understanding and improving regulatory management. Although regulatory institutions can vary in their size, structure, and specific missions, they confront a common set of managerial challenges and share a common set of qualities that define their success. This chapter distills lessons from existing research on both regulation and public administration to indicate how regulatory managers can achieve results, offering a framework of key steps in regulatory management: setting priorities; designing rules; engaging the public; enforcing rules; and measuring outcomes and evaluating actions. Rather than suggesting these steps can be pursued in a formulaic and linear fashion, this chapter stresses that achieving regulatory excellence demands flexibility and a commitment to continuous improvement. An eagerness to learn and adapt is essential to managing regulatory institutions well. The chapter concludes by offering directions for future research on regulatory management.
ch_abstract: 在世界各地，监管机构在制定和实施公共政策决策中承担着核心角色。监管领导者管理这些机构的成效，最终决定了监管在解决社会和经济问题上的成功程度。本章旨在通过提供一个理解和改进监管管理的框架，为实践和研究提供指导。尽管监管机构在规模、结构和具体任务上可能有所不同，但它们面临着一系列共同的管理挑战，并共享一系列决定其成功的关键特质。本章从现有关于监管和公共行政的研究中提炼经验，指出监管管理者如何取得成效，提出了监管管理的关键步骤框架：设定优先事项；设计规则；公众参与；执行规则；以及衡量结果和评估行动。本章并非建议这些步骤可以按固定和线性的方式推进，而是强调实现监管卓越需要灵活性和对持续改进的承诺。学习和适应的热忱对于良好管理监管机构至关重要。本章最后提出了未来监管管理研究的方向。
tags: Regulation, Regulatory management, regulatory analysis, instrument design, regulatory enforcement, evaluation and retrospective review, regulatory excellence, public administration, bureaucracy, public management

title: Regulatory-Optimal Funding
abstract: Funding is a cost to trading desks that they see as an input. Current FVA-related literature reflects this by also taking funding costs as an input, usually constant, and always risk-neutral. However, this funding curve is the output from a Treasury point of view. Treasury must consider Regulatory-required liquidity buffers, and both risk-neutral (Q) and physical measures (P). We describe the Treasury funding problem and optimize against both measures, using the Regulatory requirement as a constraint. We develop theoretically optimal strategies for Q and P, then demonstrate a combined approach in four markets (USD, JPY, EUR, GBP). Since we deal with physical measures we develop appropriate statistical tests, and demonstrate highly significant (p<0.00001), out-of-sample, improvements on hedged funding with a combined approach achieving 44% to 71% of a perfect information criterion. Thus regulatory liquidity requirements change both the funding problem and funding costs.
ch_abstract: 资金对交易部门而言是一种成本，他们将其视为投入。当前与融资估值调整（FVA）相关的文献也反映了这一点，通常将融资成本作为恒定且风险中性的输入参数。然而，从资金部门的角度看，这条融资曲线实则是输出结果。资金部门必须考虑监管要求的流动性缓冲，并兼顾风险中性（Q）和实际概率（P）两种测度。我们阐述了资金配置问题，以监管要求为约束条件对两种测度进行优化，分别提出了针对Q和P的理论最优策略，随后在美元、日元、欧元、英镑四大市场展示了综合应用方案。由于涉及实际概率测度，我们开发了相应的统计检验方法，实证表明采用综合策略能显著提升对冲融资效果（p<0.00001），样本外测试达到完美信息准则的44%至71%。由此可见，监管流动性要求既改变了融资问题的性质，也影响了融资成本。
tags: FVA, funding, Treasury, optimization, measures, regulations, out-of-sample

title: Violence Against Women and ProtectiveMeasures: With Special Reference toRegulatoryFramework in India
abstract: The study of “Violence Against Women and Protective Measures – With Special Reference to Regulatory Framework in India” has discussed the ancient to contemporary status of Indian women community. And also analyzed the problems related to violence against women in India. With the comparison of IPC crime, against society and women it has revealed that during last 20 year, significantly crime against women increased by 4.3 to 17.4. Increased crime rate against women raises the question to National and International Instruments which are working for elimination the problem related to of violence against women. Rate of crime against women prompts us  to analyze and verify the status of violence against women and regulatory protective measures in India. Scholar also tried to find the steps taken by United Nation Organization and Government of India to protect and empower the women community. Analysis of crime data and regulatory framework proves the necessity of separate women law code and establishment of special women courts in India.
ch_abstract: 《针对妇女的暴力行为及保护措施——以印度监管框架为特别参考》的研究探讨了印度女性群体从古至今的地位，并分析了印度国内与针对妇女暴力相关的问题。通过比较《印度刑法典》中针对社会和妇女的犯罪数据，研究发现过去20年间针对妇女的犯罪率从4.3显著上升至17.4。针对妇女犯罪率的攀升，对致力于消除此类暴力的国内及国际法律文书提出了质疑。这一犯罪趋势促使我们必须审视印度针对妇女暴力的现状及监管保护措施的有效性。研究者还试图梳理联合国组织与印度政府为保护及赋权女性群体所采取的措施。通过对犯罪数据与监管框架的分析，证实了印度有必要制定独立的女性法典并设立专门的妇女法庭。
tags: Women, Violence against Women, Crime against Women, Law, Regulatory Framework, Nation, United Nation Organization,IPC.

title: RegulatoryQuality Index: Methodology and Implementation Guide for European Countries
abstract: Regulatory policy is an explicit policy for a dynamic, continuous and consistent “whole of government” approach to pursue regulatory quality. Experience confirms that an effective regulatory policy needs to be made up of three components which are mutually reinforcing: policies, tools and institutions. Regulatory policy is not only about specific regulations for a sector, but about the process by which regulations are drafted, updated, implemented and enforced, set in a broader context of public policy objectives. The evaluation of policy therefore includes not only the social and economic impact of regulations, but the links between regulatory processes or systems on the one hand, and those outcomes on the other. Regulatory Quality Index offers a quantitative approach to measure the quality of primary laws and subordinate legislation in European regulatory frameworks. The Index is composed by the best practices on better regulation as they derive from the guidelines of international and European Institutions, as well as by the academic framework of regulation. It is a toolkit to identify the main weaknesses of a regulatory environment and an indicator for comparative analysis across different countries.
ch_abstract: 监管政策是一项明确的政策，旨在通过动态、持续且一致的"全政府"方法追求监管质量。经验证实，有效的监管政策需要由相互强化的三个组成部分构成：政策、工具和机构。监管政策不仅涉及针对特定行业的法规，还涉及法规在更广泛的公共政策目标背景下起草、更新、实施和执行的过程。因此，政策评估不仅包括法规的社会和经济影响，还包括监管流程或系统与这些结果之间的联系。监管质量指数提供了一种量化方法，用于衡量欧洲监管框架中主要法律和次级立法的质量。该指数由来自国际和欧洲机构指南的最佳监管实践以及学术监管框架构成。它是一个识别监管环境主要弱点的工具包，也是进行跨国比较分析的指标。
tags: Regulatory policy, regulation, legislation, index, quality of regulation

title: Regulation as Punishment
abstract: Theorists of criminal law widely agree that state punishment involves harsh treatment and stigma and that states must therefore provide protections for targeted individuals. But certain regulatory measures can also be used to impose harsh treatment and stigma. This paper addresses the stigmatic impact of harsh regulatory measures. It argues that harsh regulatory measures that label targeted individuals as risky impose a stigma that has the potential to significantly affect these individual’s personal and professional relationships. Such measures include area restrictions applied to alleged terrorists and registration requirements for convicted sex offenders. I recommend ways of implementing legal safeguards for targeted individuals against the stigma involved in the employment of such measures.
ch_abstract: 刑法理论学者普遍认为，国家刑罚包含严厉对待与污名化，因此国家必须为受针对个体提供保护。但某些监管措施同样可能被用于施加严厉对待与污名。本文探讨严厉监管措施的污名化影响，指出那些将被针对个体标记为"高风险"的严厉监管措施会施加一种污名，这种污名可能严重影响这些个体的个人与职业关系。此类措施包括对涉恐人员的活动区域限制，以及对已定罪性犯罪者的登记要求。针对这些措施运用过程中涉及的污名问题，笔者提出了为受针对个体实施法律保障的建议方案。
tags: punishment, regulatory measures, anti-terrorism measures, sex offender registration, sex offender notification

title: WhatRegulatoryPolicies Work for Emerging Markets?
abstract: This paper discusses the banking regulatory and supervisory practices in People's Republic of China (PRC) with reference to the international standard for banking supervision, namely, the Basel Core Principles for Effective Banking Supervision (BCPs). While the PRC has incorporated many sound practices advocated by the BCPs, there are quite a few areas where significant differences can be observed with respect to qualification review of senior management, broader regulation at the product level, prescriptive rules, and guidance for risk management. Broadly speaking, the PRC adopts a rules-based approach to regulation; in many cases, regulations are prescriptive or even intrusive. In building a robust supervisory system, the PRC finds specific guidance more helpful than sole reliance on principles-based approaches. The paper argues that general principles and a principle-based approach to regulation do not seem to work well for emerging markets. Indeed, the current financial crisis has revealed some shortcomings in the existing international standards on banking supervision. Perhaps this standard can be improved by greater specificity and by incorporating more aspects of the experiences in emerging markets.
ch_abstract: 本文以银行业监管国际标准——《有效银行监管核心原则》（BCPs）为参照，探讨中华人民共和国（中国）的银行监管实践。中国虽已采纳该核心原则倡导的诸多良好做法，但在高管任职资格审查、产品层面更广泛的监管、规范性规则及风险管理指引等方面仍存在显著差异。总体而言，中国采用以规则为基础的监管方式，其监管规定往往具有强制性甚至干预性特征。在构建稳健监管体系过程中，中国发现具体指引比单纯依赖原则导向的监管更为有效。本文认为，通用性原则和原则导向的监管模式对新兴市场国家效果欠佳。当前金融危机已暴露出现行银行监管国际标准的若干缺陷。或许可通过增强规则具体性、吸纳更多新兴市场经验来完善这一标准。
tags: banking regulatory supervisory practices PRC, international standard banking supervision, basel core banking supervision, BCPs

title: A Comprehensive Composite Analysis ofRegulatoryGovernance and Substance in the Power Sector for Enhanced Performance: A Case Study of a Developing Country
abstract: This study examines the complex relationship between the attributes of regulatory dimensions (i.e. regulatory governance-RG, regulatory substance-RS), and outcomes of the electric power sector of Pakistan. This research emphasizes that although regulatory attributes play a significant role, sector outcomes are also influenced by broader economic, geopolitical, and market dynamics beyond regulatory control. The analysis reveals that certain aspects of RG and RS have negligible impact on sector outcomes, highlighting the importance of understanding and addressing external factors such as circular debt, cross-subsidization practices, exchange rate inflation, and geopolitical shifts that significantly affect the sector's performance. This indicates the complexity of regulatory challenges in Pakistan. Despite efforts by the National Electric Power Regulatory Authority (NEPRA) to improve regulatory frameworks and address stakeholder concerns, disparities persist between perceived regulatory effectiveness and tangible outcomes. The study suggests that the regulatory reforms must be accompanied by measures to mitigate political interference, enhance transparency, and align regulatory practices with industry needs. The study is in accordance with UN sustainable development goals SDGs 7, 9 and 11 i.e. access to electricity, industry innovation and sustainable communities, respectively.
ch_abstract: 本研究探讨了监管维度属性（即监管治理-RG、监管实质-RS）与巴基斯坦电力行业绩效之间的复杂关系。研究强调，尽管监管属性具有重要作用，但行业绩效还受到监管范围之外更广泛的经济、地缘政治和市场动态的影响。分析表明，RG和RS的某些方面对行业绩效影响甚微，这凸显了理解和应对外部因素（如循环债务、交叉补贴做法、汇率通胀和地缘政治变化）的重要性，这些因素显著影响行业表现。这表明巴基斯坦监管挑战的复杂性。尽管国家电力监管局（NEPRA）努力完善监管框架并解决利益相关者关切，但感知的监管有效性与实际成果之间仍存在差距。研究建议监管改革必须辅以措施，以减少政治干预、提高透明度，并使监管实践与行业需求保持一致。该研究符合联合国可持续发展目标SDG 7、9和11，即分别涉及电力可及性、产业创新和可持续社区。
tags: Jarvis and Sovacool, linear regression, Power sector, Regulatory Substance

title: MeasuringRegulatoryComplexity
abstract: We propose a framework to study regulatory complexity, based on concepts from computer science. We distinguish dierent dimensions of complexity, classify existing measures, develop new ones, compute them on three examples—Basel I, the Dodd-Frank Act, and the European Banking Authority's reporting rules—and test them using experiments and a survey on compliance costs. We highlight two measures that capture complexity beyond the length of a regulation. We propose a quantitative approach to the policy trade-o between regulatory complexity and precision.
ch_abstract: 我们提出一个基于计算机科学概念的框架来研究监管复杂性。我们区分了复杂性的不同维度，对现有衡量方法进行分类并开发新的方法，在三个实例——巴塞尔协议I、多德-弗兰克法案和欧洲银行业管理局报告规则——上进行计算，并通过实验和合规成本调查进行验证。我们重点介绍了两种能捕捉超越法规长度的复杂性衡量指标。针对监管复杂性与精确性之间的政策权衡，我们提出了一种定量分析方法。
tags: Financial Regulation, Regulatory Complexity, Basel Accords

title: RegulatoryReform in Japan
abstract: Japanese governments have been actively engaged in regulatory reform since the Koizumi Cabinet in the early 2000s. They held a common expectation that the regulatory reform, as a key element of structural reform, would enhance the corporate sector’s investment and infuse more competitive factors into their rigid market structure, and by doing so enable them to escape from the long-lasting economic recession. In a similar vein, the Abe Cabinet announced the promotion of regulatory reform as part of its growth strategy, in June 2013. This research, to begin with, examines the theoretical background and significance of the mitigation of social regulations conducted by the Koizumi Cabinet in the early and mid-2000s, and address why the Abe Cabinet's growth strategy stresses the mitigation of social regulations and launched regional- and firm-level regulatory reform alongside conventional measures. Based on this framework, we follow up on the progress made in these three types of regulatory reform, to evaluate the Abenomic’s growth strategy.
ch_abstract: 自2000年代初小泉内阁以来，日本政府一直积极推进规制改革。各方普遍期待这项作为结构改革核心的举措能刺激企业投资，为僵化的市场结构注入更多竞争要素，从而帮助日本摆脱长期经济衰退。安倍内阁也延续这一思路，于2013年6月将推进规制改革纳入经济增长战略。本研究首先梳理2000年代初中期小泉内阁放松社会性规制的理论背景与意义，进而探讨安倍经济增长战略为何着重强调放松社会性规制，并在传统改革措施之外同步推进地区层面与企业层面的规制改革。基于此分析框架，我们追踪这三类规制改革的实施进展，以此评估"安倍经济学"增长战略的实际成效。
tags: Abenomics, Regulatory Reform

title: Judicial Review ofRegulatoryImpact Analysis: Why Not the Best?
abstract: Regulatory agencies often produce mediocre economic analysis to inform their decisions about major regulations. For this reason, Congress is considering proposals that would require regulatory agencies to conduct regulatory impact analysis and subject it to judicial review. For judicial review to work, judges must be able to verify agency compliance with quality standards even if they are not experts in the subject matter the agencies deal with. This article demonstrates that courts could effectively review the quality of agencies’ regulatory impact analysis if they were given more concrete statutory guidance on what a regulatory impact analysis must include and the stringency with which a court will review that analysis. We propose a regulatory reform that would accomplish this goal: amend the Administrative Procedure Act to specify the main elements a regulatory impact analysis must include and clarify the standard of review by implementing a requirement that agencies use the best available evidence in their analysis.
ch_abstract: 监管机构在制定重大法规时，常以平庸的经济分析作为决策依据。为此，国会正审议相关提案，要求监管机构开展监管影响分析并接受司法审查。要使司法审查发挥作用，法官必须能够核实监管机构是否遵守质量标准，即便他们并非该机构所涉领域的专家。本文论证表明：若法律能更具体地规定监管影响分析必须包含的内容要素，并明确法院审查分析的严格标准，法庭就能有效评估监管机构分析报告的质量。我们提出一项可实现此目标的监管改革方案：修订《行政程序法》，明确规定监管影响分析的核心要素，并通过要求机构在分析中使用最佳可得证据来明确审查标准。
tags: regulatory impact analysis, judicial review, administrative procedure act, benefit-cost analysis, economic analysis

title: Preventing aRegulatoryTrain Wreck: Mandated Regulation and the Cautionary Tale of Positive Train Control
abstract: When Congress passes legislation that mandates prescriptive regulations, legislators are under no obligation to understand the problem they are trying to solve, assess alternative solutions, or understand the benefits and costs of their choices. Passage of the positive train control mandate in response to several high-profile train accidents amply illustrates how haphazardly the legislative branch can authorize regulations. Congressional hearings and committee reports on the Rail Safety Improvement Act of 2008 contain no analysis of the causes and extent of the safety problem, alternative solutions, and the benefits and costs of alternatives to this $12.5 billion mandate. Given that major regulations are often required by statute, the time has come for Congress to subject regulatory legislation to the same kind of analysis that presidents have required regulatory agencies to conduct for more than three decades.
ch_abstract: 当国会通过立法强制规定具体法规时，立法者没有义务去理解他们试图解决的问题，评估替代方案，或了解他们选择的利弊。针对几起引人注目的火车事故而通过的列车主动控制强制令，充分说明了立法机构在授权法规时可能有多么随意。关于2008年《铁路安全改进法案》的国会听证会和委员会报告，没有对安全问题的原因和程度、替代方案以及这项125亿美元强制令的替代方案的利弊进行分析。鉴于重大法规通常由法令规定，国会是时候对监管立法进行与总统三十多年来要求监管机构进行的相同分析了。
tags: regulation, regulatory impact analysis, regulatory analysis, benefit-cost analysis, cost-benefit analysis, positive train control, railroad, administrative law

title: An Inquiry into the Nature, Causes and Impacts of Contraband Cigarettes
abstract: The US Food and Drug Administration (FDA) is contemplating a ban on menthol-flavored cigarettes. Prior to reaching a preliminary decision, the agency and their independent science advisory panel are required to consider the “countervailing” effects a ban would have on smokers and non-smokers, including the creation of significant demand for contraband cigarettes. This monograph addresses the potential negative effects of a menthol ban by analyzing three facets of the contraband cigarette issue: 1) the nature of contraband cigarettes including consideration of how they may materially differ from legal products, such as by containing higher levels of heavy metals and other contaminants; 2) factors influencing the size of the contraband market and an estimation of how it would respond to a menthol ban; and 3) a discussion of the impacts of contraband cigarettes on society.  Academic literature, findings by US government and foreign government agencies, and accounts from major media publications serve as the databases for the analyses. The monograph concludes that a ban on menthol-flavored cigarettes would significantly inflate the market for contraband cigarettes, many of which present even higher health risks than legally-made products. The increased health hazards from illicit cigarettes disproportionately impact underage and African American smokers.
ch_abstract: 美国食品药品监督管理局（FDA）正考虑禁止薄荷味香烟。在做出初步决定前，该机构及其独立科学顾问小组必须评估禁令对吸烟者和非吸烟者可能产生的"抵消"效应，包括催生庞大的违禁香烟需求。本专题报告通过分析违禁香烟问题的三个层面，探讨薄荷禁令的潜在负面影响：1）违禁香烟的本质特征，包括其与合法产品可能存在的实质性差异（如重金属等污染物含量更高）；2）影响违禁市场规模的因素及对薄荷禁令可能作出的反应预测；3）违禁香烟对社会影响的讨论。分析基于学术文献、美国政府及外国政府机构的研究成果、主流媒体报道等资料。报告结论指出，薄荷味香烟禁令将大幅刺激违禁香烟市场，其中许多产品比合法产品的健康风险更高。违禁香烟增加的健康危害对未成年和非裔美国吸烟者造成尤为严重的影响。
tags: tobacco, cigarettes, illicit, contraband, counterfeit, smuggled, organized crime, FDA. regulation, regulatory policies

title: Empirical Study: ProvisionalMeasuresin Investor-State Arbitration
abstract: This first comprehensive empirical study on provisional measures in investment treaty arbitration examines more than a hundred decisions and orders rendered by ICSID, UNCITRAL and other investor-state tribunals. It offers an insight into how international tribunals treat applications for provisional measures.Over the past 20 years, we have seen a dramatic increase in the number of investor-state disputes and in the number of applications for provisional measures. The study builds on a detailed examination of the entire universe of publicly available decisions and orders on provisional measures (114 in total).Acknowledging that many such decisions remain unpublished, it aims at providing insights for a better understanding of the evolving jurisprudence based on the published decisions of tribunals. It demonstrates the trends and practices on key issues such as criteria used by tribunals to grant provisional measures and their understanding of such criteria, success rate by applicable arbitration rules and measures requested as well as the cases most frequently relied upon by international tribunals.The study analyzes the applicable law in decisions on provisional measures, the parties making provisional measures requests, applicable arbitration rules, the types of provisional measures, the requirements for the granting of provisional measures, as well as the effect of provisional measures.
ch_abstract: 这项关于投资条约仲裁中临时措施的首个全面实证研究，审查了ICSID、UNCITRAL及其他投资者-国家仲裁庭作出的一百多项裁决和命令。它深入剖析了国际仲裁庭如何处理临时措施申请。过去20年间，投资者-国家争端数量及临时措施申请数量均呈现急剧增长。本研究基于对全部公开的临时措施决定和命令（共计114份）的细致考察。鉴于许多此类决定仍未公开，研究旨在通过已公布的仲裁庭裁决，为理解不断发展的判例法提供洞见。研究揭示了关键问题的趋势与实践，包括仲裁庭授予临时措施的标准及其理解、不同仲裁规则和申请措施的成功率，以及国际仲裁庭最常援引的案例。研究分析了临时措施决定中的适用法律、提出临时措施请求的当事方、适用仲裁规则、临时措施类型、授予临时措施的要求，以及临时措施的效力。
tags: ICSID, ISDS, UNCITRAL, Investment arbitration, interim measures, interim relief, interim protection

title: Next-GenerationRegulatoryOperations: Trends in AI, Data, and Automation
abstract: AI-enabled technologies enable automation of the routine tasks, enhance fraud detection, and also support predictive decision making in the regulatory frameworks. Studies in JPMorgan Chase, HSBC, and Pfizer show that AI can simplify and improve the compliance processes, verify facts and eliminate manual errors. Although it has its perks, there are also obstacles in implementing AI as ethical concerns, data safety hasards, and complicated integration. These challenges need the support from strong governance frameworks, standardisation and regulators' technology firms working together to overcome these challenges. By exploiting the strategic role of AI in regulatory transformation, this study also provides recommendations for its adoption, so that it results in revising, reinvigorating and improving compliance mechanisms transparently and efficiently.
ch_abstract: 人工智能技术能够实现常规任务的自动化，增强欺诈检测能力，并在监管框架中支持预测性决策。摩根大通、汇丰银行和辉瑞公司的研究表明，人工智能可以简化和改进合规流程，验证事实并消除人为错误。尽管有其优势，但在实施人工智能时也存在障碍，如伦理问题、数据安全隐患和复杂的系统集成。这些挑战需要强有力的治理框架、标准化以及监管机构与科技公司合作来共同克服。通过发挥人工智能在监管转型中的战略作用，本研究还提出了采用建议，以期透明高效地修订、振兴和完善合规机制。
tags: AI, automation, regulatory operations, compliance, risk management, fraud detection, governance, data privacy, regulatory technology, transparency

title: RegulatorySandboxes and Innovation-friendly Regulation : Between Collaboration and Capture
abstract: Regulatory sandboxes, controlled regulatory environments for the testing of novel products or processes, have garnered an increasing amount of attention over the last decade. More recently, regulatory sandboxes have been presented as innovation-friendly instruments. This article contends that fostering responsible innovation through regulatory sandboxes presents significant challenges. First, there is no consensus on what the advancement of innovation entails, how to achieve it, and what the role of regulations and regulatory sandboxes should be in it. Second, there is a lack of clarity regarding the definition and functioning of regulatory sandboxes. Third, there is a risk of regulatory capture due to the close collaboration between regulators and regulatees.Drawing on Italy’s initial experiences with general and sector-specific regulatory sandboxes and existing scholarship on experimental regulatory instruments, this article contributes to the ongoing debate on regulation and innovation by critically examining the interplay between regulatory sandboxes and the promotion of responsible innovation. Furthermore, it explores the impact of regulatory sandboxes on the evolving collaborative dimensions of public law and provides policymakers and regulators with actionable insights for navigating this innovative regulatory tool.
ch_abstract: 监管沙盒作为一种用于测试新产品或流程的受控监管环境，在过去十年间受到越来越多的关注。近年来，监管沙盒更被视为有利于创新的工具。本文认为，通过监管沙盒促进负责任创新存在重大挑战：首先，关于创新推进的内涵、实现路径以及法规与监管沙盒应发挥的作用尚未形成共识；其次，监管沙盒的定义和运作机制缺乏明确界定；第三，监管者与被监管者间的密切合作可能导致监管俘获风险。本文借鉴意大利在通用及行业特定监管沙盒的初步实践，结合现有关于实验性监管工具的研究成果，通过批判性分析监管沙盒与推动负责任创新之间的互动关系，为当前关于监管与创新的讨论提供新视角。此外，研究还探讨了监管沙盒对公法协作维度演变的影响，并为政策制定者和监管者驾驭这一创新监管工具提供了可操作的见解。
tags: regulatory sandboxes; innovation; responsible innovation; experimental regulation; regulatory collaboration; regulatory capture; flexible regulation; AI Act; technological change

title: Empirical Study: ProvisionalMeasuresin Investor-State Arbitration
abstract: This comprehensive empirical study on provisional measures in investment treaty arbitration builds on the success of the 2019 report on provisional measures (“the 2019 Report”), which has now been extensively cited in academic literature, and decisions of arbitral tribunals and parties’ submissions on provisional measures.This study consists of three parts, summarising key new developments that have occurred since the 2019 Report, exploring procedural efficiency in the resolution of requests for provisional measures, and updating the 2019 Report’s findings in accordance with the newly available cases. New decisions and ICSID reform: The past three years have seen not only the most significant revision of the ICSID and ICSID Additional Facility (ICSID AF) arbitration rules in their history, but also a significant increase in the number of publicly available decisions on provisional measures.This study conducts a detailed examination of 160 decisions on provisional measures and how these decisions affect and change the trends and practices identified in the 2019 Report. These new decisions provide more clarity on the criteria used by tribunals to grant provisional measures and their understanding of such criteria, success rate by applicable arbitration rules and measures requested, as well as the cases most frequently relied upon by international tribunals. They also deal with some of most crucial issues facing investment arbitration at the moment, including the future of the intra-EU investor-state disputes, and the sanctions against Russia.Procedural efficiency: For the first time, this study explores the procedural efficiency of decisions on provisional measures, including the average number of days it takes for the tribunals to issue their decisions. It also shows how the choice of arbitration rules, the party making a request, and various other procedural factors affect the length of proceedings. It further investigates tribunals’ decisions on costs, and some of the most recent trends, including the increasing use of the “most provisional” decisions on provisional measures by ICSID tribunals, and recent amendments to the ICSID and ICSID Additional Facility Rules.For example, tribunals are more likely to grant provisional measures in cases with a hearing compared to cases without a hearing. On average, tribunals take 112 days to resolve the request for provisional measures, and UNCITRAL and ICSID Additional Facility tribunals are much more likely to do this within 100 days. In comparison, tribunals under the ICSID Rules typically take approximately 124 days to resolve such a request. This timing varies significantly depending on the type of the requested measure, the party making the request, and various procedural factors, such as the use of virtual or in-person hearings, and party-appointed witnesses and experts.Updating findings of the 2019 Report: Compared to the findings of the 2019 Report, respondent states have become increasingly willing to file requests for provisional measures, and much more likely to obtain a positive decision from tribunals. The study found no drastic changes in the types of the provisional measures requested by the parties, or the criteria applied by tribunals, except for an increase in the number of requests for the security for costs, and an increase in importance of the criterion of proportionality.
ch_abstract: 这项关于投资条约仲裁中临时措施的全面实证研究，建立在2019年临时措施报告（"2019年报告"）的成功基础上。原报告已被学术界广泛引用，并频繁出现在仲裁庭裁决和当事人关于临时措施的陈述中。本研究包含三部分内容：总结2019年报告发布后的关键新进展，探讨临时措施请求解决中的程序效率，以及根据新案例更新2019报告的结论。. . ICSID改革与新裁决：过去三年不仅见证了ICSID及ICSID附加便利（ICSID AF）仲裁规则史上最重大的修订，公开的临时措施裁决数量也显著增加。本研究详细分析了160项临时措施裁决，考察这些裁决如何影响并改变2019年报告指出的趋势与实践。新裁决更清晰地展现了仲裁庭授予临时措施的标准及其理解、不同仲裁规则下的成功率、所请求措施类型，以及国际仲裁庭最常援引的案例。这些裁决还涉及当前投资仲裁面临的最关键问题，包括欧盟内部投资者-东道国争端的未来走向，以及对俄罗斯的制裁。. . 程序效率：本研究首次探讨了临时措施裁决的程序效率，包括仲裁庭作出裁决的平均天数。研究还揭示了仲裁规则选择、提出请求的当事人及其他程序性因素如何影响审理时长，并分析了仲裁庭关于费用分配的裁决。研究特别关注了ICSID仲裁庭越来越多采用的"最临时性"裁决新趋势，以及ICSID及其附加便利规则的最新修订。例如，举行听证会的案件比不举行听证会的案件更可能获得临时措施批准。仲裁庭平均需要112天处理临时措施请求，其中UNCITRAL和ICSID附加便利仲裁庭更可能在100天内完成，而ICSID规则下的仲裁庭通常需要约124天。具体时长因请求措施类型、提出请求方身份及听证形式（线上/线下）、当事人指定证人与专家等程序因素存在显著差异。. . 更新2019年报告结论：与2019年报告相比，被申请国提交临时措施请求的意愿明显增强，且更可能获得仲裁庭支持。研究发现当事人请求的临时措施类型及仲裁庭适用标准未发生剧烈变化，但费用担保请求数量有所增加，相称性标准的重要性也显著提升。
tags: ICSID, ISDS, UNCITRAL, Investment Arbitration, Interim Measures, Interim Relief, Interim Protection

title: RegulatoryCoherence and the Mega-Regional Trade Agreements: Lessons from the Trans-Pacific Partnership Agreement
abstract: The Trans-Pacific Partnership includes a chapter on regulatory coherence and measures to reduce trade costs arising from divergent standards. We review the substantive content of the TPP’s measures in light of existing processes in international organizations addressing good regulatory practices, and the track record of mutual recognition as a tool to reduce trade costs, and comment on the extent to which claims made on behalf of the TPP for significant cost reduction in goods trade can be sustained, and the extent to which fears concerning the impact of the TPP measures on democratic choice on regulatory matters are warranted.
ch_abstract: 《跨太平洋伙伴关系协定》包含关于监管一致性的章节，以及旨在减少因标准差异而产生的贸易成本的措施。我们根据国际组织现有关于良好监管实践的流程，以及相互认可作为降低贸易成本工具的实际成效，审查了该协定措施的具体内容，并评估了其宣称能大幅降低货物贸易成本的说法在多大程度上站得住脚，以及对该协定措施可能影响监管事务民主选择的担忧是否合理。
tags: Trans-Pacific Partnership, TPP, regulatory coherence, good regulatory practices, GRP, mutual recognition, MRAs

title: USRegulatoryComplexity, Compliance Spending, and Market Structure
abstract: Regulatory complexity is well-understood as creating additional compliance costs. It has also been associated in some studies with market consolidation. However, few studies have explicitly examined regulatory complexity and its association with greater market consolidation through the mechanism of higher compliance labor costs. This article examines regulatory complexity in several different sectors of the US economy and the associated share of labor in those sectors that is devoted to compliance activities. Next, it explores labor costs as a mechanism linking this regulatory complexity with market dynamics in that sector, such as market consolidation and large firms' share of revenue. Utilizing employment data from the US Census Bureau, this article finds that greater regulatory complexity is associated with a greater share of compliance vocations as a share of overall labor. It also examines the association between compliance share of total labor and market structure in the associated industry, finding that higher compliance spending is associated with industry consolidation. In doing so, this article helps to establish compliance share of labor as a useful alternative to direct measures of regulatory complexity, which are smaller and less frequently updated. It also highlights the importance of regulatory complexity in contributing to market structure dynamics, an important consideration for policymakers.
ch_abstract: 监管复杂性被普遍认为会增加额外的合规成本。一些研究还将其与市场集中化联系起来。然而，很少有研究明确探讨监管复杂性如何通过更高的合规劳动力成本机制导致市场集中化加剧。本文考察了美国经济中多个不同领域的监管复杂性，以及这些领域中从事合规活动的劳动力占比。接着，文章探讨了劳动力成本作为连接监管复杂性与该领域市场动态（如市场集中化和大型企业收入份额）的机制。利用美国人口普查局的就业数据，本文发现更高的监管复杂性与合规职业在总劳动力中占比增加相关。研究还检验了合规劳动力占比与相关行业市场结构之间的关联，发现更高的合规支出与行业集中化相关。通过这一分析，本文确立了合规劳动力占比作为衡量监管复杂性的有效替代指标——相比更新频率低、样本量小的直接测量方式。研究同时揭示了监管复杂性对市场结构动态的重要影响，这为政策制定者提供了关键考量依据。
tags: competition, market structure, regulation, regulatory complexity, regulatory burden, compliance costs

title: Risk Aversion inRegulatoryCapital Principles
abstract: We incorporate a notion of risk aversion favoring prudent decisions from financial institutions into regulatory capital calculation principles. In the context of Basel III, IV as well as Solvency II, regulatory capital calculation is carried out through the tools of monetary risk measures. The notion of risk aversion that we focus on has four equivalent formulations: through consistency with second-order stochastic dominance, or with conditional expectations, or with portfolio diversification, and finally through expected social impact. The class of monetary risk measures representing this notion of risk aversion is referred to as consistent risk measures. We characterize the class of consistent risk measures by establishing an Expected Shortfall-based representation, and as a by-product, we obtain new results on the representation of convex risk measures. We present several examples  where consistent risk measures naturally appear. Using the obtained representation results, we study risk sharing and optimal investment problems and find several new analytical solutions.
ch_abstract: 我们将一种倾向于金融机构审慎决策的风险规避概念纳入了监管资本计算原则。在巴塞尔协议III、IV以及偿付能力II的框架下，监管资本计算通过货币风险度量工具实施。我们关注的风险规避概念具有四种等效表述形式：与二阶随机占优的一致性、与条件期望的一致性、与投资组合分散化的一致性，以及最终通过预期社会影响的一致性。代表这种风险规避概念的货币风险度量类别被称为一致性风险度量。我们通过建立基于预期短缺的表示形式来刻画一致性风险度量的类别，并作为副产品，获得了关于凸风险度量表示的新结果。我们列举了多个一致性风险度量自然出现的实例。利用所获得的表示结果，我们研究了风险分担和最优投资问题，并发现了若干新的解析解。
tags: regulatory capital, risk aversion, risk sharing, stochastic dominance, diversification

title: RegulatoryCompetition and Forbearance: Evidence from the Life Insurance Industry
abstract: Regulatory separation theory indicates that a system with multiple regulators leads to less forbearance and limits producer gains while a model of banking regulation developed by Dell’Ariccia and Marquez (2006) predicts the opposite. Fragmented regulation of the US life insurance industry provides an especially rich environment for testing the effects of regulatory competition. We find positive relations between regulatory competition and profitability measures for this industry, which is consistent with the Dell’Ariccia and Marquez model. Our results have practical implications for the debate over federal versus state regulation of insurance and financial services in the US.
ch_abstract: 监管分离理论指出，多监管机构体系会减少监管宽容并限制生产者收益，而Dell’Ariccia和Marquez（2006）构建的银行监管模型则得出相反结论。美国寿险业的分割监管为检验监管竞争效应提供了绝佳研究场景。本研究发现该行业监管竞争与盈利指标呈正相关关系，这与Dell’Ariccia-Marquez模型一致。研究结论对美国保险及金融服务应采用联邦监管还是州级监管的争论具有现实意义。
tags: Regulatory competition, Regulatory forbearance, Insurance regulation, financial services regulation

title: ProvisionalMeasuresin Spanish Civil Procedure
abstract: Provisional measures face a highly sophisticated regulation in Spanish Civil Procedure. The Civil Procedure Act of 2000 considers thems a sort of "third type" process (the "precautionary process" besides the "declaration process" and the "enforcement process.") The article explores the way this process works in practice and differences embodied in relation to the previous existing system.
ch_abstract: 西班牙民事诉讼法对临时措施有着高度精细的规定。2000年《民事诉讼法》将其视为一种"第三类"程序（即介于"宣告程序"与"执行程序"之外的"预防性程序"）。本文探讨了该程序在实践中的运作方式，以及与原有制度相比所体现的差异。
tags: provisional measures, enforcement, Spain

title: Leveraging Technical Standards within AIRegulatorySandboxes: Challenges and Opportunities
abstract: The AI Act relies on harmonized standards to provide cutting-edge technical solutions for implementing regulatory requirements, streamlining conformity assessment procedures, and offering a presumption of compliance for high-risk AI system providers. This paper examines the multifaceted role of standards within the AI Act, with a particular emphasis on their interaction with regulatory sandboxes. It begins with a comprehensive overview of the standards’ role in the regulation, followed by an in-depth analysis of the synergy between regulatory sandboxes and technical standards. The study then explores the challenges and opportunities arising from the use of harmonized standards within the sandbox environment. Finally, it presents targeted recommendations for competent authorities, European standardization organizations (ESOs), and AI providers to maximize the potential of standards in regulatory sandbox environments. This research contributes to the ongoing discourse on effective AI governance and the practical implementation of the AI Act.
ch_abstract: 《人工智能法案》依托统一标准，为监管要求的实施提供前沿技术解决方案，简化合格评定程序，并为高风险人工智能系统提供商赋予合规推定。本文探讨了标准在该法案中的多重作用，尤其聚焦其与监管沙箱的互动关系。研究首先全面概述标准在监管中的职能，继而深入分析监管沙箱与技术标准间的协同效应，随后剖析沙箱环境中采用统一标准所面临的挑战与机遇。最后，研究向主管部门、欧洲标准化组织（ESOs）及人工智能供应商提出针对性建议，以充分释放监管沙箱环境中标准的潜力。本研究成果为人工智能有效治理及《人工智能法案》的实际落地提供了学术参考。
tags: AI Act, Sandbox, Regulatory Sandbox, Technical Standards, Harmonised Standards

title: The Italian Model to Fight COVID-19: Regional Coordination,RegulatoryInflation and the Cost of One-Size-Fits-All LockdownMeasures
abstract: What has come to be known worldwide as the Italian model to fight COVID-19 was a series of governmental measures undertaken in early 2020 to reduce the contagion of a deadly virus ravaging the northern regions of Italy—especially Lombardy, Veneto, and Piedmont. These measures included quarantine or lockdown throughout the Italian territory, together with the revamping of hospitals, followed by economic recovery packages to address the standstill of the national economy. This Article focuses on the strengths and weaknesses of the Italian model. By highlighting the initial missteps, we can understand how this turned into a productive national and regional coordination model through a learning-by-monitoring process. However, the Italian model was implemented at a high cost, due to the overextension of executive action and the lack of territorial differentiation. After the President of the Italian Republic suggested stronger parliamentary involvement in the executive lockdown measures, the legislative branch began to give full legal force to the governmental provisional regulations. Rather than tailoring the regulatory measures according to the impacted regions, the government imposed a long and widespread lockdown throughout the country by means of an overregulation and bureaucratization of social life, which produced high human and economic costs for the country. In hindsight, the Italian government did not narrowly tailor the lockdown measures or lift them in those regions with limited infections. As a result, this widespread and micromanaged governmental action has created new and effective administrative processes of regional–national cooperation in public health, but it has also triggered distrust toward the way in which public authorities managed the pandemic during the different phases of the COVID-19 pandemic.
ch_abstract: 全球所熟知的意大利抗疫模式，是2020年初该国政府为遏制肆虐北部地区——尤其是伦巴第、威尼托和皮埃蒙特——的致命病毒传播而采取的一系列措施。这些举措包括在全国范围内实施隔离封锁、升级医疗设施，随后推出经济复苏计划以应对国家经济停滞。本文重点探讨该模式的优劣。通过分析初期失误，我们可以理解其如何通过监测学习机制演变为高效的国家与地区协调体系。然而该模式实施代价高昂，源于行政权力的过度扩张及缺乏地域差异化措施。在意大利总统建议加强议会对封锁措施的监督后，立法机构开始为政府临时规章赋予完整法律效力。政府未根据疫情严重程度实施精准管控，反而通过过度监管和社会生活官僚化，在全国实施长期全面封锁，导致国家承受巨大的人力和经济损失。事后看来，政府既未精准制定封锁措施，也未及时解除低风险地区限制。这种全面微观管理模式虽催生了新型有效的央地公共卫生协作机制，但也引发了公众对疫情各阶段政府管控方式的不信任。
tags: COVID-19, lockdown measures, pandemic, Italian law, administrative law

title: RepeatedMeasuresCorrelation
abstract: Repeated measures correlation (rmcorr) is a statistical technique for determining the common within-individual association for paired measures assessed on two or more occasions for multiple individuals. Simple regression/correlation is often applied to non-independent observations or aggregated data; this may produce biased, specious results due to violation of independence and/or differing patterns between-participants versus within-participants. Unlike simple regression/correlation, rmcorr does not violate the assumption of independence of observations. Also, rmcorr tends to have much greater statistical power because neither averaging nor aggregation is necessary for an intra-individual research question. Rmcorr estimates the common regression slope, the association shared among individuals. To make rmcorr accessible, we provide background information for its assumptions and equations, visualization, power, and tradeoffs with rmcorr compared to multilevel modeling. We introduce the R package (rmcorr) and demonstrate its use for inferential statistics and visualization with two example datasets. The examples are used to illustrate research questions at different levels of analysis, intra-individual and inter-individual. Rmcorr is well-suited for research questions regarding the common linear association in paired repeated measures data. All results are fully reproducible.
ch_abstract: 重复测量相关（rmcorr）是一种统计技术，用于确定多个个体在两个或更多时间点上评估的配对测量之间的共同个体内关联。简单回归/相关通常应用于非独立观测或聚合数据，由于违反独立性假设和/或参与者间与参与者内模式差异，可能导致有偏差的虚假结果。与简单回归/相关不同，rmcorr不会违反观测独立性的假设。此外，rmcorr通常具有更高的统计功效，因为针对个体内研究问题既不需要平均也不需要聚合数据。Rmcorr估计的是个体间共享的共同回归斜率关联。. . 为了让rmcorr更易于使用，我们提供了关于其假设条件、公式、可视化、统计功效以及与多层级建模比较的权衡背景信息。我们介绍了R包（rmcorr），并通过两个示例数据集演示其在推断统计和可视化中的应用。这些示例用于说明个体内和个体间不同分析层次的研究问题。Rmcorr非常适合研究配对重复测量数据中共同线性关联的问题。所有结果均可完全复现。
tags: correlation, regression, repeated measures, power, individual differences

title: Lawyers as Lobbyists:RegulatoryAdvocacy in American Finance
abstract: Administrative agencies have undertaken an increasingly substantial role in policymaking. Yet the influence-seeking that targets these agencies remains poorly understood. Reporting exceptions under the Lobbying Disclosure Act allow many of the most powerful advocates to characterize their activity as lawyering, not lobbying, and thereby fly under the radar. Using agency-generated records on lobbying activity, financial reporting, and personnel databases specific to lawyers, as well as LinkedIn, we describe a vast subterranean world of regulatory influence-seeking that the social-science literature has (mostly) ignored. Regulatory lobbying is systematically different from legislative lobbying. It involves different kinds of people and different lobbying firms that bring specific forms of expertise and distinct networks. Our key findings about how regulatory lobbying differs include the following: (1) the regulatory lobbying sector is highly segregated from the reported lobbying sector, with many regulatory advocates failing to consistently register or report earnings commensurate with their activity level, (2) the number of unregistered regulatory advocates working on the implementation of the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform Act plausibly exceeds 150% of the registered lobbyists working on that law, (3) the most effective regulatory lobbyists and law firms involved with regulatory lobbying have incomes that dramatically outpace leading reported lobbying firms (which are also mostly law firms), and (4) back-of-the-envelope calculations and more sophisticated decomposition regressions imply that aggregate expenditure on lawyer-lobbying is several multiples of reported lobbying spending. We introduce the case of a particular lawyer-lobbyist and provide a theoretical discussion to situate and contextualize these findings. Collectively, this work opens a window into neglected domains of politics and reveals an important and understudied form of political inequality.
ch_abstract: 行政机构在政策制定中扮演着日益重要的角色。然而，针对这些机构施加影响的行为仍鲜为人知。《游说披露法》中的报告例外条款使许多最具影响力的倡导者得以将其活动定性为法律事务而非游说，从而规避监管。通过整合机构生成的游说活动记录、财务报告、律师专属人事数据库及领英数据，我们揭示了一个社会科学文献（大多）忽视的巨大地下监管影响网络。监管游说与立法游说存在系统性差异：前者涉及不同类型的人员和游说公司，这些主体具备特定领域的专业知识与独特人脉网络。关于监管游说的关键发现包括：（1）监管游说领域与已申报游说领域高度割裂，许多监管倡导者既未持续登记，也未申报与其活动规模匹配的收入；（2）参与《多德-弗兰克华尔街改革法案》实施工作的未登记监管倡导者数量，很可能超过该法已登记游说者数量的150%；（3）最有效的监管游说者及参与监管游说的律所，其收入远超领先的已申报游说公司（其中多数同为律所）；（4）粗略估算与更精细的分解回归分析表明，律师-游说者的总支出是已申报游说支出的数倍。我们通过具体律师-游说者案例进行实证分析，并辅以理论探讨来阐释这些发现。整体而言，本研究打开了被忽视的政治领域窗口，揭示了一种重要却研究不足的政治不平等形态。
tags: Lawyers, Lobbyists, Regulatory Advocacy, Financial regulation, Dodd-Frank, Influence-seeking

title: Systems Thinking andRegulatoryGovernance: A Review of the International Academic Literature
abstract: This research paper presents findings from a broad scoping of the international academic literature on the use of systems thinking and systems science in regulatory governance and practice. It builds on a systematic review of peer-reviewed articles published in the top 15 journals for regulatory scholarship. The aim of the research paper is to introduce those working in a regulatory environment to the key concepts of systems thinking and systems science, and to discuss the state of the art of regulatory knowledge on these topics.It addresses five themes:(1) the evolution of systems thinking,(2) examples of systems thinking from the academic literature,(3) evidence of how systems thinking helps improving regulatory governance, and(4) the epistemic challenges and(5) ethical challenges that come with applying systems thinking to regulatory governance and practice.
ch_abstract: 本研究论文对国际学术文献中关于系统思维和系统科学在监管治理与实践中的应用进行了广泛范围的研究。论文基于对监管领域排名前15的期刊中发表的同行评议文章的系统性综述。研究论文旨在向监管环境中的工作者介绍系统思维和系统科学的核心概念，并探讨这些主题在监管知识中的最新进展。论文围绕五个主题展开：(1)系统思维的演变，(2)学术文献中系统思维的实例，(3)系统思维如何助力改善监管治理的证据，(4)应用系统思维于监管治理与实践时面临的认知挑战，以及(5)伴随而来的伦理挑战。
tags: Systems Thinking, Systems Science, Systems Theory, Regulation, Regulatory Governance

title: RegulatoryState with Dirigiste Characteristics: Variegated Pathways ofRegulatoryGovernance
abstract: The strength of the introductory chapter by Morgan and Dubash is in their clarion call to understand the specificities of the regulatory state in the global south. They ask us to give serious consideration to the notion that the regulatory state in the global south confronts issues, problems, and pathways of development which are different from those apparent in the highly Euro-centric literature on the regulatory state where it is portrayed almost as a triumph of a European mode of governance. From this point of view, this chapter and the various case studies represent a much needed corrective to this geographical bias. In fact, it represents more than the addition of the experience of the global south; it presents a much more complex and variegated view of the regulatory states than that suggested by the mainstream analyses. In this paper, I want to build on this insight, but also suggest that case studies in the volume implicitly point to an altogether different methodological understanding the regulatory state through the analysis of the process of regulatory state-building rather than through identifying the exceptional attributes of regulatory governance in the global south. Such a process oriented perspective to regulatory state-building throws into relief the problematic identification of regulatory types forcing us to more rigorously consider the primary set of processes that produce varieties of regulatory states in the global north and south. In this respect, the introductory chapter raised a nagging concern that the references to the global south should not fall into a kind of the modernisation problematic where the emerging regulatory state is seen as a response to a particular set of developmental constraints and patterns of regulatory governance, which are then benchmarked against the modal regulatory state in the global north. A thrust of this brief paper is that we need to get away from such ideal types, and focus more on the process of state and market formation by looking at regulatory governance and politics as an on-going process of state-building within systems of transnational markets and rule making. Of course, in making this criticism, I do not exempt my own work (see for example, Jayasuriya 2005) which tended to obscure the emerging varieties of regulatory state. Taking this tack of analysing the production of variation allows us to sail much more confidently into the murky seas of the relationship between neoliberalism or market-making and the regulatory state. Market-making and state-building projects have gone hand in hand, and for this reason their distinctive patterns in the global north as well as the global south require further analysis. From such a perspective, variations and experimentations of regulatory state structures and institutions are central to the process of market reform – or neoliberalism – in both the global north and south. The introductory chapter and the various case studies by and large stay clear of notions of neoliberalism, or if you prefer, programs of market. Yet, at the root of the development of regulatory forms is the attempt to constitute or enhance programs of marketization. In fact, this is a thread that runs through the various case studies ranging from water services in Columbiato telecommunication regulation in India. And in these chapters we see clearly that market building is at the core of the project of regulatory state-building. These two dimensions are irreparably bound. This is well exemplified – if not highlighted – in many of the case studies where the relationship between the politics of neoliberalism and regulatory state-building remains obscured. Hence what is overlooked in the various case studies is the fact that the processes of market reform – or neoliberalism – do not simply emerge from ‘nowhere’, but are contingent products of specific localised political and economic contexts. If market-making is about state-building, it follows that the nature of this relationship is shaped by the previous patterns of institution building and its privileged elites. In the section below we explore these processes of regulatory state-building and its variegated character by exploring three key areas: first, the embedding of patterns of market reform within previously dominant statist economic regimes that is the path dependence of the regulation; second, the extent to which this path dependence is modified by the transnationalisation of the state through mechanisms of multilevel governance; and finally how this multilevel governance results in a process of juridification of the regulatory state that shapes a distinctive form of politics.
ch_abstract: 摩根和杜巴什所撰导论章节的亮点，在于他们旗帜鲜明地呼吁人们关注全球南方监管型国家的特殊性。他们提请我们认真思考：全球南方监管型国家面临的发展议题、困境与路径，与高度欧洲中心主义的监管型国家文献所呈现的图景截然不同——这类文献几乎将监管型国家描绘为欧洲治理模式的胜利。从这个角度看，本章与各案例研究恰如其分地矫正了这种地理偏见。事实上，它不仅是补充了全球南方的经验，更呈现了比主流分析更为复杂多元的监管型国家图景。本文旨在深化这一洞见，同时指出书中案例研究隐含地指向一种截然不同的方法论认知——应通过分析监管型国家建构的进程，而非识别全球南方监管治理的特殊属性来理解监管型国家。这种以过程为导向的视角，使对监管类型的简单归类显得问题重重，迫使我们更严谨地思考那些造就全球北方与南方不同监管型国家的核心进程。就此而言，导论章节提出了一个亟待解决的忧虑：对全球南方的讨论不应陷入某种现代化问题框架，即把新兴监管型国家视为对特定发展约束和监管治理模式的回应，再以全球北方的标准监管型国家为标杆进行衡量。本文的核心论点是必须摒弃这类理想类型，转而聚焦国家与市场形成的过程，将监管治理与政治视为跨国市场体系和规则制定中持续进行的国家建构。当然，这种批评也包括笔者自身过往研究（如Jayasuriya 2005）——它们曾模糊了监管型国家的多样性。通过分析差异性的生成机制，我们能更从容地探索新自由主义/市场构建与监管型国家关系的混沌领域。市场构建与国家建设项目始终相辅相成，因此无论在全球北方还是南方，它们的独特模式都需要深入剖析。由此观之，监管型国家结构与制度的多样性和实验性，对全球南北方的市场改革（或曰新自由主义）进程都至关重要。导论章节与多数案例研究基本避开了新自由主义或市场化计划的提法。然而监管形式发展的根本动力，正在于建构或强化市场化计划的努力。事实上，从哥伦比亚水务到印度电信监管的各案例中，这一线索贯穿始终。这些章节清晰表明：市场建设是监管型国家建构项目的核心，二者密不可分。许多案例虽未明言却充分证明——新自由主义政治与监管型国家建构的关系始终晦暗不明。因此各案例研究忽略了一个事实：市场改革（或新自由主义）进程并非凭空产生，而是特定地方政治经济情境的产物。若市场构建即国家建设，那么这种关系的本质必然受既有制度建构模式及其特权精英的影响。下文将通过三个关键维度探讨监管型国家建构的进程及其多元性：首先，市场改革模式如何嵌入先前占主导地位的国家主义经济体制（即监管的路径依赖）；其次，这种路径依赖如何通过多层级治理机制被国家的跨国化所修正；最后，这种多层级治理如何导致监管型国家的司法化进程，从而塑造独特的政治形态。
tags: regulatory state, global south, multilevel governance, regulatory law, judicalisation of politics, regulatory politics

title: RegulatoryArbitrage and Bad Loans
abstract: The banks’ forbearance lending to weak firms was one of primary reasons for the prolonged non-performing loan problem in Japan.
